Definitely help karega. Faith is a powerful thing. Aur ayurvedic treatment bhi try kar. Just make sure it's a reputable place. Baaki, weekend pe milte hain? We'll grab some chai and I'll listen to all your bakwaas. Don't worry, sab theek ho jaega.

Haan, pakka milte hain. Chai pe bahut baat karna hai. Thanks again, bhai. You always know what to say. Feeling a little lighter already. Chal, I'll catch you later. Need to go home and check on them. Take care, yaar.
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I'm kinda tight on cash this month, yaar. You know how it is, rent, bills, and then woh weekend ka plan... sab kuch ek saath aa gaya. Koi jugaad bata na, bhai.
Arey tension na le. Hota hai. Dekh, I have some extra saved up. Kitna chahiye tujhe? Aur bata, what exactly happened? Kahin zyada toh nahi kharcha kar diya iss baar?
Nah, zyada nahi. Bas woh new phone ka EMI start ho gaya and then woh dost ki shaadi mein jana pada. Around 5k would help, I think. Agle month pakka return kar dunga, promise. Thanks a lot, bhai!

Chal theek hai, no worries. I can easily spare 5k. But promise karna, next time budget properly plan karega. These unexpected expenses kill us, you know? I'll transfer it right away. Account details de de.
Haan bhai, pakka. Lesson learned. Ab se Excel sheet banaunga, expenses track karne ke liye. You're a lifesaver, seriously. Account details bhej raha hoon. Tu nahi hota toh kya karta main.
Arey yaar, dosti mein kaun hisaab karta hai? Bas yaad rakh, jab mereko zaroorat pade toh tu bhi ready rehna. Now go enjoy your weekend without worrying about money! And treat me to chai next time!
Oye! Diwali aa rahi hai, kya plan hai tera iss baar? Ghar ja rahi hai ya phir yahi party-sharty ka scene hai? Mujhe toh samajh nahi aa raha kya karna hai.

Arre yaar, Diwali toh ghar pe family ke saath hi manane mein mazaa hai. Mummy ke haath ke pakwaan, woh alag hi feeling hai. But iss baar ticket rates itne high hai, soch rahi hu yahi kuch plan kar lu.

Haan, woh toh hai. Train tickets bhi waiting list mein hai. Last time Diwali pe traffic mein phasi thi, teen ghante lage the airport pahuchne mein. Isse accha toh yahi dosto ke saath Diwali party hi kar lete hai.
Exactly! Phir Diwali party hi sahi. Lekin crackers nahi, bhai. Pollution already itna hai. Instead, let's do a potluck with all the Diwali sweets. Gujiya, ladoo, barfi... sab kuch hona chahiye.
Perfect idea! Aur haan, Diwali ke cards bhi banate hai, handmade wale. Remember bachpan mein kaise banate the? Thoda nostalgic bhi ho jayenge, aur pollution bhi nahi hoga. Done deal phir?
Done deal! Diwali cards, potluck, aur dher sari masti. This Diwali will be awesome! Bas, ek kaam kar, tu lights le aana, main decoration ka samaan le aaungi. Happy Diwali in advance!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Socha tujhe call karun. I've been feeling so sluggish lately, yaar. Need to get back in shape, warna Diwali mein pet dikhega toh kya izzat rahegi?

Haan bhai, I feel you! Office life ne toh band baja di hai. I was thinking of joining a gym, but the fees are insane. Maybe we can start jogging together in the park? Early morning thand bhi kam ho gayi hai.
Jogging is a good start, but I need something more intense. Maybe some weight training. What about those online fitness classes? Have you tried any? Sunna hai bohot flexible timings hote hai.

Online classes aren't bad, but I get distracted easily at home. Plus, the internet connection always acts up. Let's try some calisthenics in the park first. Bodyweight exercises are quite effective, and free bhi hai, samajh rahe ho?
Okay, fine. Calisthenics it is. But we need a proper plan. No half-hearted efforts. I'm thinking Monday se pakka. 6 AM sharp. And we'll track our progress. No excuses, bhai!

Deal! Monday 6 AM it is. Aur sun, diet bhi control karni padegi. No more late-night biryani sessions. Ghar ka khana, healthy food, aur lots of water. Challenge accepted! Dekhte hain kaun zyada fit hota hai.
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Itne dino baad dikhi. School days yaad aa rahe the, socha tujhe hi pakadun. Bata, kya chal raha hai life mein?
Arre bhai, main bhi tujhe hi miss kar rahi thi! Life toh bas office-ghar-office mein atki padi hai. School ke woh bunk aur canteen ke samose... kya din the yaar!
Sahi mein! Aur woh maths ka period, jab sir humesha pakadte the. Yaad hai, kaise last bench pe baithke paper plane banate the? Class monitor ki toh band bajti thi.
Haa yaar! Aur woh annual function ki practice, jisme hum dono ne milke dance kiya tha. Itni awkward choreography thi, but phir bhi kitna maza aaya tha! Aaj kal toh bas zoom calls hi hote hai.
Exactly! Woh sab moments irreplaceable hain. Chal, plan banate hain. Old school friends ka ek get-together karte hain. Canteen wali chai toh banti hai boss, kya bolti?
Done deal! Main sabko message karti hoon. Canteen wali chai and gossip session confirmed. Weekend pakka, koi excuses nahi sunungi. Dekhte hain kaun kaun free hai.
Oye, sunn! Shaadi ki taiyariyan kahan tak pahunchi? Itni shopping aur functions, I'm sure you must be exhausted! Batao kya kya final hua, mehndi ka design decide kiya ya nahi?

Arre yaar, kya bataun, exhaustion toh peak pe hai! Mehndi ka design toh almost done, bas final touch dena hai. Shopping bhi chal rahi hai non-stop. Abhi toh bas venue decoration aur caterer final karna hai, that's a big headache.

Venue decoration is a pain, I agree! Have you thought about the theme? Something Bollywood or traditional? Caterer mein, biryani toh must hai, bhai! Aur desserts mein, gulab jamun ya phir something fancy like phirni?

Theme toh traditional hi rakhenge, thoda royal touch dena hai. Biryani toh pakka hai, woh toh sabko chahiye. Desserts mein phirni aur gulab jamun dono hi honge, why choose? Guests toh khush hone chahiye, right?
Absolutely! Guests khush, toh shaadi successful. Aur tumhara outfit? Lehenga final hua? Colour kya hai? I'm dying to know! Aur jewellery? Don't forget the nath, woh toh shaadi ka highlight hota hai.

Lehenga toh final ho gaya, red and gold combination hai. Jewellery bhi done, heavy nath bhi hai, don't worry! Bas ab sab kuch smoothly ho jaaye, that's all I'm praying for. Tum free ho na shaadi ke liye? Help chahiye hogi!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Sunn, I'm on a mission – Jaipur's best coffee. Been trying a few places, but nothing's hitting the spot. You know any good cafes jahan asli wali coffee milegi?

Arre bhai, coffee ki baat kar raha hai? Jaipur mein toh bohot options hai! But 'best' is subjective, hai na? What kind of coffee are you looking for? Strong, milky, fancy wali, ya simple filter coffee type?

Yaar, something strong and authentic. Not those sugary, overly-sweetened things. I'm talking about a place that understands the art of coffee, you know? A place with a good vibe and good beans. Filter coffee bhi chalegi if it's the real deal.

Hmm, tough one. Have you tried 'Anokhi Cafe'? Thoda pricey hai, but the coffee is decent and the ambience is top-notch. Or maybe 'Tapri Central'? They have a nice rooftop and serve some interesting coffee concoctions with a desi twist.

Tapri Central toh crowded rehta hai hamesha! Anokhi is good, but feels more like a brunch place than a serious coffee joint. I heard about a new place called 'Curious Life Coffee Roasters'? Anyone tried that? Seems promising from the Insta pics.

Curious Life? Haan, suna toh hai. I think my cousin went there. Said it's a bit hipster-ish but the coffee is legit. They roast their own beans, I believe. Worth a shot, I'd say. Bataiyo, if you find the ultimate Jaipur coffee spot!
Oye sunn, guess what I just heard about Sharma aunty’s beta? Apparently, he’s been sneaking out every night! I saw him near the market, looking all shifty. Full filmi scene chal raha hai kya?
Arre yaar, what? Sharma aunty ka beta, woh toh padhaku type lagta tha. Maybe he's got a girlfriend? Ya phir, he's secretly training to become a superhero? Bollywood dreams, you know!
Girlfriend toh mujhe nahi pata, but I saw him with someone. Face nahi dikha, but definitely looked like ladki. Sharma aunty toh heart attack se mar jayegi if she finds out. Poor thing!

Haila! Sharma aunty will flip. She always boasts about how seedha-saadha her son is. This is better than any daily soap. I wonder what's the real story. We need to investigate further, like detectives.
Exactly! Operation Sharma Beta is now in motion. We need to gather intel. Maybe we should stake out the market tomorrow night? Chal, chai pe chalte hai, plan banate hai.
Chalo chalo! Chai pe charcha, Sharma beta ke baare mein. This is going to be epic. I'm already picturing the drama. Let's hope it's juicy enough for a full-blown Bollywood movie plot.

Oye, kya chal raha hai? Bachchon ki padhai kaisi chal rahi hai? I'm so done with online classes, yaar. My kid just stares at the screen like it's some alien device. I miss the good old days of actual school.

Haan bhai, same pinch! Mera bhi wohi haal hai. Online classes are a pain. And the amount of homework! It’s like they're preparing them for IIT already. I feel like I’m back in school myself, helping with every assignment.
Exactly! And the constant screen time is worrying me. Aankhein kharab ho jayengi. I try to get him to play outside, but he’s just glued to his phone. What do you do to manage it?

I bribe her with ice cream, what else? Just kidding! Sort of. We have 'no screen' hours in the evening, and I try to involve her in cooking or gardening. It works sometimes, but mostly it's a struggle, I tell you.
Gardening is a good idea! I should try that. But seriously, parenting is like a full-time job with no salary. Kabhi kabhi toh I just want to run away to the Himalayas and become a sanyasi.

Haha, don't we all? But then who will make sure they eat their vegetables and finish their homework? We're stuck in this cycle, bhai. But you know, seeing them grow up makes it all worth it, right? At least, that's what I keep telling myself.
Oye sun, how's life treating you these days? Aur batao, relationship bhi hai, research bhi... balance kaise bana raha hai? I'm struggling to juggle it all, yaar. Koi tips dedo bhai.

Arre bhai, tension nahi lene ka. It's all about setting boundaries. Like, when I'm working, phone silent. No distractions. And when I'm with her, research takes a backseat. Prioritize, my friend, prioritize!
Boundaries toh set karne ki koshish karta hu, but research ka pressure itna zyada hai ki dimag mein chalta hi rehta hai. How do you switch off completely? Koi mantra-vantra hai kya?

Mantra toh nahi hai, but I have a ritual. We cook together, even if it's just Maggi. It's our 'us' time. And weekends are strictly for chilling, no work talk allowed. Find something that works for both of you.
Maggi bhi theek hai yaar. I guess communication is key, right? Baith ke baat karna padega. I tend to bottle things up. Thanks for the advice, bhai. Will try these tips.
Exactly! Open communication is the biggest funda. Aur haan, remember to appreciate the small things. A simple 'thank you' or 'I love you' goes a long way. All the best, dost. You got this!
Oye, check this meme out! It's about how every startup founder thinks their idea is the next big thing, even if it's just another chai delivery app. I’m dying laughing here. Is this us, guys?

Arre bhai, that's so true! Remember when we thought our AI-powered samosa maker would revolutionize the street food scene? Good times, good times. Send more, this is a welcome distraction from debugging this authentication error.

Okay, next one: 'What's your startup's exit strategy?' 'To exit my parents' house.' Haha! Relatable much? Seriously though, anyone got updates on that Series A pitch deck? Deadline’s looming, and I’m fueled by caffeine and memes.

Dude, that hits too close to home. Still living at home and dreaming of unicorn status. About the deck, I finished the market analysis section. Just need your feedback on the competitor landscape before sending it over.

Awesome, send it across! Last meme for tonight: 'Engineering Manager: What's the ETA? Engineer: Soon(TM).' This perfectly describes our development team, doesn't it? Gotta appreciate the honesty, though.

Hahaha, so true! 'Soon(TM)' is basically our official project timeline. Okay, back to work now. Series A funding won't secure itself. Let's crush this deck, get funded, and finally move out of our parents' houses!
Oye, kya scene hai? Last night toh full on assignment mode mein thi. Poori raat jaag kar coding kar rahi thi. Aankhein bilkul choti ho gayi hain. Coffee piyegi?
Arre bhai, bol mat! Main bhi wahi kar rahi thi. Database assignment ne toh jaan le li. Coffee toh banta hai, yaar. Let's go to the canteen. Par exam ka kya plan hai?
Exam ka toh tension ho raha hai. Syllabus itna vast hai! Kuch samajh nahi aa raha. Maybe we should form a study group? Woh Sharma bhai toh topper hai, usko bhi bula le?
Good idea! Sharma is a genius. But canteen first, coffee baad mein. My brain needs caffeine before any studying. After that, we'll tackle the syllabus. Chal, let's go!
Chalo, chalo. I need a break from this coding madness. Canteen mein samosa bhi khaate hain. My treat! Then, back to the grind. Sharma ko text karti hoon. He's probably studying already.
Perfect plan! Samosa and chai is the ultimate study fuel. And yeah, text Sharma. Jitne zyada log honge, utna hi better rahega. Exam ke liye best of luck, yaar!
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I'm totally broke yaar. Month end aa gaya aur account mein bacha hi kya hai. Shopping bhi pending hai Diwali ke liye. Koi jugaad hai tere paas?
Arre bhai, same pinch! Mera bhi haal kuch aisa hi hai. EMI aur rent ne toh kamar hi tod di. Diwali bonus ka wait kar raha hu. Maybe try a side hustle for some quick cash?
Side hustle? Kya karein yaar? Sab try toh kar liya. Delivery bhi, freelancing bhi... Kuchh toh aisa mil jaaye jisme zyada mehnat na lage aur paise bhi ban jaaye. Koi idea hai tere dimaag mein?
Soch toh raha tha, woh online courses ka kya scene hai? Kuchh skills sikh le toh shayad freelancing mein zyada scope ho. Ya phir woh stock market ka kya scene hai? Risky hai par...
Stock market? Bhai, woh toh mere bas ki baat nahi. Usme toh aur dub jaunga. Online courses theek hai, par time kahaan hai? Office ke baad toh jaan nikal jaati hai. Koi easy option bata.
Haa yaar, I understand. Chal, ek kaam karte hain. Chai peete hain aur phir saath mein dimag lagate hain. Maybe we can figure something out together. Kya kehta hai?
Oye sunn, long distance is such a pain na? How's it going with you and her? Last time we spoke, you were saying things were getting difficult. I hope everything is okay. Bata, kya scene hai?

Haan bhai, mushkil toh hai. It's been almost a year now. We try to video call every day, but you know, time zones ka chakkar. Aur woh feeling nahi aati, like when you are actually together. Miss karta hoon yaar.

I can imagine, bhai. But you both are strong, right? Remember what we discussed during that IPL match? Communication is key. Have you guys planned any trips to see each other soon? That might help boost things up a little.

Yeah, we are trying to plan something for Diwali. Tickets are crazy expensive though! Aur uske office mein bhi problem chal rahi hai, so she's not sure if she can get the leave. Dekhte hain, fingers crossed. Hopefully, sab theek ho jayega.

Arre, Diwali toh hai hi. Try for a smaller trip maybe? Just a weekend getaway? Even that can make a big difference. Aur chill maar yaar, don't stress too much. Things will eventually fall into place. Tension mat le.

Haan yaar, you are right. I should just relax a bit. Let’s see what happens. Thanks for listening, bhai. Sometimes just talking about it helps. Chal, chai peete hain, dimag thoda fresh ho jayega. My treat!

Oye, Diwali aa rahi hai! Kya plan hai tera? Ghar ja rahi hai ya phir idhar hi kuch dhamaka karegi? Last year toh tera ghar ka Diwali photo dekha tha, full on lighting aur rangoli! Is baar kya naya hai?

Haan yaar, ghar toh jaana hi hai. Mummy papa kab se bol rahe hain. Lekin jaane se pehle, soch rahi hu ek choti si Diwali party idhar bhi kar lein. Friends log ke saath. Rangoli toh mummy se seekh lungi, lighting ka jugaad bhi ho jayega. Tu bata, tere kya plans hain?

Mera toh wahi, ghar jaana. Parso ki ticket hai. Mummy ne already list de di hai kya-kya leke aana hai. Mithai, crackers, pooja ka samaan… full on shopping mode. Idhar toh bas office mein ek choti si party hogi, uske baad seedha ghar ki flight.

Achha hai yaar, family time is the best! Crackers toh kam phodna, pollution ka scene hai. Mithai mein kya kya ban raha hai ghar pe? Mujhe bhi parcel kar dena thoda sa. Idhar toh bas store-bought mithai se kaam chalana padega.

Arre, mummy toh laddoo, barfi, sab kuch bana rahi hai. Tension mat le, tere liye special parcel bhej dunga. Aur haan, crackers kam hi phodenge, bas thoda sa shagun ke liye. Tu apni party mein kya kar rahi hai? Koi theme wagera hai kya?

Theme toh kuch nahi hai, bas sab log milke Diwali puja karenge, phir dinner aur thoda dance. Aur haan, diya decoration competition bhi rakhenge. Jiska diya sabse achha hoga, usko prize milega. It will be fun, simple and sweet.
Beta, board exams are just around the corner. Have you started making a proper study schedule? Don't leave everything for the last minute, okay? Thoda thoda karke padho, toh stress nahi hoga.
Haan Maa, I've started. But syllabus toh itna vast hai! I feel like I'm drowning. How did you manage when you were studying? Koi tips and tricks batao na, please!

Dekh, divide your subjects into easy and tough categories. Start with the difficult ones when you're fresh. Aur har ghante baad, take a short break. Chai piyo, listen to music, but don't get distracted by your phone!
Okay, that sounds doable. But what about remembering everything? I study, but then I forget. Especially all the dates in history. It's like a Bollywood movie, so many characters and plots!

For dates, try making flashcards or mnemonics. And revise regularly. Revision is key, beta. Also, solve previous years' question papers. It'll give you an idea of the exam pattern and important topics.
Okay Maa, I'll try that. Flashcards sound fun, like a game! Thanks for the advice. Now I just need unlimited chai and samosas to fuel my study sessions. Wish me luck!
Accha suno, kya plan hai weekend ka? I'm so done with law books; need a break. Thinking maybe a movie or just chilling at home, catching up on sleep. Batao, tumhara kya scene hai?

Oye hoye, law student life! My weekend is still up in the air. Socha tha thoda padhai karoon but you know how that goes. Movie sounds good, otherwise maybe Dilli Haat? Kuchh handicraft shopping and momos?
Dilli Haat is a good idea! But weekend pe bheed hogi na? Movie is safer, AC mein aaram se. We could check out that new Bollywood flick everyone's talking about. Ya phir, Netflix and chill?
Bheed toh hogi hi, but Dilli Haat ka apna charm hai. Movie is fine too, whatever works. Aur Netflix and chill...depends on the movie list! Let's decide by Friday night, ok? I'm flexible.

Done deal! Friday night ko plan finalize karte hain. I'll check out the movie timings and see what's playing on Netflix. Maybe we can even try that new cafe in Hauz Khas Village? Heard their chai is amazing.

Hauz Khas Village sounds fancy! Okay, I'm in. Friday night, we decide. Meanwhile, back to these boring legal cases. Weekend, please come faster! Chai at Hauz Khas, definitely something to look forward to.
Oye, sunn na, what's your rashi again? I was reading about zodiac signs and compatibility and it's quite interesting. Do you believe in all that stuff, ya?
Arre baba, I'm a Gemini. Thoda bahut toh believe karti hoon, you know, just for fun. Sometimes it’s surprisingly accurate! What's got you so interested suddenly in astrology, huh?

Actually, I was checking my compatibility with someone... just out of curiosity, okay? And some things were bang on! It's all just probabilities, I guess, but still, funny how it sometimes matches our behaviour.

Dekh, Geminis are supposed to be indecisive and talkative, which is totally me! But seriously, don't base your life decisions on it. It's just a lighthearted way to understand ourselves and others, right?

Haan, haan, chill. I'm not planning my shaadi based on zodiac signs. But it is fun to read about! So, tell me, what qualities do you think Geminis look for in a partner, according to your 'expert' knowledge?

Arey, we need someone who can keep up with our witty banter and doesn't get bored easily! And most importantly, someone who understands our mood swings, boss. Toh batao, does that sound like anyone you know?
Oye sun, I was thinking, our families, right? Kitna different hai yaar. Like, my mom still asks me if I've eaten properly every two hours. Do your parents do that too?
Arre bhai, same pinch! My parents also keep tabs on my khana-peena. But I think it's their way of showing love, no? Though sometimes it feels like I'm still in school, not a fully grown adult.
Exactly! And the pressure to get married! Meri toh jaan kha gaye hain. 'Beta, ladki dekh le'. Your parents are also after you about shaadi, right? Or are you the lucky one?
Shaadi? Don't even get me started! My family's already planning the reception, and I haven't even found anyone yet. They're showing me rishtas like it's a job interview. It's wild, man, wild.
I feel you, dost. But you know what I find funny? The way our families celebrate festivals. Your Diwali is all about lights, mine is about sweets first. Still, sab pyar mohabbat hi hai.

True that! At the end of the day, it's all about family. Even with all the cultural quirks and shaadi pressure, we wouldn't trade it for anything, right? Chal, chai peete hain, let's forget about rishtas for a while.
Accha suno, Diwali ki yaad aa rahi hai. Bachpan mein kaise celebrate karte the, kuch batao toh. I'm feeling so nostalgic suddenly, like woh mitti ki khushboo and all.
Arre yaar, bachpan ki Diwali toh alag hi level thi! Humara pura mohalla sajta tha, har ghar mein diye jalte the. Remember woh Lakshmi puja? Aise line lagake prasad lete the.
Haan, haan! Aur woh patakhe? My parents used to get us those small phuljharis because I was scared of the loud ones. Choti Diwali pe toh special halwa banta tha, right?
Bilkul! Halwa toh must tha. Aur woh Diwali cards exchange karna, yaad hai? Friends ke ghar jaake 'Happy Diwali' bolte the. Kitni simple thi life tab, no stress of studies.
Exactly! And the new clothes. My mom used to get me a new lehenga every year. I used to feel like a proper princess. This time, just gonna order something online, I guess.
Same here! Online shopping zindabad. But nothing beats woh maa ke haath ka bana halwa and family time. Chalo, this Diwali, let's recreate some of that magic, okay? Missing those vibes!

Oye, PTM ka scene hai yaar. Kid's school just sent a reminder. Totally forgot about it, man! Ab kya karein? I'm swamped with work toh. You think I should just skip it? Wife will kill me though, guarantee.
Arre bhai, skip kaise karega? It's about your kid's future! Office se thodi chutti maar le. Ya phir, try and reschedule with the teacher? Explain your situation. But going is important, Vikram.

Reschedule? That's a thought. But you know how these schools are, very strict. Warna principal madam sunayegi. I'll try pleading with my boss first. Maybe a half-day? What do you think I should tell the teacher?

Tell her you're genuinely concerned about your child's progress and want to collaborate. Ask about specific areas he/she needs help in. Show them you care and are invested. That usually works. Good luck with the boss battle!

True, true. Investment dikhana padega. I'll rehearse my lines. 'My kid is my priority, school is second home' – something like that, right? And yeah, the boss battle. Wish me luck! Chai peete hai baad mein, okay?
All the best, bhai! You got this. And yes, chai is definitely on once you've conquered both the PTM and the boss. Let me know how it goes. I'm sure everything will be fine. Relax and breathe!
Accha suno, weekend ka kya plan hai? I was thinking of catching up on some sleep, but Amma is insisting we visit the temple. What about you? Koi movie wagera ya phir chill scene?
Arre yaar, weekend toh bas ghar ke kaam mein nikal jaata hai! Socha tha thoda padhai karungi, par abhi toh lag raha hai poora din cleaning mein hi jayega. Temple ka plan sounds peaceful though!

Cleaning? Uff, that's the worst! Why don't you ditch it for a bit? We could grab some chai at that new cafe near the market. Thoda refreshment ho jayega, and then you can tackle the cleaning with renewed energy. What say?
Chai? Tempting proposal! But bhaiyya is coming over, so I need to help Amma with lunch. Maybe tomorrow evening? We can try that cafe then. I heard they have amazing pastries too!

Tomorrow pakka phir? Bhaiyya ke liye special khana ban raha hoga. Tell me what's on the menu! Anyway, I'll try to finish my pending work today so that I can relax tomorrow. Let's catch up after lunch?
Done deal! I think Amma is making matar paneer and dal makhani. Bhaiyya's favorites! After lunch sounds perfect. We can finalize the cafe plan then. See you tomorrow!

Oye, Diwali is just around the corner, right? Kya plan hai tera? Ghar ja rahi hai ya idhar hi dhamaka karegi? I'm already dreading the traffic and the endless mithai. But ghar ka Diwali is ghar ka Diwali, you know?

Haan yaar, Diwali toh hai. I'm still deciding actually. Maybe I'll go home for a few days, but then come back. So much work here, boss is already breathing down my neck. Waise, you making any faral this year? Remember last year's chakli fiasco?

Arre, don't remind me of that chakli! This year I'm ordering everything. No time for experiments. We should definitely catch up though, maybe after Diwali. Let's go for some street food, like golgappe or maybe some hot samosas. What say?

Golgappe is always a yes! And samosas too! Done deal. We'll plan something after all this Diwali madness dies down. But seriously, be careful with all the pollution and crackers. Last year my asthma went crazy. Take care of yourself, okay?

Haan haan, I will. Tu bhi apna dhyaan rakhna. Aur sun, Happy Diwali in advance! May the lights shine bright and all that jazz. Don't forget to send me pictures of your Diwali decorations. I want some inspiration for next year!

Same to you, dost! Happy Diwali! Will definitely send you pics. And yeah, let's make it a point to actually meet this time, not just talk about it. Okay? This time pakka golgappe treat from my side. Deal?

Arey yaar, I finally managed to book those sunset boat ride tickets! Took ages, everything was getting sold out so fast. Hope he likes it, I really want this to be special. What do you think, zyada cheesy toh nahi ho raha?

Nahin, nahin, sunset boat ride toh एकदम romantic hai! He'll love it! Just imagine, the golden hour, the sea breeze... perfect setting. Just be yourself, aur sab theek ho jayega. Tension mat le, chill kar!

Haan, tension toh ho rahi hai. I even planned the outfit. Light, flowy dress, you know? Something that looks good in pictures against the sunset. I hope the weather cooperates, baarish ka mausam hai na.
Weather ka tension mat le. Bhagwan sab theek karega. And the dress sounds perfect! Just remember to wear comfortable shoes. You don't want to be struggling on the boat. Baki sab toh set hai!
Shoes ka toh socha hi nahi! Thank you, thank you! You're a lifesaver. Abhi jaake dekhti hu. I'm so nervous, but also super excited. Wish me luck! I'll tell you everything tomorrow.
All the best! Don't forget to take lots of pictures and enjoy the moment. And yes, definitely tell me everything tomorrow. I'm dying to hear all the details. Have a wonderful time!

Oye sunn, office mein kya chal raha hai? Last week toh suna tha, someone was crying in the bathroom after that presentation. Kya scene tha exactly? Bata na yaar, I'm dying to know. Don't tell me it was about that new project deadline.

Arre yaar, it's a total mess! Turns out, it wasn't just the deadline. Apparently, Sharmaji ne Vermaji ki presentation 'borrow' kar li thi, bina bataye. And then Vermaji got reamed out by the boss for 'lack of originality'. Poor guy was devastated.

What?! Sharmaji? I thought he was all about 'teamwork' and 'collaboration'! That's so low, even for him. Vermaji should have spoken up then and there. Ab kya hoga? Is HR involved? Ya phir sab aise hi chalega?

Vermaji did try, but Sharmaji played the victim card, saying he was just 'inspired' and didn't mean to cause harm. HR is 'looking into it,' matlab nothing will probably happen. Office politics, you know? It's always the same drama.

Seriously! This is why I hate office sometimes. Matlab, kaam karo, stress lo, and then deal with these kinds of chindi people. Vermaji should start looking for a new job, honestly. He deserves better than this nautanki.

Exactly! I told him the same thing. He's updated his resume and started applying already. Good riddance to bad rubbish, I say. Anyways, chai peene chalen? I need a break from all this office gossip ki garmi.
Oye, bhai! Interview ka tension ho raha hai yaar. Kal TCS ka interview hai. Kya padhun, kya bolun, kuch samajh nahi aa raha. Aisa lag raha hai sab bhool gaya hu. Koi tips hai tere paas?

Chill maar, dost! Tension mat le. First, apne basics strong kar. Data structures aur algorithms revise kar le. Aur jo bhi projects resume mein likhe hain, unke baare mein detail mein pata hona chahiye. Confidence dikha, bhai!
Haan yaar, woh toh hai. Lekin woh HR questions ka kya karun? 'Tell me about yourself' aur 'Why do you want to work here' jaise sawaalon mein hamesha phans jaata hu. Kuch aisa bata jo impress kare.

Dekh, 'Tell me about yourself' mein apne skills aur experience ko job description se relate kar. Aur 'Why work here' mein company ke baare mein research karke bata ki unka mission tumhare values se kaise match karta hai. Positive rehna.
Accha, ye sahi hai. Aur dress code kya rakhun? Formal toh pehenna hi padega na? Tie-shai bhi lagani padegi kya? Ya phir casuals mein bhi chalega? Bata bhai, kya scene hai?
Formal hi best hai, bhai. Full sleeves shirt, trousers, aur tie bhi laga le. Thoda professional dikhega. First impression is the last impression, remember? All the best, phod dena interview!
Oye, kya scene hai? Diwali toh khatam ho gayi, ab kya plan hai? I'm thinking to get back on track with fitness. Peth toh dekho, kitna badh gaya hai after all those mithais!

Haan bhai, same pinch! Diwali weight gain is real. I was also thinking ki thoda gym shym join kar lein? Ya phir subah jogging hi start karein? What do you say? I need to fit into my sister's wedding lehenga.
Gym ka toh budget tight hai yaar. Jogging seems better. Kal subah chalein? 6 baje? Humare park mein? Phir ghar aake chai-nashta banayenge. Deal? Warna yeh samosa cravings toh control nahi honge.
Done deal! 6 baje pakka. But no chai-nashta everyday okay? Weekends only. We can explore healthy options like oats or poha. Think about it, healthy bhi aur tasty bhi. Kal milte hain, fitness partner!
Haan haan, healthy options bhi try karenge. But weekend pe samosa toh banta hai, boss! Chal, good night. Kal subah alarm lagana mat bhoolna. Warna phir main akela bhagta rahunga.
Alarm set hai! Don't worry, I'll be there. Ab sone ja raha hoon. Kal subah dekhte hain kaun zyada stamina dikhata hai. Prepare to be defeated! Shubh ratri, fitness freak!

Acha suno, I'm planning a PTM for my younger sibling. Bhaiyya is in class 10th, and I want to make sure everything goes smoothly. Any tips from you guys? I've never done this before, only attended them as a kid. It's quite daunting, no?

Arre, don't worry too much! First, make a list of questions you want to ask the teachers. Focus on Bhaiyya's strengths and weaknesses in each subject. Also, be prepared to discuss his study habits at home. Teachers appreciate that.

Good point! I was thinking of asking about his performance in the recent tests. Also, he seems a bit distracted lately. Maybe I should ask if they've noticed anything similar in class? I really want him to score well in boards.

Definitely ask about distractions. And remember, be polite but firm. You're advocating for Bhaiyya. Maybe also inquire about extra classes or any support the school offers for board exam preparation. All the best!

Haan, that’s a good idea about the extra classes. I’ll also ask about career counseling options available in school. He seems confused about what he wants to do after 12th. This PTM feels like a big responsibility!

You're doing great! Just remember to be a good listener during the meeting. Take notes, and don’t hesitate to ask for clarification if needed. And most importantly, reassure Bhaiyya that you're there to support him, not to scold him. It'll be fine, chill maar!

Accha suno, anniversary aa rahi hai. I'm totally blank on what to get. He's not into the usual stuff like watches or wallets. Koi unique idea hai tumhare paas? Budget bhi thoda tight hai, so nothing too extravagant.

Hmm, difficult. How about a personalized experience? Like a cooking class focusing on his favorite cuisine, or a weekend getaway to a nearby hill station? Those are memorable and won't break the bank completely. Or a custom-made photo album?

Weekend getaway sounds nice, but time kam hai yaar. Cooking class is interesting, he loves Italian. Photo album is too cliché, I think. Kuch aur batao. Something that he can use daily, maybe? But not boring like a pen.

Okay, daily use... How about a subscription box tailored to his interests? There are ones for coffee, grooming products, even books. It's a gift that keeps on giving! Or a high-quality Bluetooth speaker for his morning music?

The subscription box idea is actually quite good! He's a total coffee addict. I'll check out some options online. Bluetooth speaker is also a contender. Thanks a lot! Tumhare ideas hamesha kaam aate hain.

No problem! Glad I could help. Don't stress too much about it. The most important thing is that it comes from the heart. Aur haan, whatever you choose, wrap it nicely and add a handwritten note. That's the magic touch!

Bhai sahab, Ganesh Chaturthi is round the corner! Thinking of wearing that silk kurta I got from Fabindia. What do you think? It's either that or a more modern Nehru jacket set. Batao, what feels more festive?

Arre bhai, both sound good, but for Ganesh Chaturthi, the silk kurta feels more traditional and apt. Plus, it photographs better! Nehru jacket is cool, but maybe for another occasion. Go with the kurta, it's a classic!

Sahi baat hai! Now, the bigger problem: gifts. Every year, I struggle. Modak is a given, but I want something more thoughtful. Any ideas? Maybe something related to travel, since that's 'my thing', you know?

Hmm, travel-related... How about a nice travel journal with a Ganesh-themed pen? Or a small, portable speaker with devotional songs pre-loaded? Practical and festive! Avoid anything too generic. Personal touch matters a lot.

Wah, the speaker idea is actually quite good! I could even add some of my travel videos on a pen drive along with it. Double dhamaka! Thanks, yaar. You always have the best solutions. Now to find a good one!

No problem, bhai! Glad I could help. Check out online stores like Amazon or Flipkart. They usually have good deals around festivals. And don't forget to wrap it nicely! Happy Ganesh Chaturthi in advance!
Accha suno, socha hai ki ka birthday aa raha hai, toh ek surprise party plan karein? Woh hamesha sabke liye itna karti hai, toh humein bhi kuch special karna chahiye. Kya kehti ho?
Haan yaar, idea toh mast hai! toh surprise se hi khush ho jayegi. Lekin karna kya hai? Aur kahan karein? Ghar pe toh mushkil hai, usko pata chal jayega. Koi secret location socho.
Maine socha tha ki woh naya rooftop cafe khula hai na, 'Sky High'? Wahan book karein? View bhi accha hai aur thoda secluded bhi hai. Aur theme kya rakhein? Koi Bollywood theme ya kuch aur?

Rooftop cafe is perfect! Aur Bollywood theme toh ko bahut pasand hai. Uske favorite songs ka playlist banate hain aur sabko dress code bhi de dete hain. Cake kaisa hoga? Chocolate ya kuch aur special?

Chocolate hi theek rahega, woh uska favorite hai. Aur decorations? Balloons aur fairy lights lagayenge? Sab friends ko secretly message kar do. Aur haan, uske office ke colleagues ko bhi inform karna hai.

Done! Main sabko message kar dungi. Decorations ka bhi tension mat lo, main dekh lungi. Bas tum cafe booking aur cake ka order confirm kar do. ko pata nahi chalna chahiye, warna surprise spoil ho jayega!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Socha tha weekend chill karenge, but dimaag mein business ideas ghoom rahe hain. Bata na, tere paas koi mast idea hai kya? Ya phir wohi 'chalo so jao' wala scene hai?

Arre bhai, 'chalo so jao' toh kabhi bhi option hai! But seriously, ideas toh hain. Actually, I was thinking, online saree rental service for weddings? Bohut log expensive sarees pehenna chahte hain, but sirf ek baar ke liye. Kya bolta hai?

Saree rental? Interesting angle hai! Logistics ka kya scene rahega? Dhobi expenses and all? Aur woh authenticity ka issue bhi toh hai, right? People want original designs, not cheap copies. But yeah, potential toh hai.

Logistics ke liye we'll partner with a good dry cleaner. Authenticity is key, I agree. We'll curate designer sarees directly from artisans, maybe even offer customized designs. Funding ke liye venture capitalists ko pakadenge. What do you think about this?

VCs ko pakadna is easier said than done! But I like the artisan connect. Maybe we can add a storytelling element – the history behind each saree. That'll add value. Let's do some market research next week. Free time mein plan banate hain.

Perfect! Market research is a must. We can also explore tie-ups with wedding planners. Storytelling is a brilliant idea – adds that emotional touch. Chal, phir next week milte hain, chai peete hain, aur details plan karte hain. Startup life rocks!

Accha suno, kal market jaana hai for groceries. List banayi kya? Warna wahan pahunchke sab bhool jaungi. Socho, weekend hai, kitni bheed hogi. Planning se chalna padega, nahi toh pura din nikal jayega.

Haan haan, list toh bana li. Sabzi, daal, aur kuch snacks bhi likhe hain. Lekin bhai, market mein itna kuch dikhta hai, hamesha kuch extra hi le aati hoon. Bheed toh hogi hi weekend mein, lekin jaldi nikalenge toh bach jayenge.

Theek hai, subah jaldi uthte hain. Phir woh sabzi wala jo fresh bhindi deta hai, uske paas seedha chalenge. Aur haan, woh chhole bhature wala stall bhi toh hai market mein. Control karna padega khudko.

Arre yaar, chhole bhature ki baat mat karo. Abhi se muh mein paani aa raha hai. Lekin promise karo, sirf ek plate. Aur haan, plastic bags mat le jaana. Apna jhola le chalenge, environment ka bhi sochna hai.
Haan baba, jhola toh pakka. Aur sirf ek plate chhole bhature, deal. Lekin woh uncle jo fresh paneer banate hain, unse paneer bhi lena hai. Ghar pe paneer tikka banayenge. Kya kehti ho?

Paneer tikka? Perfect! Phir toh market trip is worth it. Bas yeh decide kar lo ki kaunsa detergent lena hai. Last time wala mujhe kuch khaas pasand nahi aaya. Aur haan, woh dhaniya aur pudina free mein mangna mat bhoolna.
Oye, Rakhi ka kya plan hai? Bachpan mein toh humlog kaafi dhoom dhaam se manaate the. Remember woh saare fancy rakhis aur gifts ke liye fight hoti thi?
Haan yaar, bilkul! Woh din toh ekdum festival jaisa hota tha. Subah jaldi uthke nahaana, phir ready hoke bhaiyon ko rakhi baandhna. Aur baad mein dher saara mithai! I miss those days.
Exactly! Aur yaad hai, humari dadi kitne pyaar se apne haathon se rakhi banati thi? Uss rakhi mein jo feeling thi, woh aajkal ke fancy rakhis mein kahaan.
Sahi kaha tune! Unke haath ka bana hua khana aur woh rakhi, sab mein alag hi pyaar hota tha. Aajkal toh sab kuch ready-made milta hai, lekin woh baat nahi hai.
This time soch rahi hu ghar jaungi. Family ke saath celebrate karne mein jo maza hai, woh kahin aur nahi. Kya pata, bachpan waali feel phir se aa jaaye.
That's a great idea! Ghar jaake maa ke haath ka khana khana aur bhaiyon ke saath masti karna, best rahega. Meri taraf se sabko Rakhi ki shubhkaamnayein dena.
Bhai sahab, kya haal hai? Suno toh, I'm struggling to balance work and personal life. Girlfriend is always complaining I'm working too much. Koi tips batao, you seem to have it figured out.

Arre yaar, I get it. Work-life balance is a myth, but manageable. First, set clear boundaries. No work calls after 9 pm, no checking emails during dinner. Communicate this to your partner, very important.
Haan, that makes sense. But what if something urgent comes up? My boss expects me to be available 24/7. She gets upset if I don't reply to emails immediately, even on weekends.
Tell her politely that you are unavailable during certain hours. Schedule dedicated 'couple time' – even an hour a day. No phones, just talk. Plan activities that both of you enjoy together.
Okay, I can try that. We used to go for morning walks, but I stopped because of work. Maybe I should start again. Anything else I can do to improve the situation?

Absolutely. Learn to delegate at work, if possible. Prioritize tasks ruthlessly. And most importantly, be present when you are with your girlfriend. Put your phone away and listen actively. Small gestures go a long way.
Oye, sunn na, tujhe pata hai? I heard about Sharma ji's son, Rohan. Apparently, he cracked the CAT exam with flying colors! Imagine, I remember him struggling with basic math back in school days.

Arre wah! That's amazing news! Rohan? Seriously? Last I heard, he was trying his hand at photography. Good for him. Hard work pays off, I guess. What percentile did he score? Must be something huge to get into IIM.

Apparently, it was 99.8 percentile! Can you believe it? Sharma ji must be so proud. He's already started talking about going abroad for further studies. Good days are here for them after all these years of struggle.

Wow, 99.8! That's insane. Sharma ji deserves all the happiness. Remember how he used to work overtime just to make ends meet? This is truly inspiring. We should definitely congratulate them properly, maybe with a mithai ka dabba.

Exactly! I was thinking the same thing. Let's get some good barfi from that new shop near the metro station. And maybe a small bouquet too? It's a big achievement, after all. Sharma ji will be over the moon. Let's plan this for tomorrow evening.

Done deal! Barfi and a bouquet it is. Tomorrow evening sounds perfect. This calls for a proper celebration. has set a great example. Chalo, good for him. Life is unpredictable, isn't it? From photography to IIM, quite the journey!

Oye, kal raat ka episode dekha? 'Succession' ka finale tha bhai! Kya cliffhanger pe chhoda hai. I was expecting kuch aur hi, but the writers ne game palat diya, completely unexpected. What did you guys think?

Haan bhai, dekha! I was glued to the screen. Mujhe toh laga tha woh company bech dega. Lekin family drama toh end tak chalta raha. The ending was a bit dark, but that's what makes it so good, isn't it? Real life ki tarah.

Exactly! Koi happy ending nahi. Sab apne matlab ke liye khel rahe hain. Shiv ka decision samajh nahi aaya mujhe, she could have taken it all! Aur woh bhaiyon ka jhagda, it never ends, right? I think it's a commentary on family businesses in general.

True that. Shiv ka decision was totally unexpected. But I guess power is more important than the company itself. And Kendall, poor guy, he was so close. Ab kya karega woh? Maybe he'll start a rival company, who knows?

Yaar, I really felt bad for Kendall. He tried so hard, but he was always living in his father's shadow. Anyways, now I need a new show to binge-watch. Any recommendations? Something with the same level of drama?

Try 'The Crown' if you haven't already. It's a different kind of drama, but equally gripping. Or maybe 'House of Cards'? Political intrigue at its best. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. Chai piyega? I'm heading to the tapri.
Accha suno, kal subah market jaana hai grocery shopping ke liye. List bana li hai kya? Nahi toh abhi saath mein baith ke bana lete hain. Warna vahan jaake sab bhool jaati hoon main.
Haan, list toh bana li thi. Par abhi dhyaan se dekh rahi hoon, kuch missing toh nahi hai. Aata, daal, chawal – yeh sab toh pakka chahiye. Aur haan, thoda meetha bhi le aana.
Theek hai, meetha bhi daal deti hoon list mein. Aur koi special sabzi chahiye kya? Bhindi toh tumhare bete ko bahut pasand hai, woh bhi le lenge. Shaam ko bana lenge uske liye.
Haan, bhindi toh zaroor le aana. Aur dekho agar achhe tamatar mile toh woh bhi le lena. Chatni banaungi weekend pe. Lekin please, zyada bargaining karna market mein.
Bargaining ki tension mat lo tum. Woh toh mera right hand ka khel hai. Bas tum batao aur kuch chahiye kya? Dahi aur paneer bhi le aana hai na? Woh main bhool jaati hoon hamesha.
Haan, dahi aur paneer bhi zaroor. Bas itna hi hai. Kal jaldi uthna, market mein rush hone se pehle pahunch jaayenge. Fir aaram se chai peeyenge ghar aake.

Oye, sun na. I was thinking… you know how society puts everyone in boxes? Like, 'ladka hai toh yeh karega, ladki hai toh woh karegi'. I've been feeling a bit… off about it all, lately. Tu kya sochti hai is bare mein?

Haan yaar, I get you. It's so limiting, right? Like, why can't a 'ladka' enjoy cooking or a 'ladki' be super into coding? These labels are so outdated. I think it's about figuring out what makes you happy, regardless of what anyone else says.

Exactly! And it's not just about hobbies, na? It's about how you *feel* inside. I've been reading about gender identity and it's so much more complex than just 'male' or 'female'. It's like… discovering a whole new part of yourself.

Totally! And the best part is, you get to define it for yourself. There's no right or wrong way to be. As long as you're being true to yourself, that's all that matters. I'm here for you, whatever you're figuring out.

Thanks, that means a lot. It's scary, you know? Especially with how judgemental people can be. But having someone like you who understands… it makes it a little easier. I'm still figuring things out, but I feel a bit braver now.

Of course, always! We'll navigate this together. And honestly, screw the judgemental people. Their opinions don't define you. Focus on finding your happiness and living your truth. Chai piyegi? My treat. We can discuss more.
Oye, sunn na! Kya lagta hai, yeh zodiac signs mein kuch toh sachchai hogi, nahi? I mean, I'm such a typical Gemini, it's scary. Hamesha confused and talking too much. Tu kya hai?

Arre, mujhe toh yeh sab bakwas lagta tha, lekin ab sochti hoon. I'm a Scorpio, and bhaiyya, jealous toh main hoon! But passionate bhi, they say. Maybe there's something to it. What's your take seriously?
Seriously, I think it's a fun way to understand yourself and others. Like, my mom is such a Cancer, so emotional! But yeah, don't take it too seriously, warna shaadi ke liye kundli milate rah jaoge.

Haan, that's true! Kundli matching is a whole other level. But sometimes, I read my horoscope just for fun. It's like a little pep talk, even if it's totally made up. Waise, what does your horoscope say today?
Aaj ka horoscope bol raha hai, 'take risks, be bold.' I think I'll order that extra spicy biryani I was eyeing. Zodiac signs or not, living on the edge is always a good idea, right?
Bilkul! And mine probably says, 'be mysterious and plan revenge.' Just kidding! But yeah, go for the biryani! Life is too short to worry about what the stars say. Bas pet puja honi chahiye!
Oye, kya padh raha hai? Itni shaanti se coffee shop mein? Usually toh tera phone hi chalta rehta hai. Event planning se thoda break mila kya?
Haan bhai, thoda break toh banta hai. Yeh book padh raha hoon, 'The Silent Patient'. Crazy plot twists hain. Bata nahi sakta, spoiler alert ho jayega. Coffee pi raha hoon, dimag shant karne ke liye.

Achha? Suspense thriller? Mujhe bhi bata na, main bhi padhunga. Last time jo tu ne book recommend ki thi, woh toh bilkul time waste thi. Iski story line toh interesting lag rahi hai. Hint de thoda sa.
Hint yeh hai ki kuch bhi woh dikh nahi raha hai jo hai. Aur jo dikh raha hai, us mein bhi jhol hai. Seriously, you'll be hooked. Lekin agar padh raha hai, toh mujhe bhi bata, discuss karenge.
Theek hai, done. Kal hi order karta hoon. Tab tak, aur bata, event planning mein kya chal raha hai? Koi naya client mila ya phir wohi shaadi ke functions?

Wohi sab chal raha hai. But, I'm working on a big corporate event next month. Fingers crossed, sab theek ho jaaye. Yeh book khatam kar ke, phir uski tension. Chalo, coffee khatam, kaam pe laut te hain.
Kya chal raha hai, sir? Reading break mein bhi kitab? Konsi novel hai yeh jo itni engrossing hai? Office mein bhi padhte rehte ho. Batao toh, hum bhi try karenge.

Arre yaar, yeh 'The Silent Patient' hai. Psychological thriller. Itni unexpected twists and turns hain ki kya bataun. Coffee break mein toh thoda dimag refresh ho jata hai. Tumhe suspense pasand hai toh definitely try karna.
Suspense toh mujhe bhi pasand hai. But aajkal ke writers kuch bhi likh dete hain. Last time jo padhi thi, woh toh bilkul bakwas nikli. Koi logic hi nahi tha plot mein. Isme kuch dum hai kya?

Nahi nahi, yeh alag hai. It's really well-written. The ending will completely blow your mind. Main bhi shocked ho gaya tha. Actually, I'm thinking of starting a book club in school, what do you think?
Book club? That's a great idea, sir! Bachchon ko bhi kuch padhne ki aadat lagegi. But yeh toh batao, bina spoiler diye, aisa kya twist hai jo itna dumdaar hai? Thoda hint toh do.
Ok, just one hint: the whole story is narrated from a very specific perspective. But what if that perspective is… unreliable? That's all I'll say. Baaki padh ke khud hi jaan lo. You won't regret it!

Accha suno, Ganesh Chaturthi is around the corner! Itna excitement hota tha bachpan mein. Do you remember how we used to make those tiny pandals out of cardboard boxes and decorate them with fairy lights?

Haan yaar, bilkul yaad hai! Aur woh paper mache ka kaam, pura ghar mess bana dete the. But the best part was going around the neighbourhood to see all the different Ganesh idols. Har pandal ki apni alag vibe hoti thi.
Exactly! Aur mummy ke haath ke modak! Uff, kya taste tha. Koi bhi mithai uske aage kuch nahi hai. I remember sneaking extra modaks when no one was looking. Woh taste abhi tak yaad hai mujhe.

Arre bhai, main bhi! Modak toh modak tha. Aur woh visarjan ka procession... the dhol beats, the dancing, the sheer energy of the crowd. It was like the whole city was celebrating together. Kya din the woh.

Sahi mein. Ab toh sab kuch itna commercial ho gaya hai. Woh bachpan wali baat nahi rahi. But still, I try to keep the tradition alive for my kids. Thoda sa hi sahi, but the spirit should remain, right?

Absolutely! Woh feeling toh zaroori hai. Even if it's just making a small Ganpati at home and singing a few bhajans. It’s about remembering those happy times and passing on the values to the next generation. Ganpati Bappa Morya!

Beta, board exams are just around the corner. Kitni taiyari hui hai? I know it's stressful, but don't take too much pressure. Remember to take breaks in between studying, okay? Aur healthy khana khao.

Haan Maa, pata hai. Subjects toh almost revise ho gaye hain. Thoda Physics mein problem ho rahi hai, numericals samajh nahi aa rahe. I'm trying to solve previous year papers, but sometimes I get stuck. Tension ho raha hai.

Physics mein problem hai? Koi baat nahi. Why don't you ask your friends for help? Ya phir, school mein teachers se bhi puch sakte ho. Remember, asking for help is not a sign of weakness. Revision is key, so keep practicing.

Haan Maa, woh toh hai. Friends se help maangi thi, but sab apne mein busy hain. Teachers se poochhne mein thodi sharam aati hai. But I'll try again. I'll focus on the important topics first, like you said.

Sharam kis baat ki? They are there to help you! Aur suno, raat ko zyada der tak mat jagna. Proper sleep is important. Subah jaldi uthkar padhna, fresh mind se sab samajh mein aayega. Relax and give your best shot.
Okay Maa, I understand. I'll try to get enough sleep and ask the teachers for help. Thank you for your support. I feel much better now. I'll definitely give it my best shot. Fingers crossed!
Accha suno, Ganesh Chaturthi aa rahi hai, na? I'm totally confused about what to wear. Something traditional but not too heavy, you know? And gifts bhi sochne hain... Any ideas, yaar?

Haan, obviously! Ganesh Chaturthi matlab full-on festive vibes! For your outfit, maybe a simple cotton kurta with some nice embroidery? Light and breezy. And for gifts, dry fruits ka hamper is always a safe bet. Or handmade diyas?

Dry fruits are so boring, na? Everyone gives dry fruits! I was thinking maybe a cool Ganpati idol for my friend's new house? Or something related to photography, like a lens cleaning kit? What do you think?

A Ganpati idol is a great idea, especially for a new house! Very thoughtful. Lens cleaning kit is also good, but maybe a bit too practical? Add something festive with it, like a small box of modaks, toh perfect lagega.

Modaks! Yes, that's it! I'll get a Ganpati idol and a box of homemade modaks. Outfit-wise, I think I'll go with a silk saree, but a light one. Thanks for the suggestions, you saved me from a major fashion and gifting crisis!

Arre, anytime! Silk saree sounds amazing! Just pair it with some simple jewellery and you're sorted. Now, tell me, what are you planning to cook for the Chaturthi feast? I need some inspiration too, bhai!
Sunn bhai, anniversary aa rahi hai. I'm totally blank on gift ideas. She’s not into jewellery much. Last year I got her a saree, toh woh bhi ek baar hi pehni. Help kar yaar, dimag kharab ho raha hai.

Arey tension na le. What about an experience? Like a weekend getaway to some hill station near Mumbai? Ya phir, if she's into it, a cooking class? Something she'll actually enjoy and remember, you know?

Hmm, getaway is a good idea, but planning mein time lagega. Cooking class thoda predictable hai. She's been hinting about wanting to learn pottery. Do you think that's too niche? I don't even know if there are classes for that around here.

Pottery is actually pretty cool! Check online, bohot classes mil jaayenge. It’s unique and she'll love the effort you put in finding it. Plus, imagine, she makes you a chai cup! Win-win situation, right? Just make sure it's a good instructor.

Wah, chai cup! Good thinking. Okay, pottery classes it is. Now, where to find a decent one? Any leads? And what about a small, thoughtful gift to go with it? Just in case the pottery thing doesn't pan out as expected.

I know this artist in Bandra who does pottery workshops. I'll send you her contact. As for a small gift, maybe a personalized photo album with all your memories together? Sentimental, but always a safe bet. Aur mithai ka dabba toh banta hi hai!

Suniye, Eid aa rahi hai, na? Socha hai is baar apne mohalle mein kuch community event arrange karein? I was thinking of maybe a small get-together with food and music. What do you think, will people be interested?

Haan, yeh toh bohot achchi baat hai! Eid ke mauke par sabko milne julne ka mauka milega. Food aur music ka idea bhi zabardast hai. Lekin logistics kaise manage karenge? Venue aur funds ka kya plan hai?

Venue toh community hall hai na, woh book kar lenge. Funds ke liye, I thought we could ask everyone to contribute a little bit. Maybe ₹500-₹1000 per family? Aur phir kuch sponsors bhi dhoond lenge. What say?

Sounds practical! Community hall is perfect. Contribution ka idea bhi sahi hai. Sponsors dhoondne mein main bhi help kar sakta hoon. Let's make a list of potential sponsors. Aur food menu mein kya rakhenge?

Menu mein biryani toh must hai, aur phir haleem, kebabs, aur kuch meetha bhi. Firni ya sheer khurma? Aur vegetarians ke liye bhi kuch options rakhna padega. Paneer tikka aur vegetable biryani, kaisa rahega?

Perfect! Biryani, haleem, kebabs are Eid essentials. Firni is a great choice. Paneer tikka aur veg biryani vegetarians ke liye sahi hai. Chalo, phir ek meeting karte hain sabke saath, aur details finalise karte hain. Eid Mubarak in advance!

Suniye, weekend ka kya plan hai? Soch raha tha kahin ghoomne chalein. Stress bahut ho gaya hai kaam ka, ek break toh banta hai. Lekin surprise rahega, bilkul hint nahi dunga. Bas packing kar lena Friday evening tak.
Accha? Kahan ka plan hai bhai sahab? Mujhe toh office ka kaam khatam karna hai Friday tak. Surprise hai toh kuch toh batao, kaise tayyari karungi? Aur kya le jana hai, garam kapde ya summer clothes?

Arre tension mat lo. Garam kapde le jao, shayad thandi jagah ho. Aur zyada sawaal mat poochho, surprise kharab ho jayega. Bas trust karo mujh par, weekend mast jayega. Booking wagera sab maine kar li hai.
Theek hai, tumhara surprise hai toh tumhari marzi. Lekin agar boring nikla toh dekhna! Waise bhi, tumhari surprises hamesha ajeeb hoti hain. Hope this one is better. Tell me the weather at least!

Arre yaar, negative mat ho. I promise, yeh surprise sabse best hoga. Weather ka tension mat lo, sab manage kar liya hai. Bas Friday ready rehna, time pe nikalenge. Aur kisi ko batana bhi nahi, secret mission hai yeh.

Okay baba, I trust you. But agar kahin pahunch ke pata chala ki trek karna hai toh main nahi karne wali. Heels pack karun ya sneakers? Thoda toh clue do, warna main pareshaan ho jaungi. Fine, I'll wait for Friday then.

Oye sunn, interview ka kya scene hai? Tension ho rahi hai kya? Bata na, how's the prep going? Koi mock interview wagera diya kya? I know how much this job means to you, so just breathe and tell me everything.

Haan bhai, tension toh full on hai. Prep chal rahi hai, but I feel like I'm forgetting everything. Mock interview toh ek bhi nahi diya. I'm mainly focusing on STAR method answers. Tu bata, koi tips hai tere paas?

STAR method is good, but try to personalize it. Don't just memorize answers. Aur ek mirror ke saamne practice kar. See your body language and all. Confidence dikhna chahiye, bhai. And remember to ask questions at the end. It shows interest.

Arey yaar, mirror wala idea toh sahi hai! I'll try that. Questions bhi prepare karne padenge. I was so focused on answering their questions, I forgot about asking my own. Koi specific questions mind mein hai tere?

Yeah, ask about company culture, opportunities for growth, or what the team is currently working on. It shows you're thinking long-term. Don't ask about salary or benefits in the first interview, okay? All the best, bhai!

Got it, got it! Company culture and growth opportunities... noted. Thanks a lot, bhai! You're a lifesaver. Ab thoda confidence aa raha hai. Chal, I owe you a treat after I nail this interview! Chai-samosa on me!

Hey, suno toh! Any good movies out lately? I'm so bored of working from home, need some entertainment. Thinking of catching a flick this weekend, but everything looks same-same. Koi recommendation hai kya?

Arre, bilkul! 'Fighter' dekhi? Hrithik Roshan is looking fab as always! And the action sequences are totally paisa vasool. But if you want something lighter, then 'Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya' is a good watch too. Pure rom-com vibes.

Hmm, 'Fighter' sounds too action-packed for a relaxed weekend. Rom-com is more my vibe right now. 'Teri Baaton Mein...' kaisi hai? Is it one of those cringe-worthy ones or actually funny? And what about the songs, catchy hain?

Nahi, nahi, it's actually pretty good! Kriti and Shahid are a cute pair, and the storyline is different. Songs are decent, not super memorable, but they fit the vibe. It's perfect for a lighthearted watch. Take your friends along!
Okay, you've convinced me! 'Teri Baaton Mein...' it is. Sunday ko plan banate hain. Thanks for the recommendation! Ab tension nahi hai, weekend toh set ho gaya. Popcorn and chill mode activate!
Awesome! You'll enjoy it, I'm sure. Mujhe bhi batana kaisi lagi, okay? And yeah, enjoy the popcorn! Maybe we can catch a movie together next time. Let me know if you need more recommendations later.
Oye, Diwali aa rahi hai, kya plan hai tera? Ghar jaa rahi hai ya idhar hi dhamal machayegi? Bata na yaar, kuch toh exciting karte hain is baar.
Arre yaar, ghar toh jaana hi hai, mummy papa kab se bol rahe hain. Lekin Diwali se pehle kuch toh yahan bhi karenge na? Party-sharty, shopping vagera… kya bolti hai?
Haan, woh toh hai. Pehle toh Dhanteras pe shopping ka scene hai, phir Diwali party toh banti hai. Let's plan something grand. Kahaan karein party, batao?
Mere dimag mein ek rooftop party ka idea chal raha hai. Thodi desi vibes, thoda modern touch. Dj wale babu ko bhi book kar lenge. Kya kehti hai?
Perfect! Rooftop party sounds amazing. Aur Diwali ke din ghar mein kya hoga? Mummy ke haath ke ladoo toh milenge na? Uske bina Diwali, Diwali thodi na hai.
Of course! Ladoo, barfi, sab milega. Aur haan, ghar pe Diwali puja bhi hogi. Lekin uske baad, we can sneak out for some late-night fireworks, right? Chalo, plan final.
Arre bhai, Sunday ko market jaana hai for groceries. List toh bana li hai, but socho kya kya lena hai? Dimaag mein toh bas biryani ka idea chal raha hai. What all ingredients I need?
Haan bhai, biryani toh mast idea hai. Check karo basmati rice, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, dahi, aur biryani masala. Maybe some saffron for that extra touch? Aur kya veggies daaloge?
Right, right, basmati rice toh must hai. Veggies mein aloo, matar, maybe some carrots? Aur thoda sa podina aur hara dhaniya bhi chahiye. Bhindi bhi le leta hu, side dish ke liye. What do you think?
Perfect combo! Bhindi fry with biryani? Wah wah! Don't forget the cooking oil, maybe some ghee bhi for that rich flavor. Aur bhai, bargaining karna mat bhulna market mein. Sunday ko bheed hogi.
Haan yaar, ghee toh dalna hi padega. Bargaining toh apne khoon mein hai. But Sunday ko itni bheed hoti hai na, darr lagta hai. Koi nahi, mask pehen kar jaunga. Anything else I am missing?
Bas, paani ki bottle le jana saath mein. Garmi bahut hai. And maybe a small bag for carrying everything. Baaki toh sab set hai. Biryani ki photo bhej dena phir!
Oye, sun na, Eid ki planning kya hai? Bachpan mein kaise manate the? I mean, ab toh sab busy ho gaye hain, but those old days... kya scene tha!

Arre bhai, bachpan ki Eid toh Eid hoti thi! Chand raat se hi excitement shuru. New kapde, mehndi, ghar mein sewai ki khushboo... pura mahalla jagta tha. Ab toh sab WhatsApp pe 'Eid Mubarak' bhej dete hain.

Exactly! Woh jo dadi ki sewai hoti thi, uske toh kya kehne! Aur woh eidi milne ka thrill... collecting those crisp notes from all the elders. Ab toh digital payments ka zamana hai, feeling hi nahi aati.
Haan yaar, woh masjid ke bahar line lagakar biryani khana, aur phir doston ke ghar jaakar maze karna... pure din masti! Ab toh diet conscious ho gaye hain, biryani se bhi darr lagta hai.
Aur woh patakhe phodne ka craze! Diwali mein toh phir bhi restriction hoti hai, Eid pe toh full permission thi. Subah se shaam tak dhoom dhadaka. Ab toh pollution ka darr lagta hai.

Sahi bol raha hai, bhai. Woh unconditional joy, woh sense of community... missing those days. Chalo, is baar try karte hain thoda bachpan revive karne ka. Sewai toh banti hai, phir chahe jitni bhi gyming karni pade!

Sunn bhai, vacation ka kya scene hai? I was thinking Goa chale, but budget ka thoda tension hai. My journalist salary isn't exactly showering me with paisa, you know? Let's break it down properly, warna wahaan jaake bhookhe marenge.

Haan yaar, Goa toh mindblowing rahega! But budget is key, agree. Hotel ka dekho, beach ke paas chahiye ya thoda andar chalega? Beachfront is always pricier. Aur flights ka bhi early book karenge toh sasta padega. Let's check some options online tonight.

Beachfront is tempting, but practicality first. Thoda andar bhi chalega, as long as it's clean and safe. Flights definitely early booking. Food ka kya? Goa mein toh seafood mast milta hai, but daily fancy restaurants isn't feasible. Any ideas on that front?

Seafood toh pakka khayenge! But balance karenge. Some meals at local dhabas, kuch groceries leke khud bhi bana lenge. Aur beer toh Goa mein sasti hai, uske liye budget nikal hi aayega. We can also pack some snacks from home.

Dhaba is a great idea! And beer is a must, obviously. Okay, so flights, hotel, food, beer... Anything else we're forgetting? Activities? Sightseeing? Should we set a daily spending limit once we're there so we don't overspend?

Activities and sightseeing toh hain hi! Water sports, maybe a spice plantation tour. And yeah, daily spending limit is crucial. We'll use a shared Google Sheet to track everything. Total transparency, no financial surprises. Goa, here we come (hopefully within budget)!
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I was thinking about what happened last night with that group. Mujhe toh kuch vibe theek nahi aa rahi thi from a certain someone. You know who I'm talking about, right?
Haan yaar, I felt it too. Itna negativity toh office mein bhi nahi hoti jitni uske saath reh kar hoti hai. Always complaining, always putting others down. Kabhi toh positive baat kar liya karo!
Exactly! And the constant drama? I'm starting to think this friendship is more draining than my daily commute in peak hour traffic. Should we maybe...you know...distance ourselves a bit?
I've been thinking the same thing, bhai. It's like, we're always walking on eggshells around her. Aur humesha uske problems hi sabse bade hote hain. My mental peace is worth more than this, honestly.
True that! Chalo, let's make a pact. Thoda kam milenge, thoda kam sunenge uski bakwas. Focus on ourselves, our goals, and people who actually lift us up. Deal?
Deal! Bilkul sahi baat. Life is too short to be surrounded by toxicity. Positive vibes only from now on! Chal, let's grab some chai and plan our escape from this friendship saga. Cheers to that!
Accha suno, Christmas aa raha hai. Is baar decorations kaise karein? Bachchon ko bhi mazaa aana chahiye, aur ghar bhi sundar dikhna chahiye. Last year toh bas aise hi nikaal diya tha.
Haan, yeh toh sahi hai. Decorations toh zaroor honi chahiye. Aur sweets ka kya plan hai? Kuch traditional banayein ya phir woh cake-wagerah order karein? Kids ko kya pasand hai, woh bhi toh dekho.

Sweets mein toh main soch raha tha ki is baar ghar par hi gujiya banate hain, aur saath mein kuch chocolate cookies bhi. Cake bhi order kar denge, ek chhota sa. Decorations mein kya idea hai tumhare paas?

Gujiya is a great idea! Decorations mein, hum woh fairy lights laga sakte hain, aur ek chhota sa Christmas tree bhi. Bachchon ko bolenge ki woh apne haath se kuch decorations banayein. Unhe bhi creative feel hoga.
Yeh idea toh mast hai! Fairy lights aur tree toh pakka. Aur haan, bachchon ko DIY decorations banane bolenge. Unke school mein bhi toh sikhate hain. Isse unko bhi busy rakhne mein madad milegi.
Perfect! Toh phir list bana lete hain kya kya chahiye. Aur sweets distribute karne ka kya plan hai? Neighbours aur friends ko bhi toh dena hai. Unke liye bhi kuch special rakhte hain.

Beta, ab toh batao college mein kya karna hai? Engineering ka scope toh hamesha rehta hai, but you know your interest better. Architect banoge toh phir competition bhi tough hai, lekin creative satisfaction bhi hai.

Maa, mujhe coding mein interest hai, but architecture bhi accha lagta hai. Engineering mein scope hai, yeh toh pata hai. Lekin I feel like architecture mein main kuch alag kar sakta hoon, apne ideas use kar sakta hoon.

Dekho, job security important hai, but agar dil se karoge toh architecture mein bhi bahut scope hai. Think about sustainable designs, green buildings. Duniya ko bhi zarurat hai aur tumhe bhi mazaa aayega. Do what you love, paise toh aate rahenge.

Haan, woh toh hai. Sustainable architecture mein toh future bhi hai. I was reading about some new techniques. Actually, I'll research more about architecture colleges and their programs. Maybe I can find something that combines coding and design.

That's a great idea! Hybrid skills are always in demand. Don't just think about the money, think about what will make you happy for the next 40 years. We will support you no matter what you choose. Just make an informed choice.

Okay, Maa. Thanks! I feel much better after talking to you. I'll do some more research and then we can discuss it again. Maybe we can visit some architecture firms too, to get a better idea of the field. Thanks for understanding.
Oye, Diwali is just around the corner, right? Kya plan hai tera? Ghar jaa rahi hai ya idhar hi kuch dhamaka karegi? I'm already feeling the festive vibes, you know, woh Diwali wali feeling!

Arre yaar, definitely going home! Diwali toh family ke saath hi manane mein mazaa hai. But before that, we should totally do some Diwali shopping together. Lights, diyas, maybe some new clothes? What do you say, boss?

That sounds awesome! Diwali shopping is a must. Aur mithai? Which is your favorite? I'm thinking of trying some new recipes this year, maybe some fusion sweets. What about you? Koi special dish bana rahi hai?

Mithai toh sab hi favorite hai, honestly! But I love barfi and gulab jamun the most. My mom makes the best besan ke laddoo, so I'm definitely looking forward to that. Fusion sweets sound interesting, though! Let me know how they turn out.

For sure! I'll send you some pictures of my experiments. By the way, have you decided on your Diwali outfit yet? I'm still confused. So many choices! Maybe we can hit up that new boutique in Linking Road. Kya bolti?

Linking Road sounds perfect! I need to find something traditional but also trendy, you know? Diwali is the only time we get to dress up fully desi. Okay, let's plan a shopping date soon! Diwali shopping, mithai, and lots of gossip – perfect!
Oye, kya scene hai? Life mein kitna struggle hai na? Office ka kaam khatam hi nahi hota aur phir ghar ke bhi chores karne padte hain. Exhaust ho gaya hu yaar.
Haan bhai, bilkul sahi bola. Subah utho toh metro ki bhagam bhag, phir kaam ka pressure. Aur ghar aao toh mummy ke taane alag. It's like a never-ending cycle, isn't it? I feel you, totally.
Exactly! Aur upar se society wale aunty log bhi toh kam nahi hain. Har waqt judge karti rehti hain. Koi kuch bhi kare, unko toh bas gossip chahiye. Kya karein yaar?
True that! Woh toh professional hain is mamle mein. But seriously, kabhi kabhi lagta hai sab chhodke pahadon mein chala jau. At least wahan shanti toh milegi, no nagging aunties or deadlines.
Haan yaar, that sounds like a plan! But phir yaad aata hai ki EMI kaun bharega, bills kaise pay karenge? Life is a trap, bhai. But, chai piyega? Thoda toh relax karenge.
Perfect! Chai is the answer to everything, I swear. Chal, tapri pe chalte hain. At least thodi der ke liye toh tension kam hogi, aur gossip bhi toh karni hai, right?
Oye, sun na! Remember that time we tried making biryani in the hostel room with an electric kettle? What a disaster that was! The smell lingered for days, and the warden almost caught us!

Arre bhai, don't even remind me! That 'biryani' was more like soggy, spicy rice pudding. And the look on the warden's face when he sniffed around... I thought we were goners for sure! What about that time during Diwali?

Diwali was epic! We lit those sparklers on the terrace, and someone accidentally set off a small 'ladi' near the water tank. The whole hostel echoed with laughter. Good times, man! Did you ever get caught sneaking in food?

Caught? More like legendary! I once hid a whole tiffin carrier of samosas under my bed during surprise inspection. The aroma almost gave me away, but I managed to distract the inspector with a fake cough. Pure genius, right?

Haha, you were always the master of jugaad! Remember that professor who always wore the same tie? Someone replaced it with a bright pink one before his lecture. The look on his face was priceless, no? So funny.

Oh god, that pink tie incident! I nearly choked trying not to laugh. Those were the days, na? Full of masti and crazy adventures. College life was truly something else, yaar. Miss it so much sometimes!
Oye, kya scene hai? Soch rahi thi, we're such different backgrounds, right? Like, my family is all about that traditional stuff, and yours is super modern. Kabhi weird nahi lagta?

Arre, weird toh kabhi nahi laga. Interesting lagta hai! Your Diwali celebrations are epic, full-on Pooja and mithai. Our house just has some lights and maybe a small party. Different strokes for different folks, I guess.
Haan, true that. But like, when it comes to career choices, my parents were all about 'doctor or engineer'. Yours were cool with you doing photography, right? That's a huge difference, yaar.
Exactly! My parents were more like, 'do what makes you happy'. But your family's values are solid, you know? The way you respect elders and keep traditions alive is something I admire, honestly.
Aww, thanks! I guess we learn from each other, na? I'm trying to be more open-minded like you. Maybe I'll even convince my mom to try sushi next time we go out. Baby steps, baby steps.

Haha, that's the spirit! And maybe I'll join your family for a full-on Diwali Pooja this year. Deal? After all, thoda culture toh hum sabko absorb karna chahiye, isn't it? It's what makes India so vibrant.
Oye sunn, long weekend aa raha hai! Koi plan hai kya? I'm so fed up with this city's traffic and pollution. Need a break, ya. Kahin ghoomne chale?
Arre bhai, exactly mere dil ki baat cheen li! I was thinking the same. But where to go? Shimla-Manali toh usual suspects hain. Kuchh different try karein?
Haan yaar, let's ditch the hills this time. How about Goa? Beaches, seafood, shanti... or maybe even Rajasthan? I've always wanted to see Jaipur properly.
Rajasthan sounds amazing! Think of the forts, the food, the colours... plus, it won't be as crowded as Goa. Let's check out some travel blogs tonight and decide?
Perfect! I'll look up some good hotels and things to do. But budget bhi dekhna hai, bhai. Zyaada kharcha nahi karna. Pehle hi salary kam hai.
Agreed! We'll find something pocket-friendly. Maybe even a cool Airbnb. Rajasthan it is then! I'm already excited, yaar. Let's make some memories!
Oye, sunn! Fitness goals kya chal rahe hain? Diwali toh khatam ho gayi, ab toh sweets kam karne ka time aa gaya hai. I've gained like, 2 kgs already. Socha hai gym wapas join karlu?
Arre bhai, same here! Diwali weight is real. Gym ka toh scene on hai, but soch raha tha ki yoga try karoon. Sunna hai stress bhi kam hota hai aur body bhi flexible rehti hai. Kya bolta hai?
Yoga is a good idea, yaar. But I need something more intense. Maybe we can try some HIIT workouts together? YouTube pe bahut sare free videos hain. Shaam ko park mein chale?
Haan, that sounds doable. HIIT bhi theek hai. But bhai, diet ka kya scene hai? Just workout se toh kuch nahi hoga. I need to cut down on the biryani and butter chicken, I guess.
Diet toh mushkil hai, but let's try to eat more fruits and veggies. Aur chai mein cheeni kam! Baby steps, bro. Aur haan, ghar ka khana zyada, bahar ka kam.
Deal! Fruits and veggies on point. Chai mein cheeni kam will be tough, but challenge accepted. Let’s start tomorrow. Park, 6 pm? Fitness mode activated!
Arre bhai, kya tension hai? Tu toh aise dukhi lag raha hai jaise India World Cup haar gayi. Bata kya hua, maybe I can help. Relationship ka chakkar hai kya?
Haan yaar, exactly wohi. Girlfriend se jhagda ho gaya. She says I don't communicate properly. I don't know what she wants. Main toh apne hisab se sab kuch karta hoon.

Dekh, communication is key, mere dost. 'Main apne hisab se karta hoon' is not the answer. Try listening to her first, really listen. Understand what she's trying to tell you, even if it sounds like bakwas at first.
But sometimes she says things that don't make sense! Like, 'You don't understand me!' How can I understand if she doesn't explain properly? It's so frustrating.

Okay, okay. Next time, instead of getting defensive, ask her to give specific examples. Say something like, 'Okay, tell me one specific instance where you felt I didn't understand you.' It's less confrontational.
Hmm, that's actually a good idea. Specific examples... I'll try that. Thanks, bhai. Maybe yeh Bollywood drama thoda kam ho jaaye. Hope she understands too. Fingers crossed!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Aajkal toh bilkul dikhai nahi deta. Productivity guru ban gaya hai kya? Batao, kya tips and tricks use kar raha hai jo humein bhi thoda enlightenment mile.
Arre bhai, guru shuru kuch nahi. Bas thoda deadlines ka pressure hai. Actually, I started using the Pomodoro technique. 25 min focus, 5 min break. Works wonders, yaar! Try karke dekh.
Pomodoro? Sounds fancy! Main toh bas chai peeta rehta hoon aur YouTube scroll karta hoon. Shayad isiliye kaam pending pada hai. But 25 minutes? Itna concentration toh mushkil hai.
Haan, initially difficult lagega. But trust me, after a few days, you'll get used to it. No distractions during those 25 minutes, okay? Phone silent, social media off. Total focus!
Okay, okay, I'll give it a shot. But if it doesn't work, you're buying me samosas at that Sharma uncle ka stall. Deal? And next time, we’re discussing diet plans!

Deal! But if it works, you're treating me to golgappe. Sharma uncle ke samosas toh main waise bhi kha leta hoon. And diet plans? Let’s tackle this productivity challenge first, then we can worry about the waistline!
Oye sunn, kya chal raha hai? Aaj kal toh tu bada khoya-khoya sa lag raha hai. Exams ka pressure hai ya phir aur kuch game hai?
Arre bhai, exams toh hain hi sar pe. But uske alawa, there's this girl in my class, you know? I think I'm crushing hard. Samajh nahi aa raha kya karu.
Aha! Toh yeh chakkar hai. Bata bata, kaun hai woh lucky one? Koi senior hai ya apne hi batch ki? Don't keep me hanging, yaar! Details de.
Woh apne hi batch ki hai, woh jo statistics mein saath baithti hai. She's really smart and her smile, bhai, seedha dil pe lagti hai. But I don't think she even knows I exist.
Arre tension na le. Hum hain na. We'll figure out a plan. Pehle toh casually hello-hi start kar. Find common ground, maybe assignments? Don't be too desperate, play it cool.
Yeah, that's a good idea. Assignment toh bahaana mil jayega. Thanks, yaar! Tu sach mein dost hai. Kal se hi start karta hu. Wish me luck!
Accha suno, I was thinking, life is getting too hectic, no? Office, music gigs... We need a break. What say you about a surprise weekend getaway? Somewhere peaceful, maybe near the hills?
Batao! You know I'm always up for a vacation. Hills sound amazing! But surprise? You know I like to pack meticulously. Where are we even thinking of going? And when?
Arre, chill maar! I've got most of it figured out. Thinking of Kasauli. Small, quaint, beautiful. And I'll handle the packing, trust me. Just a few essentials. This weekend, Saturday morning. Deal?
Kasauli? Wah! Okay, I'm intrigued. But you better not forget my favorite scarf and the sunscreen, okay? And promise me good food. I'm trusting your planning skills completely on this one, mister!
Done and done! Scarf, sunscreen, and amazing momos are guaranteed. Just clear your schedule for the weekend. Consider it a mission. Operation: Weekend Bliss is officially a go!
Mission accepted! Ab dekhte hain, Mr. Planner, how well you execute this. But honestly, I'm already excited. Thanks for thinking of this. Kasauli, here we come! Jaldi se Saturday aa jaaye!
Oye, kya scene hai? Visa ka kuch update mila ya abhi bhi pending dikha raha hai? I'm getting so stressed yaar, flight tickets bhi book kar li hai maine.
Arre bhai, mat poocho! Mera toh wahi 'under process' dikha raha hai. Consulate walon ko email bhi kiya, but no reply. Flight tickets cancel karane pade toh bohot nuksaan hoga.
Yeh toh badi tension wali baat hai. Maine suna hai ki aajkal bohot backlog chal raha hai. Koi agent vagera pakadna chahiye tha kya? Ab toh last minute mein problem ho rahi hai.
