Haan yaar, woh toh maine socha tha, but doston ne bola tha ki direct apply kar le. Ab lag raha hai ki agent se hi karwana chahiye tha. Koi contact hai tere paas?
Ek tha, but pata nahi abhi bhi kaam karta hai ki nahi. I'll check and let you know. Tension mat le, kuch na kuch toh jugaad lag hi jayega. We'll figure something out.
Thanks bro, teri badi meherbani hogi. Agar kuch pata chale toh please jaldi batana. I'm keeping my fingers crossed, hopefully, sab theek ho jayega.
Accha suno, I'm facing some issues with my partner lately. We're constantly misunderstanding each other, and it's leading to unnecessary fights. Any tips on how to improve communication?

Dekho, communication is key, especially in relationships. The first thing you need to do is actively listen. Really try to understand their perspective before jumping to conclusions or getting defensive. It's harder than it sounds, trust me.
Haan, that makes sense. But sometimes, I feel like they're not even trying to understand me. They just hear what they want to hear. How do I address that without starting another argument?

Okay, try using 'I' statements. Instead of saying 'You always do this,' say 'I feel hurt when this happens.' Focus on your feelings and experiences, and frame it as a request for understanding, not an accusation. It diffuses tension.
That's actually really helpful. I've never thought about phrasing it that way. What about when we're both heated? Should we just avoid the conversation altogether until we cool down?

Absolutely! Taking a break is crucial. Agree to revisit the conversation when you're both calmer. Maybe go for a walk, listen to some music, or even just make chai. Clear heads lead to clearer communication. Remember, patience is important.
Oye sunn, tujhe pata hai woh Sharma aunty ke bete ka rishta fix ho gaya? I heard ladki toh badi modern hai, bilkul alag Sharma family ke values se. Kya scene hai yaar, I'm so curious!
Arre baba, mujhe bhi pata chala! Maine suna hai ladki MBA hai aur US mein job karti thi. Sharma aunty ko toh bahu chahiye thi jo ghar sambhale. Ab dekho, kismat ka khel. I wonder kya hoga aage.

Exactly! Sharma aunty toh har waqt traditional values ki baat karti hain. Now she's getting a bahu who probably wears jeans and goes to parties. I can't wait to see the Diwali photos. Full entertainment hoga!
Haan yaar, Diwali toh dhamaka hoga. Mujhe toh lagta hai Sharma aunty apne bete ko bol rahi hongi, 'Beta, zara bahu ko saree pehnao.' But seriously, I hope the girl is happy. Zindagi toh uski hai.
True that. Pyaar se rehna chahiye sabko. But still, I'm dying to know the full story. Pata chala toh mujhe bhi update karna. Chai pe milenge kal, aur gossip karenge detail mein!
Pakka pakka! Kal chai pakki. I'll try to get some inside information from my cousin, woh Sharma aunty ke ghar ke paas rehti hai. Prepare for some spicy details, my friend. This is going to be good.

Accha suno, Navratri is just around the corner! I was thinking, this time, we should have a proper community garba night. What do you guys think? We haven't done anything big in ages, and it'll be a great way to bring everyone together.

Bhabhi ji, that's a fantastic idea! It's been so long since we had a proper Navratri celebration. I'm in! We can book the community hall and get a DJ. What kind of decorations are you planning? Should we get some food stalls too?

Haan, community hall toh pakka book karna hai. Decorations mein, I was thinking traditional marigold garlands and colorful lights. Food stalls definitely! We can have some chaat, jalebi, and maybe even some thandai. It will be like a proper mela. What say?

Perfect! Count me in for helping with the decorations. I know a few people who can get us good deals on the flowers and lights. And my sister makes amazing chaat. I'll ask her if she's willing to set up a stall. This is going to be epic!

Awesome! Let's make a list of things we need to do. We need to send out invitations, arrange for security, and get the music sorted. Also, maybe we can have a small competition for the best dressed? That'll get everyone excited, right?

Bilkul! Best dressed competition is a must! And we should definitely have prizes. I can help with the invitations and getting sponsors for the prizes. This is going to be the best Navratri celebration our community has ever seen! Let’s make a WhatsApp group to coordinate everything.
Arey bhai, Ganesh Chaturthi aa rahi hai, aur main soch raha hoon kya pehnu. Travel blog ke liye photos bhi toh leni hain. Koi desi outfit suggest karo jo comfortable bhi ho.
Haan, I get it! Photos toh badiya aani chahiye. Ek kaam kar, kurta-pajama try kar. Linen ya cotton mein, so that garmi bhi na lage. Aur ek colourful shawl bhi add kar de, festive lagega.
Kurta-pajama toh theek hai, lekin shawl ka idea bhi sahi hai. Warna toh boring lagega. Ab gift ka kya scene hai? Kuch unique sochna hai family aur doston ke liye.
Gift ke liye, try handmade diyas ya Ganesh idols. Aajkal toh eco-friendly options bhi milte hain. Ya phir, agar budget ho toh, traditional sweets ka hamper bhi de sakta hai. Logon ko pasand aayega.
Eco-friendly idols are a great idea! Aur sweets ka hamper bhi sahi hai. Chal, I think I'm sorted. Thanks for the suggestions, yaar! Ab main bhi Ganesh Chaturthi ke liye ready hoon.
Koi baat nahi bhai! Wish you a very Happy Ganesh Chaturthi in advance. Photos badiya dalna blog pe, dekhna hai. Aur haan, modak khana mat bhoolna! Enjoy the festival!

Oye, sunn! New job ka kya scene hai? Interview kaisa gaya, bhai? Tension ho rahi hai, salary negotiation ka scene kaise handle karun? Bata na yaar, kuch tips de de. Gharwale bhi pooch rahe hain, kab party dega.

Arre tension na le! Interview toh clear ho gaya na? Ab salary ki baari hai. Research kar, market rate kya chal raha hai teri profile ke liye. Confidence dikha, par over-the-top bhi mat ban. Apni value bata, bhai.

Haan, research toh kiya hai. Glassdoor pe dekha tha, but mujhe lagta hai woh thoda outdated hai. Mujhe dar hai ki woh log kam offer karenge, aur main reject nahi karna chahta. First job hai na, isliye thoda pressure hai.

Dekh, unko apna expected salary range bata. Thoda high side pe rakh, taki negotiation ka scope rahe. Aur benefits ke baare mein bhi pooch, like health insurance, transport allowance. Yeh sab bhi salary ka part hota hai.
Accha, yeh toh maine socha hi nahi tha! Health insurance aur transport allowance bhi pooch sakta hoon? Mujhe laga tha sirf CTC ke baare mein baat hoti hai. Thanks yaar, yeh toh helpful tip hai!

Haan bhai, sab pooch! Sharma mat. Yeh tera haq hai. Aur agar woh log tujhe kam offer karein, toh politely bol ki tu woh offer consider karega. Unko lagega ki tere paas aur bhi options hain. All the best, bhai! Party toh banti hai!

Oye, sunn! Going to the mandi today for groceries. Need anything specific? Thinking of making maa ke haath ka rajma chawal tonight, but fridge is empty. Tell me quickly, otherwise I'll just grab the usual suspects – pyaaz, tamatar, aloo.

Accha? Rajma chawal sounds amazing! Haan, get some dhaniya and pudina, absolutely necessary. Also, check if they have fresh hari mirchi. And bhai, if you see good baingan, grab some for bharta. Warna, just focus on the rajma ingredients, that's the priority!

Done deal, boss! Dhaniya, pudina, and mirchi on the list. Baingan I'll see. Mandi mein quality unpredictable hoti hai. Will try my best. Anything else, or should I just get the regular dal-chawal fixings too, just in case the rajma plan falls through?

Nahin, rajma is the mission! Full focus. Get some dahi too, to go with it. And maybe a small packet of papad? You know, for that extra crunch. Oh, and check for good lemons for nimbu pani later. Garmi bohot hai yaar.

Okay, dahi, papad, and lemons bhi done. Anything else, oh great food guru? Warna I'm off. The mandi awaits, and I don't want to get stuck in the usual Saturday crowd. Jaldi batao, my auto-rickshaw is already waiting.

Bas bas! That's all. Thanks a ton, yaar. You're a lifesaver. Ab jaldi jao and get the best stuff! And don't forget to bargain with those vendors, okay? They always try to charge extra. And be back soon with the rajma ingredients!

Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Everything okay na? You seem a bit off lately. Office ka pressure zyada hai kya? Bata na, share kar. Sometimes just talking helps, you know? We've been friends forever, koi judgement nahi.

Haan bhai, pata nahi yaar. Just feeling a bit low, I guess. Office toh theek hai, but internally kuch chal raha hai. Like, I'm constantly overthinking things. Sleep bhi proper nahi ho rahi. It's getting frustrating, honestly.

I understand, man. Overthinking is a killer. Listen, have you considered talking to someone professional? Like a therapist or counselor? It's not a big deal, many people do it. Even I thought about it once during my MBA stress.

Therapist? I don't know, yaar. It feels like admitting defeat. Plus, what will people say? 'Dekho, pagal ho gaya'. You know how society is. But yeah, maybe it's something I should seriously think about.

Arre, who cares what people say? It's your mental peace we're talking about. Think of it like going to the doctor for a fever. This is the same thing. I can help you find some resources if you want. No pressure, just an option.

Thanks, bhai. I really appreciate that. Maybe you're right. It's time I prioritize myself. Let me think about it and I'll let you know. Chai pe chalte hai? Thoda relax ho jayega. My treat, for being such a supportive dost.

Accha suno, kal market jaana hai. Ghar mein sab kuch khatam ho gaya hai. Daal, chawal, atta, sab kuch list bana li hai. Tumhe kuch chahiye toh bata do, warna phir baad mein mat bolna 'yeh nahi laya, woh nahi laya'.

Haan haan, mujhe yaad hai. Last time tum bhul gaye the. Ek kaam karo, woh besan bhi le aana, pakode banane ka mann kar raha hai. Aur haan, dhaniya aur pudina mat bhulna, woh toh har sabzi mein dalta hai. List mein likh lo.

Besan, dhaniya, pudina...done. Aur kuch? Warna mein nikal jaunga. Subah subah market jaana, kitna traffic hoga. Upar se woh uncle kitna bhav badhate hain. Bargain karna padega warna poora budget hil jayega.

Ek minute... haan, woh green chillies bhi le aana, teekha khana hai. Aur dekho, agar achhe aam mile toh woh bhi le aana. Aam ka season hai, thoda treat toh banta hai. Baki sab tumhare hisab se dekh lena.

Theek hai, mirchi aur aam bhi done. Ab mein jaa raha hoon. Traffic mein phans gaya toh shaam tak hi aa paunga. Tum ghar ka kaam nipata lena, mein aate hi chai banaunga. Tab tak kuch aur yaad aaya toh message kar dena.
Okay, all the best! Dhyan se jaana. Aur haan, plastic bags mat use karna, apna wala kapde ka bag le jaana. Environment ka bhi sochna hai. Jaldi aana, mujhe bhookh bhi lagi hai. Bye!

Sun yaar, date night ka kya plan hai? I was thinking we could finally watch that new Bollywood flick everyone's raving about. Heard it's got some killer songs and the story is supposed to be pretty good. What do you say?

Hmm, Bollywood theek hai, but I'm a little burned out on the same old masala. Kuch aur dekhte hain? Maybe something international? I saw a trailer for a suspense thriller on OTT, looks properly gripping. We can order in pizza, chill scene.

Arre yaar, suspense thriller date night pe? Thoda zyada serious nahi ho jayega? I was hoping for something light and fun, you know? But pizza sounds amazing! Okay, compromise – Bollywood masala with a slightly different flavour. Comedy?

Comedy chalega! As long as it’s actually funny, and not just those forced jokes, you know? And promise me, no over-the-top drama. Deal? Okay, tell me which comedy you had in mind. I'm checking the reviews right now.

Deal! There's this one, 'Crazy Rishtey', heard it's a laugh riot. It's about a big fat Indian wedding gone completely wrong. Seems perfect for a light-hearted evening. Plus, the songs are already stuck in my head! What do you think?

Okay, 'Crazy Rishtey' it is! Reviews seem decent enough. Big fat Indian wedding gone wrong…sounds like my cousin's shaadi last year! Pizza and comedy it is then. I'm already looking forward to it. See you Saturday, right?

Accha suno, I've finally managed to book those sunset boat ride tickets. Hope you're free this Saturday evening? It's been ages since we did something other than just dinner and a movie. Think you'll like it, very romantic vibes!

Arre wah! That sounds amazing, honestly! Saturday is perfect, I've kept it free. Sunset boat ride, huh? You're turning into a proper Bollywood hero, Meera. Now I'm really looking forward to it. Where are we sailing from?

Hehe, not quite Raj from DDLJ, but I try. It leaves from Gateway of India. I thought the view of the Taj Hotel and the city skyline would be stunning at sunset. Afterwards, maybe we can grab some street food nearby? Chowpatty?

Gateway and Chowpatty? Done! Perfect Mumbai date, একদম! You know me too well. Street food after a fancy boat ride is the perfect combo. Just tell me what time I need to be ready. And should I wear something fancy-shancy or keep it casual?

Casual is good! The boat ride starts at 6:00 PM, so maybe reach Gateway by 5:45 PM? That way we can find parking and all. I'm so excited! This will be a much-needed break from all the office ka drama.
Got it! 5:45 at Gateway. Casual it is. And trust me, I need a break from work too. This sounds like exactly what the doctor ordered. Thanks for planning this, Meera. See you Saturday!
Oye, toh bata na, rooftop restaurant ke liye kya pehnu? First date hai, impression toh jamana hai. Casual toh nahi chalega na? Kuchh stylish but comfortable bhi hona chahiye. Help kar yaar!

Dekh, zyada toh mat soch. Dark jeans ya chinos, with a crisp linen shirt would work well. Maybe roll up the sleeves a bit. Add a nice watch and some loafers. Avoid anything too flashy, keep it classy and understated.
Linen shirt... hmm, garam toh nahi hoga? Mumbai ka weather hai, rooftop pe paseena paseena ho gaya toh game over. Aur loafers theek rahega? Sneakers better nahi hai for a more relaxed vibe?

Arre bhai, linen breathable hota hai. Light color ka le, white ya light blue. Sneakers bhi chalega, but clean white ones, not the ones you wear to the gym. And a light jacket, just in case thand lag jaaye.
Okay, okay. Linen shirt, light color, check. White sneakers, got it. Jacket bhi daal deta hu bag mein. Ab perfume kaunsa lagau? Theek se bata, over nahi hona chahiye. Subtle, but memorable.
Subtle and memorable? Go for something woody with a hint of citrus. A few sprays on the wrists and neck is enough. Confidence is the best perfume, remember that! All the best, bhai!
Sun yaar, I'm so stressed about these exams. My screen time is killing my study schedule. I just can't seem to focus. It's like my phone is glued to my hand. Any tips from your side?
Arre, I feel you! Exam stress is real. What I've started doing is setting app limits. Like, only 2 hours on Insta, max. And I put my phone on 'Do Not Disturb' while studying. Try it, it helps a lot.
Hmm, app limits sounds like a good idea. I'll try that. But what about when I need to look something up for my studies? I end up getting distracted by other things. That’s the main problem.

Okay, so here's what I do: I use my laptop for research, not my phone. And I keep a notebook handy to jot down extra thoughts, so I don't immediately Google them and fall into a rabbit hole. Works like a charm!
Laptop for research, got it! And the notebook idea is genius. I'm definitely going to implement that. Thanks for the tips, really appreciate it! Ab thoda relief mil raha hai, honestly.
Anytime, yaar! We all need to help each other survive these exams. And remember, take breaks! Chai breaks, walk breaks, whatever works for you. All the best! Padhte raho, badhte raho!
Oye, kya scene hai? I was thinking, life mein kuch toh improve karna chahiye. Just feeling a bit stuck, you know? Same routine, same problems. Koi naya challenge toh banta hai, boss!
Haan bhai, I feel you! I was just reading about this new online course on productivity. Maybe that could help us both? Ya phir, we could start going to the gym regularly? Summer is coming, after all.

Gym is a good idea, but I'm so lazy yaar! Online course sounds less painful. Which one were you looking at? Something practical hona chahiye, like coding or digital marketing. Something that can actually pay the bills later.

I was checking out this one on data analytics. It's supposed to be really good, and there's a lot of demand for it. Plus, it's all online, so we can do it at our own pace. Think about it, it could be a game-changer!

Data analytics sounds intense! But okay, let's check it out together. Shaam ko milte hain, chai peete hain, and we can browse the course details. If it's too technical, maybe we can try something else. Deal?
Deal! Chai pakka meri taraf se. And if data analytics doesn't work out, we can always try learning a new language. Spanish, maybe? Imagine ordering tapas in Spain, kitna cool lagega!

Accha suno, weekend aa raha hai. Grocery shopping ka plan hai kya? Ghar pe toh kuch bhi nahi hai, bas Maggie aur bread pada hai. Local market chalenge? Wahan sab kuch fresh milta hai, aur thoda sasta bhi.

Haan, yeh toh sahi hai. Weekend pe market jaana hi padega. Maggie aur bread kab tak chalega? List bana li hai kya? Mujhe bhi dekhna hai, shayad kuch cheezein main bhi add kar doon. Aur haan, bargaining bhi karna hai!

List toh nahi banayi hai abhi tak. Soch rahi thi pahle tumse pooch loon, tumhare hisab se kya kya chahiye. Bargaining toh main kar hi loongi, woh toh mera favourite part hai. Bas thoda jaldi nikalenge, warna bheed bahut ho jaati hai.

Okay, toh phir ek kaam karte hain, main ek rough list bana leti hoon. Tum bhi add kar dena jo bhi yaad aaye. Aur haan, jaldi nikalna is a must! Sunday ko toh bilkul hi nahi jaana, itni bheed hoti hai ki sar chakrane lagta hai.

Perfect! Main bhi ek list start karti hoon. Sunday ko market mein toh jaise Kumbh ka mela laga hota hai. Saturday theek rahega. Aur suno, shopping ke baad golgappe bhi khaayenge, woh uncle bahut mast banate hain!

Done deal! Shopping aur golgappe, Saturday ko. Golgappe toh banta hai, itni mehnat ke baad. Phir ghar aake chai banayenge aur aaram se baith ke gossip karenge. This sounds like a perfect weekend plan, yaar!

Oye sunn, I was reading about gender identity online. It's so different from what we were taught growing up, right? Like, it's not just ladka or ladki anymore. What are your thoughts on all this new stuff? It's kinda mind-blowing, no?

Haan yaar, I know what you mean! It's definitely a shift. Pehle toh bas wohi binary tha, but now there's so much more understanding. I think it's great that people are feeling more comfortable expressing who they really are, even if it takes time for us to fully understand.

Exactly! And it's not just about clothes or how someone looks, hai na? It's about how they feel inside. I saw this documentary about someone who didn't identify with either gender. It really made me think. It's a journey for everyone, I guess.

Bilkul. And we should all be respectful of that journey. It's their life, their identity. We don't have to 'get it' completely to be supportive. Thoda sa empathy dikhana is important. World mein already itni negativity hai, why add to it?

True that. I think educating ourselves is key. I'm trying to be more mindful of the language I use, you know? Avoiding assumptions and all that. It’s a learning process for sure, and I'm glad we can talk about this openly.

Me too! It's good to have friends who are open to these conversations. Change is scary, but it's also necessary. Let's grab some chai and discuss this further. Maybe we can watch that documentary together sometime? It'll be fun!
Oye, kya scene hai? I was thinking, yeh study abroad ka kya plan hai tera? I'm seriously considering it, but thoda dar bhi lag raha hai. Paisa-waisa, visa, sab manage ho payega ki nahi.

Arre, darne ki kya baat hai? Opportunity toh hai! I've been researching universities in Canada. Fees thoda zyada hai, but scholarships bhi toh milte hain na? Let's check together, maybe we can find something suitable for both of us.

Canada? Not bad! But I was thinking more like UK. Culture bhi thoda familiar hai, plus language barrier bhi nahi hoga. But visa ka process kitna complicated hai yaar. I heard it's a total headache. Any idea about that?

Haan, visa toh tricky hai. But we can go to those education consultants, right? They handle all that paperwork. Plus, let's start preparing for IELTS or TOEFL. Achha score toh chahiye hi. We should start studying together, kya bolti hai?

IELTS toh pakka karna padega. Okay, deal! We'll study together. Aur sun, parents ko kaise manayenge? They'll be worried sick if we go so far. Especially my mom, she's already emotional about me leaving for college.

That's the biggest challenge, I know! We'll have to convince them that this is a good investment for our future. We can show them the career prospects and higher salaries after studying abroad. Let's make a presentation for them!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? I was thinking, life mein kuch naya try karna chahiye. I've been feeling stuck lately, you know? Same routine, same old grind. Need to shake things up a bit, bhai.
Haan yaar, I feel you! Main bhi soch raha tha. Office aur ghar bas. Kuch toh karna padega. Maybe we should pick up a new skill together? Online courses are quite trending, heard they are pretty good.

That's a good idea! What kind of skill, though? Coding is too mainstream, right? I was thinking more along the lines of something creative, like photography or maybe even learning an instrument, like guitar.
Guitar would be awesome! Imagine us jamming together. But photography is also good, especially with all the travel we do. Let’s check out some courses this weekend. We can start with a free trial.
Done deal! This weekend we explore options. But also, I've been meaning to get back into fitness. Join kar gym, kya? Summer is coming, and I need to shed some of this lockdown weight, dost.

Perfect! Gym is a great idea. I’ll join too. We can motivate each other. Aur diet bhi control karna padega, sirf gym se nahi hoga. Challenge accepted then, new skills and fitness goals! Let's do this!
Accha suno, I'm thinking of suggesting a coffee and book date this weekend. There's this cute bookstore near my place, 'The Book Nook'. You think that's a good idea for a first date, na?

Haan haan, that sounds lovely! 'The Book Nook' is perfect – cozy vibes, good coffee, and plenty to talk about. Much better than a noisy bar. Go for it! Just make sure they also like books, otherwise it'll be awkward.

Exactly my thought process! I remember him saying he enjoys reading, so fingers crossed. I'll suggest it then. Should I specify a time, or just say 'this weekend'? I don't want to sound too eager, you know?
Relax, ya! Suggest a specific time, like Saturday afternoon around 3 pm. That's casual enough, not too much pressure. Plus, if it goes well, you can always extend it to dinner. Smart, hai na?

Wah, you're a total dating guru! Saturday 3 pm it is. Now, what should I wear? Something casual but cute? I don't want to look like I tried too hard, but also want to make a good impression, obviously.

Definitely casual but cute! Think jeans and a nice top, or a flowy kurta. Something comfortable that you can actually sit and read in. And don't forget a little bit of kajal – always works! All the best, yaar!
Okay guys, Christmas aa raha hai! Decorations ka kya plan hai?
Meera, last year wale lights toh hain. Kuch naya try karein?
Haan, this time handmade ornaments banate hain. Aur sweets mein kya distribute karein?
Gujiya toh must hai! Aur maybe kuch cookies bhi?
Perfect! Gujiya aur cookies done. Decorations ka material kab layenge?
Kal shaam ko chalte hain, Meera. Sab kuch le aayenge!
Hey! Work-life balance in a relationship, tricky hai na? First, set clear boundaries. No work talk after 9 pm, agreed?
Agreed! But what if there's a deadline? Yaar, office toh office hai.
Okay, emergencies happen. But make it an exception, not the rule. Compensate with extra quality time later, promise?
That sounds fair. Aur kuch tips? I'm all ears, boss!
Schedule date nights like meetings! Treat them seriously. Phone calls aside, just us time. Samajh aaya?
Haan, date nights are important. Noted! Thanks, Rohit, these are actually helpful. Cheers!
Socho, family ke liye healthy meals kaise plan karein? I'm thinking more veggies and less junk.
Haan, that's a good idea. Maybe we can start with adding more fruits to breakfast?
Perfect! Aur lunch mein, let's try to pack more homemade food instead of relying on outside options.
Agreed. What about dinner? Maybe some light soups and salads?
Bilkul! And we can also try to incorporate millets into our diet. They're super healthy, you know?
Sounds like a plan! Let's make a list of healthy recipes and stick to it.
Beta's grades are slipping. I think I need to schedule a parent-teacher meeting. Kya bolti hai?
Yeah, Mom, that's probably a good idea. I've been struggling a bit in maths lately.
Okay, I'll email the teacher tomorrow. Any specific concerns I should mention besides maths, or sab theek hai?
Nah, just maths. Everything else is manageable, I think. Thanks, Mom.
Cool. I'll ask for a time that works for both of us. Maybe we can grab some chai after, kya kehti ho?
Sounds good, Mom! Thanks for helping me out with this. I appreciate it.
Baby, I'm thinking of a surprise weekend getaway. Kya kehte ho?
That sounds amazing! Where are you thinking of going?
I was thinking maybe a cozy hill station? Somewhere with good views and chai.
Ooh, I love that! When were you planning on going?
Next weekend? I'll handle everything, just pack a bag, okay?
Deal! You're the best, Ananya. I'm so excited!
Yaar, anniversary aa rahi hai, kya gift doon? I'm totally blank.
Hmm, depends on what she likes! Jewellery? Experience gift? Kuch personalized?
Jewellery toh hai kaafi. Experience... like kya? Aur personalized mein kya karoon?
Experience mein, maybe a hot air balloon ride? Ya personalized mein, a photo album of your memories?
Photo album is a good idea! I'm a photographer, after all. Hot air balloon... thoda risky lag raha hai.
Haha, fair enough! Then go with the photo album. Add some handwritten notes too, romantic lagega!
Okay guys, Ganesh Chaturthi is around the corner! Decorations ka kya plan hai?
Hum traditional rangoli banate hain, aur maybe kuch fairy lights bhi laga denge?
Sounds good! Aur sweets? Modak toh must hai, aur kya banaye?
Laddu aur barfi bhi bana sakte hain. Enough variety rahegi.
Perfect! Distribution ka kya scene hai? Who all are we sending sweets to?

Oh great! Class ke baad chal ke le aate hain.
Haan, chalte hain. Size ka issue na ho bas.
Hopefully sahi size diya hoga unhone.
Fingers crossed!
Bike ki key kahin rakh di, mil nahi rahi.
Aaram se yaad kar, last kahan use ki thi?
Class se aane ke baad room mein hi rakhi thi shayad.
Desk pe, bag mein, ya jeans ki pocket mein check kiya?
Har jagah dekh liya yaar. Tension ho rahi hai.
Chal main bhi help karta hoon dhoondhne mein. Mil jayegi.
Cultural fest mein stall lagane ka soch raha hoon. Kya bechoon?
Food stall hamesha chalta hai. Ya phir kuch games rakh le chote mote.
Food ka idea achha hai. Maggi ya Momos?
Momos zyada bikenge I think. Variety rakh lena thodi.
Sahi hai. Permission leni padegi pehle.
Haan, committee se baat kar le.
Yaar, English communication improve karni hai. Tips dega?
Movies/Series English mein dekh subtitles ke saath. Aur thoda bolne ki practice kar friends ke saath.
Hesitation hoti hai bolne mein.
Start mein hogi. Mirror ke saamne practice kar. Ya phir chote chote sentences se start kar.
Koi app suggest karega?
Duolingo try kar sakta hai basics ke liye. Ya phir Elsa Speak pronunciation ke liye.
Alumni meet kab hai is saal?
Usually December mein hoti hai. Abhi date announce nahi hui hai.
Jaana chahiye. Networking ke liye achha chance hota hai.
Haan, kaafi seniors aate hain achhi positions pe.
Resume update karke rakhna padega.
Bilkul. Opportunity miss nahi karni chahiye.
Blood donation camp laga hai college mein. Chalega donate karne?
Haan, achha kaam hai. Kab tak hai camp?
Shaam 4 baje tak hai. Lunch ke baad chalte hain.
Okay done. Pehle kuch kha lena achhe se.
Haan, woh toh hai. Weakness nahi honi chahiye.
Sahi hai. Chal milte hain lunch ke baad.
Marksheet mein naam galat print ho gaya hai. Correction kaise hoga?
Exam cell mein application deni padegi. Saath mein ID proof lagana hoga.
Kitna time lagta hai correction mein?
Thoda time lag sakta hai. Follow up karte rehna padega.
Okay. Kal hi jaake process start karta hoon.
Haan, delay mat karna.
Aaj mausam ajeeb hai na? Garmi bhi hai aur baadal bhi.
Haan, humidity bohot hai. Baarish ho jaaye toh rahat mile.
Lecture mein AC bhi nahi chal raha dhang se.
Sahi mein yaar. Neend aa rahi hai bas.
Chal class ke baad lassi peene chalte hain.
Mast idea! Thandak milegi.
Placement ke liye company specific preparation kaise karein?
Company ki website check kar, unke values, recent news padh. Glassdoor pe interview experiences dekh.
Aptitude aur technical round ke liye?
Previous year questions solve kar uss company ke. Aur jis role ke liye apply kar raha hai usse related concepts revise kar.
Okay, yeh sahi approach lag rahi hai.
Haan, targeted preparation se help milti hai.
Wifi bohot slow chal रहा है आज।
Haan yaar, mera bhi same haal hai. Complaint ki kisi ne?
Pata nahi. Karni padegi shayad hostel office mein.
Chal, class ke baad saath mein chal ke bol aate hain.
Theek hai. Assignment upload karna hai, ho hi nahi raha.
Haan, problem toh hai.
Farewell party ke liye contribution kitna karna hai?
Abhi final nahi hua hai. Committee decide karke batayegi.
Okay. Venue decide ho gaya?
Haan, college auditorium mein hi hai shayad.
Theek hai. Dress code kya hoga?
Formals ya ethnic wear hoga most probably.
Yaar, bore ho raha hoon. Kuch game khele?
Kya khelega? Mobile pe ya PC pe?
Mobile pe hi. Ludo ya Chess?
Chess khelte hain. Thoda dimaag lagega.
Chal theek hai. Online aa jaa.
Okay, aa raha hoon.
Industrial visit ka plan ban raha hai kya is semester?
Suna toh hai HOD sir plan kar rahe hain. Abhi final nahi hai.
Kahan jaane ka plan hai?
Koi local industry hi hogi shayad. Paas mein hi.
Chalo, kuch toh practical exposure milega.
Haan, woh important hai.
Breakfast mein kya tha aaj mess mein?
Poha tha. Theek thaak hi tha.
Maine miss kar diya. Ab seedha lunch hi karunga.
Kuch bahar se manga le na? Canteen se sandwich?
Nahi yaar, ab class hai. Lunch break mein hi dekhenge.
Okay. Bhook lagegi phir toh.
Volunteering ke liye sign up kiya kya? NSS camp ka.
Haan, kar diya. Gaon mein jaana hai is baar.
Mast experience rehta hai uska. Maine last year kiya tha.
Haan, suna hai. Kuch social work karenge wahaan.
Good. Certificate bhi milta hai uska.
Haan, resume mein add karne ke kaam aayega.
Printer kaam nahi kar raha lab mein. Assignment print karna tha.
Market se karwa le print phir. Paas mein hi hai shop.
Haan, wahi karna padega. Kitna lete hain per page?
Shayad 2 rupees black and white ka.
Theek hai. Chal, class ke baad chalta hoon.
Okay.
Sports meet kab hai? Practice shuru karni hai.
Next month hai shayad. Abhi se practice karega?
Haan, 100m race mein part lena hai. Stamina build karna padega.
Sahi hai. Main toh bas fun events mein participate karunga.
Tug of war mein aa jaana phir.
Haan, usmein pakka!
Aaj movie night rakhein room pe? Projector hai tere paas?
Haan, projector hai. Kaunsi movie dekhenge?
Koi comedy ya sci-fi? Sabka mood ban jaaye.
Sci-fi aacchi rahegi. 'Interstellar' dekhein dobara?
Mast choice! Done karte hain. Popcorn ka intezaam main kar lunga.
Perfect! Dinner ke baad start karte hain.
Oye sun na, it's 2 AM and I'm craving something मीठा. Dimag mein sirf gulab jamun chal raha hai. Kya karein yaar? Bhook bhi lagi hai, neend bhi aa rahi hai.
Arre bhai, same pinch! I was just thinking about jalebi. Itni raat ko kahaan milega? Swiggy bhi band ho gaya hoga. Momos chaleinge kya? Woh toh mil jaate hai.
Momos? Thik hai, lekin woh chutney spicy honi chahiye. Aise feeke momos nahi khaane. Yaar, I wish we had some leftover biryani from yesterday. Woh kya mast bani thi!
Haan, biryani toh kamaal thi. Chalo, momos order karte hai. Extra spicy chutney bolenge. Aur agar woh nahi hua toh maggi bana le? 2 minute wali, apna jugaad.
Maggi is a good backup plan. Momos try karte hai, nahi toh phir maggi hi sahi. Kal subah gym mein double workout karna padega, yeh sab khaane ke baad. Diet gaya tel lene!
Exactly! Diet-shiet subah dekhenge. Abhi toh bas pet puja. Okay, momos are ordered! Ready ho jao, spicy treat is on its way! Raat ko yeh cravings bhi na...!
Oye sunn, yeh toh bata, study abroad ka kya scene hai? Maine suna tu GRE ki tayyari kar raha hai. Serious plan hai kya, ya phir aise hi timepass chal raha hai?

Arre bhai, serious plan hai! I mean, I'm really hoping to get into a good university. GRE toh bas ek step hai. Canada ya US dekhenge, depending on scholarships and all. Paisa bhi toh matter karta hai na.
Haan, woh toh hai. Tuition fees aur living expenses, sab mila ke bohot kharcha ho jaata hai. Gharwale raazi hain? Unka kya kehna hai is baare mein?
Gharwale thode hesitant toh hain, but they understand ki opportunities zyada milengi. I've promised them ki I'll work hard and send money back home. Plus, I'll only go if I get a decent scholarship.
That's a good way to convince them. Which course ka soch raha hai? Aur visa process wagera ka kuch idea hai kya? Woh bhi toh bada jhanjhat hota hai.

Thinking of Masters in Data Science or something related to AI. Visa ka toh research chal raha hai. Agents se bhi baat kar raha hoon. It's a long process, but I'm hoping everything will fall into place.
Arey bhai sahab, Ganesh Chaturthi ki tayari kaisi chal rahi hai? Meera ji, aap toh rangoli aur lighting ki master hain. Is baar kya special plan hai?
Haan ji, tayari toh full swing mein hai. Is baar thoda traditional touch dene ka socha hai. Rangoli mein peacock design banayenge aur lighting mein warm colours use karenge, zyada flashy nahi.
Wah, peacock design! Sunne mein hi kitna sundar lag raha hai. Warna aaj kal toh sab log fancy lighting aur modern designs ke peeche bhagte hain. Traditional is always the best, hai na?
Bilkul! Traditional ka apna charm hai. Bachchon ko bhi humari sanskriti se jode rakhna zaroori hai. Rangoli banana bhi ek art hai, jo humari peedhiyon se chali aa rahi hai.
Sahi kaha aapne. Main bhi apni beti ko sikhaunga rangoli banana. Aap bataiye, lighting ka kya scene hai? LED lights ya phir traditional diyas bhi use karengi?

LED lights toh energy efficient hain, lekin diyas ka apna hi alag mahatva hai. So, I'm planning to use a mix of both. Diyas for the main aarti area and LED lights for the rest of the decoration. Balance bana rahega.

Arre suno toh, I was talking to Rekha aunty yesterday. Do you know about promotion? She's now heading the entire design team! Imagine, from intern to head in just five years! Itna hard work aur dedication hai usme.
Sachchi? That's amazing news! toh hamesha se hi brilliant thi. Remember how she used to ace all her exams? Lagta hai, uska luck bhi saath de raha hai. Good for her! I always knew she’d go far.

Haan yaar, and you won't believe it, she's also been nominated for some architecture award. National level award hai! Rekha aunty was saying the competition is tough, but has a good chance of winning. Kitni khush hogi woh.

Wow, that’s incredible! I'm so happy for her. She deserves all the accolades. We should definitely plan a surprise party for her. What do you say? Somewhere nice, maybe a rooftop restaurant with a view.

That's a great idea! I'm in. Let's get a few more people involved. Maybe Leela and Sameer too? We can coordinate everything over WhatsApp. This calls for a proper celebration. I'm so proud of her, seriously.
Perfect! I'll create a group right away. Let’s make it a memorable one for her. She’s worked so hard, it’s time to celebrate her success. I'm already excited! Let's plan the menu and decorations too.
Beta, ab toh college form bharne ka time aa gaya. Socha kya hai, aage kya padhna hai? Doctor, engineer, ya kuch aur interesting karna hai?
Maa, I'm still confused, yaar. Sab bolte hain engineering kar lo, scope hai. But mujhe toh coding se zyada design mein interest hai. UX designer banne ka mann hai.
Dekh, scope toh har field mein hai agar dil se kaam kare toh. UX designer bhi toh kitna demand mein hai aaj kal. Companies ko achche designers chahiye apni apps aur websites ke liye.
Haan, woh toh hai. But papa keh rahe the ki isme zyada competition hai. Aur starting mein salary bhi kam hoti hai. Engineering mein toh placement pakka hota hai.

Beta, placement toh important hai, but khushi bhi toh honi chahiye na kaam mein? Let's research UX design courses and career paths properly. Phir decide karenge, okay? Don't worry, we'll figure it out together.
Okay, maa. Thank you! I feel much better now. Chalo, saath mein dekhte hain. Maybe we can find some internships too, so I can get a feel for what it's really like before committing.

Oye, sunn! Remember that time in college when we accidentally swapped our project submissions? I ended up presenting your disastrous attempt at recreating a Mughal miniature in Photoshop, and you had my abstract art that looked like a spilled chai stain! What a mess!

Arre bhai! How can I forget? Professor Sharma's face was priceless! He kept asking me about the 'deep symbolism' of the chai stain. I just mumbled something about 'post-modern deconstruction of Mughal art.' Saved my life, that did! What a bakra I made of myself.

And then there was the hostel warden's surprise visit during the 'study group' session. Remember all the textbooks hastily hidden under the bed, replaced by the latest Bollywood gossip magazine? Classic! I think someone even chucked a half-eaten samosa under there.

Haan yaar, aur woh samosa was never seen again! Legend has it, it's still lurking under bed number 42, a relic of our glorious college days. We were so lucky that warden uncle didn't find the 'evidence'. He was so strict about everything.

Don't forget the time we tried to sneak into the girls' hostel disguised as delivery guys! Remember the ridiculously fake moustaches and the oversized pizza boxes? That plan went south faster than a plate of hot jalebis in winter. We were caught!

Arre, that was epic failure! The girls recognized us instantly, thanks to your bright orange shirt! And then we had to do 'murga' in front of the entire college! But hey, at least we provided some entertainment, right? Good times, good times!
Oye, sunn! New job pakka? Congrats yaar! But tell me, salary kya scene hai? Negotiate kiya ya chup chap haan bol di? Bata bhai, tension ho raha hai. Market mein kya rate chal raha hai, idea toh de.

Arre, thanks bhai! Offer toh aaya, but obviously negotiate kiya. Starting mein thoda kam bolte hain, phir dheere dheere badhana padta hai. I asked for a 20% hike, they countered with 15%. Phir maine benefits aur perks bhi add karwaye. Smart bano, bhai!

20%?! Kamal hai! Mujhe toh dar lagta hai jyada mangne mein. I always feel like they'll withdraw the offer. Kya bolna chahiye exactly? Koi mantra hai kya tere paas? Bata de, bhai, zindagi sawar jayegi.

Dekh, confidence dikha. Research kar, similar roles ke liye kya mil raha hai. Highlight your skills and experience. Bol ki you bring value to the table. Aur haan, don't be afraid to walk away. They'll come back if they really want you.

Walk away?! Yeh toh next level advice hai. I can barely look them in the eye while asking for more money. But I guess you're right. Value toh hai mujhmein! Next time, I'll channel my inner Shah Rukh Khan and negotiate like a boss.

Exactly! Attitude rakh, bhai! Aur haan, remember, salary is not everything. Work culture, growth opportunities, team environment, yeh sab bhi important hai. Balance bana ke chal. All the best for your next negotiation!

Accha suno, I finally managed to book those sunset boat ride tickets. It took forever, but I got us the ones with the live music. Hope you're free this Saturday. I know how much you wanted to go. Let me know what you think.

Arre wah! Seriously? That’s fantastic! Live music, you say? You know me too well. Saturday is perfect. I was actually dreading another weekend just Netflix-ing. This sounds way more romantic. Thanks for going through the hassle of booking it!

Haan, Netflix is good and all, but sunset over the water is a different vibe, right? I was thinking we could grab some dinner afterwards at that new seafood place near the Gateway. Heard they have amazing prawns. Does that sound good to you?

Prawns, you say? Now you're just spoiling me! Gateway is perfect, it’s nearby. I'm already picturing the whole evening. Sunset, music, yummy food, and you. Honestly, you’re the best. What time should I be ready by for the boat?

Okay, great! Let's aim for 5:30 PM. That way we can get there a bit early and soak in the atmosphere before the ride actually starts. Wear something comfy but also, you know, date-night appropriate. I'm excited already!

Perfect! 5:30 it is. Comfy but date-night appropriate, got it! I'll find something that strikes the perfect balance. This is going to be so much fun. Thanks again for planning everything. See you on Saturday!

Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I was thinking about that whole drama with… you know who. Seriously, I'm starting to think maybe we need to distance ourselves. It's like, constant negativity and competition, yaar. Kabhi toh accha feel karao.

Haan bhai, I feel you. It's exhausting, isn't it? Every time we hang out, it's just one complaint session after another. And the subtle digs? Ugh! I've been feeling drained after every meet-up. Maybe thoda space is what we need, honestly.

Exactly! It's like, we're supposed to be supporting each other, not constantly comparing ourselves. Remember that time I got that promotion? The way they reacted was so... off. I felt like I had to apologize for succeeding. Kya yaar!

Oh, I remember that! I felt so bad for you. And honestly, I've experienced similar things. It's like they can't be happy for anyone else's success. Maybe it's insecurity, but it's not our job to manage their feelings, right? We deserve better.

Totally! So, what do you think we should do? A direct confrontation feels too dramatic. Maybe just slowly start declining invitations and focusing on other friendships? It's sad, but my mental peace is more important, boss.

I agree. A slow fade-out seems like the best option. No need for unnecessary drama. Let's invest our energy in people who actually uplift us and celebrate our wins. Life is too short for toxic friendships, hai na? Chai piyein? New friends banaate hai!

Oye, kya scene hai? Socha tujhse thodi cultural gup shup karein. I was thinking about how different our families are, even though we've been dosts for ages. Bata na, what's one thing that always cracks you up about my family's traditions?

Arre bhai, kya batau! Your family's obsession with 'shubh muhurat' for everything! Seriously, even for a simple movie night, there's a consultation with the panditji? That's something I'll never understand. But it's endearing, I must admit. What about you and my family?

Ha ha, true that! Panditji is like the family's official decision-maker. But honestly, your family's chill attitude towards everything throws me off sometimes. Like, casually deciding a vacation the night before? My parents would need a year of planning and multiple Excel sheets!

Exactly! We believe in spontaneity, yaar. Zindagi na milegi dobara, you know? But I get your point. Sometimes I feel like your family has a rulebook for every single thing. But hey, that's what makes our friendship so interesting, right? Opposites attract and all that.

Bilkul sahi! Imagine if we were both the same? Zindagi boring ho jaati. I guess that's the beauty of India, na? So many cultures, so many ways of doing things. It's like a constant comedy show, especially during shaadi season.

Arre, don't even get me started on shaadis! The dance-offs, the drama, the endless food… It's a whole other level of cultural extravaganza! But at the end of the day, we all just want to celebrate life and family, right? So, chal, chai peete hai and celebrate our differences!

Oye! Kya chal raha hai? Socha tha gym jayega aaj? I'm still debating. Kal raat biryani zyaada ho gayi, yaar. Feeling so bloated. Should I even bother going? Tu bata, what's your fitness plan looking like?

Arre bhai, gym toh jaana hi hai! Biryani toh chalti rahegi. I'm focusing on cardio this week. Need to shed some kilos before Diwali. Maybe try some Zumba? Heard it's a fun way to burn calories. Tu bhi chal, mazaa aayega.

Zumba? Me? Na baba na! My dance moves are strictly limited to shaadis after a few drinks. But cardio sounds good. Maybe I'll just hit the treadmill. What time are you planning to go? I'll try and drag myself there too.

Perfect! I was thinking around 6 pm. We can motivate each other. Plus, that new protein shake place opened up near the gym. Post-workout reward, what say? It's healthy, promise! No more biryani for a week, deal?

Deal! 6 pm it is. Protein shake sounds tempting. But if they have a chocolate flavour, all bets are off. Waise, I was also thinking of starting yoga. Heard it's good for stress. Koi achha class pata hai kya?

Yeah, I know a good yoga instructor. She takes classes online. I'll send you her details. We can even do a session together sometime. Double the motivation, right? See you at the gym then! No excuses!
Accha suno, Diwali toh aa rahi hai, aur ghar mein rangoli aur lighting ka kya plan hai? Mummy ji ne kuch socha hai ya phir humein hi sab karna hai?

Mummy ji ne kaha ki rangoli toh tum hi banaogi, Priyanka. Tumhara design sabko pasand aata hai. Aur lighting ka bhi tum hi dekh lo, LED lights lagani hai ya phir traditional diyas use karna hai, decide kar lo.

Okay, fine. Rangoli mein toh phool use karungi, ekdum traditional look ayega. Lighting mein mix karte hain, kuch LED aur kuch diyas. Par bhaiyya ko bhi toh bolo help karne ke liye, akele kaise hoga sab?
Haan, bhaiyya ko bol dungi woh decorations mein help kar dega. Tum bas rangoli aur lighting ka design final kar lo. Phir Diwali shopping ke liye bhi jana hai, list bana lena.
Theek hai, main ek design soch rahi hu, peacock theme pe. Lights bhi arrange kar leti hu. Shopping list bhi ready hai, bas mithai ki dukaan decide karni hai, kahan se leni hai is baar.
Haldiram's se le lete hain, unki quality achchi hoti hai. Aur haan, patakhe kam phodna, pollution bohot badh gaya hai. Chalo, Diwali ki tayari shuru karte hain, dhoom dhaam se manayenge!
Oye, sunn, yeh MBBS toh jaan le lega! Screen time itna badh gaya hai online lectures ke wajah se. Aankhein bhi thak jaati hain aur padhai bhi dhang se nahi hoti. How are you managing, bhai?

Haan bhai, same problem idhar bhi. I've started using blue light filters on my laptop and phone. Thoda farak padta hai. And I try to take breaks every hour. 10 minutes ka walk ya stretching, something to get the blood flowing.

That sounds like a good idea. I was thinking of implementing the Pomodoro technique. 25 minutes study, 5 minutes break. Repeat. Maybe that'll help me stay focused and reduce the constant screen gazing. What do you think?

Pomodoro is awesome! I tried it during my prep for the anatomy exams. It really helped with concentration. Just make sure you actually take the breaks, warna burnout ho jayega. Aur chai-shai pee lena beech mein.

Haan, chai toh zaroori hai! Warna dimag kaise chalega? I'll try the Pomodoro thing starting tomorrow. Thanks for the advice, yaar. Let's see if I can finally conquer this syllabus before the next internal exam.
All the best, bhai! Remember to prioritize sleep too. No point studying if you're too tired to remember anything. And don't forget to breathe! We got this, doctor saab! Let's kill it!
Oye, tension ho rahi hai yaar. First date hai, rooftop restaurant mein. Kya pehnu? Casual theek rahega ya thoda formal hona chahiye? Dimag kharab ho raha hai, kuch samajh nahi aa raha.
Relax bhai, itni tension mat le. Rooftop hai toh smart casual chalega. Ek achi shirt aur chinos try kar. Sneakers avoid kar, loafers ya derbys better lagenge. Aur perfume thoda sa lagana, zyada nahi.
Hmm, shirt aur chinos... theek hai. Lekin kaunsi shirt? Mere paas toh plain white bhi hai aur ek striped blue bhi. Aur chinos mein beige ya navy blue? Confusion hi confusion hai, life mein.
Blue striped shirt and beige chinos are a safe bet, bhai. Classy bhi lagega aur zyada effort bhi nahi dikhega. Cuff the chinos a little bit. You'll look sharp. Trust me, I know these things.
Alright, blue striped shirt aur beige chinos final. Shoes loafers hi pehen leta hu. Watch kaunsi dalu? I have a metal strap one aur ek leather strap wali bhi hai. Batao fatafat.
Leather strap watch will go better with the outfit. Metal strap zyada formal ho jayega. And most importantly, be yourself. All the best for your date! Mujhe baad mein sab update dena.
Accha suno, Christmas aa raha hai! Is baar ghar pe decorations kaise karenge? Kids bhi excited hain. Aur sweets ka kya plan hai? Kuch traditional banayein ya phir bakery se order karein?

Haan, Diwali ke baad ab Christmas ki tayyari! Decorations mein toh woh LED lights laga dete hain jo online dekhi thi. Aur sweets mein, I think gujiya aur nankhatai try karte hain. Kids ko bhi mazaa aayega.

Gujiya toh Diwali mein banayi thi, kuch different try karte hain. Cake aur cookies ka kya scene hai? Woh bhi toh Christmasy hota hai. Aur decorations mein Santa hat aur reindeer antlers bhi add karte hain.
Cake aur cookies perfect rahega! Woh neighbor aunty bahut achha cake banati hain, unse order karein kya? Aur decorations ke liye woh Christmas tree bhi toh nikaalna hai attic se. Kids ki help lenge.
Haan aunty se cake order kar lete hain. Christmas tree nikaalna is weekend ka project hai. Aur woh Santa costume bhi dhundhna padega. Kids ke school mein Christmas party bhi hai.
Perfect! Toh is weekend decorations ka kaam shuru karte hain aur aunty ko cake ka order de dete hain. Kids ko bhi bata dena, Santa costume ready rakhne ko. Christmas vibe set karte hain!

Arre suno suno! This Holi, I'm thinking of organizing a proper community event in our neighborhood. Warna sab apne apne ghar mein hi rang khelte reh jaate hain. What do you guys think? Should we go for it?

Bhabhi ji, that's a brilliant idea! But organizing it is a big responsibility. Who will handle the rang, the music, and, most importantly, the food? Aur budget ka kya scene rahega? We need to plan everything properly.

Haan, that's true. I was thinking we could ask everyone to contribute a small amount. Rang toh eco-friendly wala hi use karenge. Music DJ se baat kar lenge. Food stalls bhi lagwa sakte hain, local vendors se.

Perfect! Eco-friendly rang is a must. Aur food stalls se toh maza hi aa jayega. Golgappe, chaat, dahi bhalle... mouthwatering! I can help with contacting the DJ and coordinating the music playlist. Bollywood hits only, okay?

Awesome! You're a lifesaver. I'll handle the rang and try to get some sponsors for the event. Maybe the local kirana store or the mithai shop will be interested. Let's make this Holi the best one yet!

Bilkul! This Holi, poora mohalla ek saath rang mein doob jayega. I'll start spreading the word. Dhol bhi arrange kar lete hain? Holi without dhol is like chai without sugar, totally incomplete! Let's do this!

Arre yaar, Jaipur mein coffee scene toh boom kar raha hai! Batao, which cafe do you think has the absolute best coffee? I'm on a quest to find the perfect cup. So far, nothing's really hitting the spot, you know?

Accha suno, I've been trying a few places too. For me, Tapri Central's vibe is great, but their coffee is okay. Maybe try Curious Life Coffee Roasters? Their cold brew is pretty strong, and the ambience is chill. Worth a shot, I think!

Curious Life, huh? Never tried it! Tapri's coffee is definitely average, agreed. I'm looking for something with that real coffee kick, like a proper Italian espresso. Is Curious Life too hipster-ish, or does it actually deliver on the taste front?

Nah, it's not just hype, trust me. They focus on the beans themselves. Plus, they have different brewing methods. Try their pour-over; it's less milky and lets the coffee flavour shine through. The place is a bit small, but the coffee makes up for it, I promise.

Okay, pour-over at Curious Life it is! Next on my list. Otherwise, I was thinking maybe Anokhi Cafe? Their food is fab, but I haven't tried their coffee seriously. Is it just a side thing for them, or do they actually put some effort into it?

Anokhi's coffee is decent, but honestly, it's more about the overall experience there. The coffee is like, an accompaniment to the shopping and the ambience. For a serious coffee fix, Curious Life is definitely the better bet. Let me know what you think!
Oye, kya scene hai? You look like you've seen bhoot. Sab theek toh hai na? Bata na yaar, why so down? I thought you were supposed to be all loved up. What happened suddenly?
Kya batau bhai. It's over. Done. Finito. We broke up last night. I'm feeling like a proper loser, you know? Like I messed everything up. Samajh nahi aa raha kya karu.

Arre bhai, chill maar. Breakups happen. It's not the end of the world. Remember what happened with Meera and Rohan? Life goes on, boss. Don't dwell too much. Let’s go for chai, dimag thoda refresh hoga.
Chai se kya hoga yaar? My heart is broken into a million pieces. I don’t think chai can fix this. But fine, chalte hai. Maybe some samosas too? Shayad thoda better feel hoga.
Exactly! Samosas and chai solve almost everything. And listen, this too shall pass. You're a great guy. You'll find someone even better. Don't lose hope. Just focus on yourself for a while, ok?

Thanks, bhai. I really appreciate that. You're right, I need to focus on myself. Maybe hit the gym, learn that guitar I always wanted to. Okay, samosa and chai it is. Let's go, I need the distraction.

Accha suno, Goa ka monsoon toh alag hi level ka hai na? Kabhi dhoop, kabhi baarish. Prediction karna toh impossible hai. I swear, I've seen it rain for five minutes and then the sun shines like nothing happened.

Haan yaar, bilkul sahi kaha tumne. Goa mein baarish ka koi schedule nahi hota. Ekdum mood swings jaisa. I remember last year, I was at the beach and suddenly it started pouring. Bhagwan kasam, sab log has rahe the.

Exactly! Aur woh humidity toh jaan le leti hai. Baarish ke baad itni chipchip hoti hai ki lagta hai nahakar bhi koi faayda nahi. Makeup toh five minutes bhi nahi tikta. I feel like giving up sometimes.
Arre, uski toh baat hi mat karo. I bought a new foundation, thinking it was waterproof. Lekin Goa ki humidity ne usko bhi hara diya. I looked like a ghost after an hour. Total waste of money!

Hahaha, same here! I tried wearing a silk saree for a wedding, thinking it would be elegant. But the monsoon had other plans. I was so uncomfortable and sticky the whole time. I felt like a drowned rat.

Seriously! Goa mein monsoon mein fashion ka toh koi scene hi nahi hai. Just wear something light and breathable, and pray that you don't get completely drenched. Aur hamesha ek umbrella saath rakho, just in case. It's the only way to survive!
Oye, Navratri ke liye kya plan hai? Office mein toh sab boring 'Hi Tea' bol rahe hain. Kuch dhamakedar karte hain na, iss baar. Rangoli competition rakh dein?
Haan, rangoli competition toh sahi hai. Lekin lighting ka kya? Sirf rangoli se toh feel nahi aayegi. Kuch Diwali jaisa karna padega, you know, lights wagera lagake. Budget bhi dekhna padega.

Budget ki tension mat le. Thoda contribution kar lenge sab. Rangoli ke liye colors aur lights ke liye LED strips Amazon se manga lenge. Last year jo Diwali lights kharidi thi, woh bhi use kar sakte hain kya?
Woh Diwali lights toh box mein padi hongi. Check karna padega ki chalti bhi hain ya nahi. Rangoli design kya soccha hai? Kuch traditional ya phir modern art wala scene karein?
Traditional hi rakhte hain. Radha-Krishna ya phir Durga Maa ka design. Lights mein bhi mix and match karenge – kuch colorful, kuch warm white. Boss ko manana padega, permission ke liye.
Boss toh maan jayenge, unko bhi toh photo opportunity chahiye. Main lights ka order place kar deta hu. Tum rangoli colors ka dekh lo. Kal tak final karte hain sab kuch. Jai Mata Di!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Been meaning to ask, yeh Flipkart aur Amazon ka sale kab khatam hoga? I need to buy a new phone cover, yaar. My old one is literally falling apart.

Arre, mujhe kya pata bhai! But seriously, yeh sales toh kabhi khatam hi nahi hote. Lagta hai, hamesha koi na koi offer chalta hi rehta hai. Which phone do you have again? Maybe I can suggest something.
I have a Redmi Note 10. I was thinking of getting a funky pop socket wali cover. You know, something to jazz it up a little. Warna it looks so boring. What do you think? Should I check on Myntra too?
Myntra for phone covers? Thoda zyada nahi ho gaya? But haan, a pop socket is a good idea. Makes holding the phone so much easier, especially when you're watching videos or taking selfies. Go for it!

Haan, but Myntra has some cool accessories sometimes. Okay, I'll stick to Flipkart then. Accha, did you see that new movie trailer? Looks totally paisa vasool. We should go watch it this weekend, right?
Definitely! Movie toh pakka. And while we're at it, let's grab some golgappe afterwards. Deal? But first, find that perfect phone cover. Send me the link when you find something you like!
Accha suno, Rakhi ka plan kya hai iss baar? I was just thinking about how different it used to be when we were kids. Remember those huge family gatherings, almost like a mini-Diwali?

Haan yaar, bilkul! Ab toh sab apne apne sheher mein settle ho gaye hain. Lekin bachpan mein Rakhi matlab full-on drama. New dress, rakhi selection mein itna tension, aur phir bhai se gift ke liye bargaining!

Exactly! Aur woh rakhi jo bhaiyon ko pasand nahi aati thi, but they had to wear them anyway, with all the cartoon characters. My older brother used to complain so much, but secretly he loved showing them off to his friends.

Haha, same here! And the food! Mummy ke haath ke pakwaan, specially gujiya aur mathri. I remember stuffing my face until I couldn’t move. Ab toh diet ka bhi tension rehta hai, bachpan mein koi fikar nahi thi.
True that! Aur woh chanda collect karna for Rakhi gifts? I used to team up with my cousins to get the best possible present. Now, it's just a formality. Miss those carefree days, you know?

Totally! Those were the golden days. This year, I'm thinking of sending rakhis and sweets to all my cousins, just to relive a bit of that bachpan wala Rakhi. Let's try to keep the tradition alive, what say?

Accha suno, I just finished 'The Midnight Library' by Matt Haig. Kya book thi yaar! It's about regrets and second chances. You know, the 'what ifs' of life. Have you read it? I was thinking of you when I finished it.

Arre wah! No, I haven't read that one. But it sounds right up my alley! I'm currently reading 'Pachinko' by Min Jin Lee. It's a sweeping historical saga about a Korean family in Japan. Bohot emotional aur gripping hai. You should check it out too!

Pachinko? Sounds interesting! I like historical fiction. Okay, I'll add it to my list. What did you like most about it? For me, 'The Midnight Library' really made me think about the choices I've made and if I'm living the life I truly want. Deep stuff, you know?

The characters in Pachinko are so well-developed, and their struggles felt so real. It’s a beautiful exploration of family, resilience, and identity. I cried buckets! And about your book, that's exactly what I need right now. I've been feeling stuck lately, so maybe a dose of 'what ifs' is good.

Totally! It will make you question everything. Seriously though, 'Pachinko' sounds amazing. I need a good cry sometimes. I'll download it tonight. Maybe we can discuss both books next week over chai? My treat, of course. Tell me when you are free.

Chai pe charcha and book reviews? Perfect! I'm free next Wednesday evening. We can go to that new cafe near my place? They make awesome masala chai. And yes, prepare for some serious feels with 'Pachinko'. You won't regret it. See you then!
Oye, kya scene hai? I'm so confused about what to do after graduation. Engineering toh karli, but coding mein itna interest nahi aa raha. Papa chahte hain MBA karoon. What are you thinking?

Arre yaar, same pinch! Gharwale are pushing for government job exams. But I’m more inclined towards digital marketing, you know? Instagram reels dekh dekh ke dimag mein ideas aate rehte hain. Koi creative field mein jaana hai.

Digital marketing? Interesting! But will it pay well, dude? Woh sab toh theek hai, but at the end of the day, roti, kapda, aur makaan bhi toh chahiye. MBA mein placement toh guaranteed type hota hai, right?

Placement guaranteed? That's a myth, bhai. And I'm sure digital marketing mein bhi scope hai, if you hustle right. Plus, the work-life balance seems better than the corporate grind. Freelance bhi kar sakte hain, apni marzi ke maalik.

Hmm, freelance sounds appealing. But risky bhi toh hai na? Startup culture is booming, maybe something there? I saw a posting for a data analyst role. Pays decent, but coding phir bhi karni padegi. Dilemma hi dilemma hai!

Dekh, jo dil kare woh kar. Don't just follow the crowd or pressure from family. We're young, we can experiment! Maybe try a few internships in different fields? At least pata toh chalega what clicks. Aur chai piyega?
Accha suno, I'm going on a first date this weekend. Rooftop restaurant scene hai, you know? So, what to wear? I'm totally blanking out. Help a sister out, yaar!
Oye Meera, rooftop, huh? Nice! Don't go too OTT. Something chill but classy. Maybe a flowy midi dress? Or even well-fitted jeans with a nice top and a blazer? Depends on your style, obviously.
Midi dress sounds good, but Delhi ki garmi! Jeans and a top might be more practical. But what kind of top? Something fancy or just a regular one? I don't want to look like I tried too hard, you know?

Haan, Delhi heat is killer! Go for a silk camisole or a dressy blouse with some delicate embroidery. Pair it with those jeans you love and some cute heels or even stylish flats. Accessorize lightly – statement earrings maybe?
Silk camisole sounds perfect! And I have those jhumkas I bought from Janpath last month. Okay, jeans, silk camisole, jhumkas. Now, shoes? Heels are too much, right? Flats it is. Which color, though?

Jhumkas are a great touch! Flats in a metallic shade would look amazing - gold or silver, depending on your outfit. Or even a pop of color if the rest is neutral. Just make sure they're comfy enough for rooftop strolling!

Arre yaar, Mumbai local train ka scene toh batao. I'm studying abroad and coming home for a bit. Heard it's crazy during peak hours. Any tips for surviving the commute? I'm dreading the crowds already.

Oye, Mumbai local is something else! Peak hours are a battlefield, literally. Try to travel off-peak if possible. Ladies' compartment is usually less crowded, but still, be prepared to squeeze. Get a grip on the handrails, or you'll fly.
Off-peak is ideal, but college timings are fixed, right? So, what's the real deal then? Should I just resign myself to being squashed like a samosa in a box? Maybe I should just live on campus, haan?

Campus living is definitely an option if it's available. Otherwise, try to find a group of friends to travel with. It makes the journey a bit more bearable and safer. And learn to push your way through, politely of course! It's an art.

Push politely? That sounds like an oxymoron! Anyways, thanks for the advice. Maybe I should invest in some serious elbow pads. Or perhaps a personal bodyguard for the Mumbai local experience? Wish me luck!

Haha, bodyguard might be overkill! Just keep your phone and valuables close, and be aware of your surroundings. And remember, everyone's in the same boat. Once you get the hang of it, it becomes part of the Mumbai experience. All the best!

Hello! Rakhi toh aa rahi hai, kya plan hai ghar pe decoration ka? Is baar kuch naya karte hain, woh purane wale phool aur rangoli se hatke. Maybe something modern, like fairy lights and some unique diyas?

Haan, bhaiyya, idea toh achha hai. Fairy lights will look really nice! Aur sweets ka kya plan hai? Woh traditional barfi aur ladoo toh honge hi, but can we add something new? Maybe some fusion mithai, like chocolate peda?

Chocolate peda sounds amazing! Aur decoration mein, let's add some Rakhi-themed banners. Maybe we can even get some personalized rakhis this time. Sabko surprise milega. What do you think about a small Rakhi-making competition for the kids?

Rakhi-making competition is a great idea! It will keep them busy and creative. Banners toh definitely lagayenge. Aur sweets mein, maybe we can order some special gujiyas too? Everyone loves those, especially around festive times.

Perfect! Gujiyas are a must. I'll check with that mithai shop near the market; they make the best ones. We should also plan the Rakhi tying ceremony properly. Who's bringing the puja thali and all the necessary stuff for it?

Main le aaungi puja thali. Don't worry, bhaiyya. Aur haan, let's make sure everyone gets a chance to tie Rakhi. No rushing through it this time. This Rakhi should be memorable for everyone in the family, especially the kids.

Sun yaar, date pe kaunsi movie dekhe? I was thinking something light-hearted, you know? Kuch zyada drama nahi chahiye. After a long workout session, I just want to relax and chill. Koi Bollywood rom-com chalegi?

Hmm, Bollywood rom-com toh theek hai, but kuch naya hai kya? I'm kind of bored of the same old stories. Maybe something with a good soundtrack too? Ya phir koi action movie dekhe? I heard Fighter is good, but you may be tired.

Fighter is too much, ya. Rom-com hi better hai. How about 'Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya'? I heard the songs are good and it's supposed to be funny. Plus, Kriti and Shahid look great together. What do you say?

Okay, 'Teri Baaton Mein...' sounds decent. Chalega. But promise me we're getting bhel puri afterwards? I've been craving it all week. Movie ke baad Marine Drive? Perfect romantic date night after a tiring day at the gym!

Done deal! Bhel puri pakka. Marine Drive is sorted. Toh, 'Teri Baaton Mein...' final? I'll book the tickets now itself. Which showtime works for you? Evening wala? We can grab chai before the movie too.

Evening show is perfect. Book the tickets! And yes, chai is a must. Okay, movie done, bhel puri done, Marine Drive done. Now just hoping the movie is actually good, otherwise, you're buying me extra bhel puri!
Arre yaar, suno toh. Did you hear about what all happened with Sharma ji's beta? He's been up to some serious stuff, na?
Sharma ji ka beta? Oh ho, batao batao. Last I heard, he was struggling with his startup. Kya naya dhamaka kar diya usne ab?
Dhamaka toh aisa hai ki seedha moon pe land karega! Apparently, he secured a massive funding round. Like, seriously huge. Ab toh party sharty banti hai, kya bolti?
Wah bhai wah! Sharma ji ka beta toh chhupa rustam nikla. Funding bhi mil gayi? Chalo, good for him. Par kitna mila, kuch idea hai kya? Curiosity toh hogi na.
I heard it's in crores, bhai! Crores! And he's expanding his team, hiring like crazy. I think this is his big break. Usko toh ab bhul hi jaega humein.
Crores? Baap re! Woh toh phir bada aadmi ban gaya. But good for him, yaar. Mehnat toh karta tha. Let's hope he remembers his purane dost when he's sitting on all that money.

Oye sun, I was reading this article online about gender identity. It's so much more than just male or female, you know? I never really thought about it deeply before, lekin ab lagta hai it's important to understand.

Haan yaar, I've seen some stuff on Insta too. It's kinda confusing, right? Like, what does it all *really* mean? I mean, I get the basics, but the nuances are a bit beyond me. Explain karo zara, simple terms mein.

So, basically, gender identity is how you *feel* inside. It's not necessarily the same as the gender you were assigned at birth. Some people might feel like they're a different gender, or maybe none at all. It's all about self-identification, samajh rahi hai?

Accha, okay. So, if someone feels like they're a girl even though they were born a boy, that's their gender identity? Matlab, it's not just about clothes or liking 'girly' things, it's a deeper feeling, right? Thoda clear ho raha hai.

Exactly! It's way deeper than just preferences or stereotypes. And it's not a choice either. It's a real, internal feeling. We just need to be supportive and understanding, even if we don't fully get it. Zaroori hai respect karna.

Got it. Respect is key, definitely. I guess it's like anything else – we need to be open-minded and learn. Thanks for explaining, it makes a lot more sense now. Chal, let's grab some chai and talk more about this. My treat!
Arre bhai, Jaipur ka mausam toh dekho! Kabhi dhoop, kabhi baarish. It's like someone flipped a switch. UX designer ka dimag bhi itna nahi ghoomta jitna yahan ka weather ghoomta hai.
Sahi kaha tumne! Subah office aate waqt toh lag raha tha Rajasthan mein Sahara ban gaya. Aur ab dekho, baarish aisi jaise Mumbai mein flood aa gaya. What's up with this nautanki?
Mujhe toh lagta hai Bhagwan ji bhi confuse ho gaye hain. Unko bhi nahi pata kab dhoop deni hai aur kab baarish. Maybe we should add a 'weather forecast' feature to the Jaipur tourism app?

Haha, that's a great idea! Imagine, 'Jaipur Weather: Aaj baarish hogi ya nahi, toh bhagwan jaane! Stay tuned!' Users will love the unpredictability. But seriously, auto-rickshaw wale aaj lootenge pakka.
Haan yaar, auto wale toh monsoon mein apne rate 3x kar dete hain. It's like they're charging for a helicopter ride instead of a rickshaw ride. Better to just work from home today, I guess?
Exactly! Ghar baithe chai-pakode and enjoy the monsoon madness from the window. At least we can control the AC temperature and not rely on Jaipur's mood swings. Cheers to working from home, then!

Accha suno, Lucknow ka traffic toh hadd hi karta hai. Roz subah school jaate waqt itna jam milta hai, ki aadha din toh wahin nikal jaata hai. Upar se yeh auto wale, kabhi meter se nahi jaate, hamesha extra paise maangte hain.

Haan yaar, sahi keh rahi ho. Lucknow mein commute karna ek jung hai. Metro ban toh gayi hai, lekin sab jagah connect nahi karti. Aur woh e-rickshaw wale toh aur bhi pareshan karte hain, itni slow chalate hain ki traffic aur badh jaata hai.

Exactly! Metro se bhi kahin na kahin auto pakadna padta hai. Aur agar baarish ho jaye toh phir toh puchho hi mat. Roads aise lagte hain jaise nadi ban gayi ho. School pahunchte pahunchte toh aadha make-up utar jaata hai.

Arre yaar, tumhari toh phir bhi job hai. Main toh soch rahi hoon ki office ke paas hi kahin PG dhoondh loon. Kam se kam subah ki tension toh kam hogi. Warna boss ki daant alag se sunni padti hai late pahunchne par.

Woh toh hai. Waise, maine suna hai ki government kuch new flyovers bana rahi hai. Shayad usse kuch farak pade. Lekin mujhe toh darr hai ki construction ke time par aur bhi zyada traffic jam hoga. Uff, yeh Lucknow!

Chalo, dekhte hain kya hota hai. Tab tak, dua karo ki koi magic ho jaye aur Lucknow ka traffic khud hi solve ho jaye. Warna toh hum sab late hote rahenge aur traffic mein hi phas kar reh jayenge. Chai piyogi?
Oye! Kya scene hai? You know, I was thinking about how different our families are, even though we've been best friends since forever. Like, my family is super loud and dramatic about everything.
Arre, tell me about it! My family is the opposite. We're all about keeping things calm and quiet. Koi drama nahi, please! It's like we're living in two different Bollywood movies, no?
Exactly! And the food! Your mom makes the most amazing South Indian food, so subtle and flavorful. My mom's Punjabi cooking is all about butter chicken and maa ki daal – heavy stuff!
Hahaha! True that. But I secretly crave your mom's butter chicken sometimes. It's like a guilty pleasure. Though, I think the biggest difference is our festivals. You guys go all out with Diwali!
Diwali is a full-on event! Lights, sweets, endless card parties. For Pongal, you guys have a quieter celebration, right? More about family and tradition than flashy celebrations.
Yeah, Pongal is more about gratitude and simple joys. But honestly, despite all the differences, that's what makes our friendship so awesome, isn't it? Variety is the spice of life, yaar!
Accha suno, beta. College ke forms bharne ka time aa gaya. What are you thinking of majoring in? Koi idea hai ya sab gol-maal hai abhi bhi?
Maa, I'm still confused, yaar. Everyone's saying engineering or medicine is the safest bet. But mujhe toh art aur creative fields mein zyada interest hai. Kya karu?
Dekho, beta, safe toh sab bolte hain. But at the end of the day, you have to do what you love. Engineering accha hai, no doubt, but agar dil nahi lagega toh kya faida?
Wahi toh tension hai, Maa. What if I choose art and don't get a job? Sab log bolenge 'dekho, isliye science lena chahiye tha'. Society pressure bhi toh hai na?
Beta, job toh mil hi jayegi if you're good at what you do. Aur society toh kuch na kuch bolegi hi. Focus on developing your skills and passion. Let's explore some art courses together, okay?
Okay, Maa. That sounds good. Maybe we can research some design schools too? Thanks for understanding, Maa. I feel much better now. Let’s have chai!
Oye, kya scene hai? Sun raha hun tera aur ka kuch chal raha hai? Sab theek toh hai na, bhai?
Yaar, thoda tension hai. She's saying I don't communicate enough. Like, I'm always online gaming, and she feels ignored. I don't know how to fix this, you know?
Dekh, communication is like a perfectly timed headshot in CS:GO. You gotta be precise and consistent. Tell her how you feel, genuinely. No gamer talk, just be real.
But I suck at that stuff, man! I'm better at leading a raid than expressing my feelings. What if I mess it up even more? I don't want to lose her, she is special.
Arre, chill maar. Start small. Maybe a handwritten letter? Or even a voice note saying you appreciate her. And bhai, put down the controller sometimes. Quality time is important, samajh gaya?
Okay, okay, point taken. Letter likhta hun. Aur haan, thoda gaming kam. Thanks, yaar! You're a lifesaver. Ab samajh mein aaya, relationship bhi ek game hai, but with real stakes. Wish me luck!
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Ghar pe sab theek toh hai na? Last time jab baat hui thi, you sounded a bit stressed about something. Bata, kya chal raha hai?
Haan bhai, stress toh hai yaar. Papa ka health thoda down hai, and mummy is super worried. Upar se, choti behen ki shaadi ka pressure alag se. You know how it is, family drama never ends.
Arre yaar, I understand. Papa ka kya hua? Koi serious toh nahi hai na? And shaadi ka tension toh har ghar mein hota hai. Don't worry, sab theek ho jayega. Just take it one step at a time.

Doctor ne bola hai age related issues hain. Medication toh chal rahi hai, but mummy is constantly panicking. Shaadi ka scene bhi complicated hai, ladke wale expectations bahut rakh rahe hain. It's exhausting, man.

Listen, try to convince your mom to stay calm. Stress se papa aur bimar ho jayenge. And shaadi mein, set some boundaries with the ladke wale. Don't let them take advantage. You need to prioritize your family's well-being.

Yeah, you're right. I need to be strong for them. I'll talk to mummy again and try to handle the shaadi negotiations firmly. Thanks, bhai, for listening. It helps to vent out sometimes. Chai pe chalega?

Accha suno, Mom's been complaining about feeling tired all the time. I think we need to revamp our family's diet. Maybe more greens and less oily stuff? What do you guys think? I was thinking of starting with weekly meal plans.

Haan yaar, that’s a good idea. Mom ke liye toh definitely healthier food is needed. But you know how Dad is, he won't give up his samosas easily. Maybe we can sneak in some healthier alternatives without him noticing?

Exactly! I was thinking of baking the samosas instead of frying them, and maybe adding more veggies inside. And for Mom, definitely more salads and dal. I saw a great recipe for palak paneer that's not too heavy on the cream.

Palak paneer sounds good! And maybe some oats for breakfast instead of parathas every day? I'm happy to help with the cooking, especially on weekends. We can make it a family affair, healthy cooking and all!

Perfect! Weekend cooking sessions sound amazing. I'll make a meal plan for the week and share it with everyone. We can even try some new recipes from YouTube. Let's aim for a balance of healthy and tasty, okay?

Deal! Healthy and tasty it is. And maybe we can convince Dad to join our yoga sessions too? It's a long shot, but worth a try. Let's make this a family health revolution, one meal at a time! Let’s start tomorrow.
Sun yaar, I'm facing some serious issues with my boyfriend. Baat baat pe misunderstanding ho jata hai. I don't know how to make him understand what I'm trying to say. Koi solution hai tere paas?

Dekh, communication is key. Sidhe sidhe bol jo bhi tere dil mein hai. Don't beat around the bush. Aur sun, he should also be able to express himself clearly. Agar woh nahi kar raha toh gently encourage him. Bina jhagre ke, pyaar se.
Haan, woh toh try kiya maine. But he gets defensive. Usko lagta hai main usko blame kar rahi hoon. Then he shuts down completely. How to handle that? I don't want to hurt him, but this is killing me.

Okay, try 'I feel' statements. Instead of saying 'You always do this,' say 'I feel hurt when this happens.' It's less accusatory. Aur bhai, listen actively when he's talking. Don't just wait for your turn to speak. Samajh rahi hai na?
Hmm, that makes sense. 'I feel' statements. Will try that. But what if he still doesn't get it? What if he continues to misunderstand me? I'm really worried about this, you know. It feels hopeless.

Then maybe, just maybe, you need to consider couples therapy. It's not a big deal, many people do it. A third person can help you both communicate better. Lekin sabse pehle, try what I suggested. Give it time, thoda patience rakh.
Oye! Kya plan hai aaj? I was thinking of hitting up Linking Road. Need some new clothes, ya know? Meri wardrobe toh boring ho gayi hai bilkul. Tu bhi chal na, shopping karenge!
Chal chal! I'm always up for some retail therapy. But seriously, what are you looking for? Ethnic wear ya western? Aajkal toh fusion ka trend hai, mixing and matching is the real game.
Actually, I was thinking something Indo-western. Like, a long kurta with ripped jeans maybe? Or a saree with a funky belt? Thoda different try karna hai. What do you think will look good on me?
Hmm, a long kurta with ripped jeans sounds cool. Just make sure the kurta isn't too plain. Add some embroidery or a cool print. And don't forget the jhumkas! They'll complete the look perfectly.
Good point! Jhumkas toh zaroori hai. Okay, kurta with ripped jeans and jhumkas it is! But what about footwear? Sneakers ya heels? I'm so confused. You always have the best fashion sense, yaar.

Sneakers would be more comfortable and give it a casual vibe. Heels are great, but for Linking Road, sneakers are the way to go. Plus, you can walk around more easily and bargain better! Let's go, then!

Accha suno, I'm thinking of surprising him with a dinner date this weekend. Beach side cafe in Hyderabad sounds romantic, no? What do you think? Any recommendations for places with good ambience and not too crowded?
