Exactly! And don't forget about 'me time' too! If you're happy and relaxed, it automatically reflects in your relationship. So, go get that pedicure, read that book, do whatever makes you happy! Trust me, it works wonders.
Oye, socha tha kahin shaant jagah chalte hain. Yeh bookstore sahi rahega na? Coffee bhi mil jaati hai aur books bhi. Perfect date spot, kya bolti hai?
Haan, yeh toh sahi hai. Thoda hatke hai usual coffee shops se. I like the vibe already. Dekhte hain phir, kaun si book milti hai aaj humein padhne ke liye.
Exactly! Kuchh interesting dhundhte hain. Maybe a thriller or a romantic novel? Depends on the mood, right? Coffee order karu? Tumhare liye kya laoon?
Haan, thriller sounds good! Coffee mein, latte chalegi. Aur dekhna koi achi si pastry bhi mile toh. Aaj toh full date mode on hai, bhai.
Done deal! Latte aur pastry. Tum book browse karo, mein order lekar aata hoon. Phir milke decide karte hain kaun si book leni hai. Cool?
Perfect! Chalo, let's see if we can find a hidden gem in this place. Jaldi aao, coffee thandi nahi honi chahiye. Aur pastry bhi tasty honi chahiye!
Oye! Diwali aa rahi hai, kya scene hai tera? Ghar jaa rahi hai ya phir Mumbai mein hi dhamaka karegi? Mujhe toh lagta hai iss baar pollution ka level aur badhega.

Arre yaar, ghar toh jaana mushkil hai. Office mein itna kaam hai ki Diwali ki chutti bhi cancel ho gayi. Socha tha ghar jaake maa ke haath ke pakwaan khaungi. Mumbai mein hi kuch plan banate hai, tera kya plan hai?

Mera bhi same scene hai, bhai. Parents toh bol rahe the ki aa jao, lekin project deadline sir pe hai. Socha hai ki doston ke saath party karenge aur phir Marine Drive pe thoda ghumenge. Lekin pollution ka darr toh hai.

Haan yaar, pollution ka toh scene hi kharab hai. Lekin Diwali toh Diwali hai. Kuch toh karna padega. Chal, ek kaam karte hai, is baar sirf diye jalate hai aur crackers avoid karte hai. Environment ka bhi toh sochna hai.

Yeh hui na baat! Diye jalayenge aur sweets khayenge. Aur woh jo naya Bollywood movie release ho raha hai, woh bhi dekhenge. Kya bolti hai? Environment bhi safe rahega aur Diwali bhi celebrate ho jayegi.

Perfect plan! Movie, sweets, aur diye. Isse better Diwali kya ho sakti hai? Chal phir, tickets book kar le aur Diwali ki shopping bhi kar lete hai. Aur haan, pollution mask bhi le lenge. Happy Diwali in advance!
Oye, kya scene hai? Room mein itna sannata kyun chhaya hua hai? Is everything okay, bhai? I thought you'd be blasting Honey Singh after that coding assignment submission. Tension free ho gaya kya?

Arre, tension toh hai yaar. It's about my roommate, Sameer. He's been impossible lately. Leaving his stuff everywhere, never cleans up, and keeps the lights on till 3 AM watching those cringe reels. I'm losing my mind!

Arey bhai, that's a classic roommate drama! Humare time pe bhi hota tha. Have you tried talking to him directly? Maybe he doesn't realize he's being such a pain. Seedha seedha bol de, 'Sameer, bhai, sudhar jaa'!

I tried, but he just brushes it off, saying, 'Chill maar, bhai!'. Last night, I found his socks in my protein shake bottle! I almost lost it. I'm thinking of complaining to the hostel warden, but I don't want to be that guy.

Okay, socks in the protein shake is next level. Warden is a good option, or maybe a mediation session? You both sit down, air out the issues, and find a compromise. Warna, tu apna alag room dekh le. Just kidding, sort of.

Mediation sounds good. I'll try that first. Otherwise, I might just start hiding his phone charger. That'll get his attention. Seriously though, thanks for listening, yaar. Needed to vent. Chai piyega? My treat.
Oye, itni raat ko kya kar rahi hai? Neend nahi aa rahi kya? Mujhe toh bhookh lag rahi hai yaar, pata nahi kyun. Aisa lag raha hai jaise pet mein chuhe daud rahe hain.
Arre main bhi jaag rahi hoon. Studying kar rahi thi, but now I'm craving something sweet! Actually, I was thinking of ordering some gulab jamun from that mithai shop near my house. Will you join?
Gulab jamun? Abhi? You're kidding me! But seriously, that sounds amazing. Order karna toh bata dena, I'll also order some. Pet puja is very important, especially at this hour.
Haan haan, definitely bataungi. I'm checking Zomato and Swiggy right now. Dekhti hoon kaun jaldi deliver karega. Maybe we can even split the delivery charges. It’s good to save money.
Perfect! Jo bhi fast delivery kare, wohi order karo. Aur agar kuch aur bhi sweet mil jaaye, toh woh bhi dekh lena. I'm in the mood for full-on indulgence tonight. Let's do it yaar!
Done deal! I'll make sure to check all the options. Get ready for a sweet treat delivered straight to our doors! Just imagine, garam garam gulab jamun… Maza aa jayega!
Accha suno, I'm thinking of going to this new bookstore near Linking Road this weekend. They apparently have a really good coffee counter too. Kya plan hai?
Oh, nice! Linking Road is always buzzing. Bookstore and coffee sounds like a perfect chill scene. What kind of books are they supposed to have? Kuch interesting hai?
I heard they have a great collection of fiction and some really good art books. Plus, they have these comfy armchairs where you can just sit and read. Socha, let's make it a book date?
Book date? I like the sound of that! I've been meaning to pick up something new to read. Aur batao, what time are you thinking of going? I need to check my schedule.
Maybe around 4 pm? That way we can avoid the worst of the Linking Road traffic and grab a good seat before the evening crowd arrives. Sounds good to you, ya kuch aur socha hai?
4 pm works perfectly! I'm in. Let's meet right outside the bookstore. I'll probably be a little early. Looking forward to it! Pakka plan, right? No cancellations, haan?

Oye, batao toh, latest movies mein kya dekhne layak hai? I'm so bored, gaming se break chahiye. Koi Bollywood ya Hollywood recommendation do, jismein bilkul paisa wasool ho jaye. Abhi tak trailer bhi nahi dekha maine kisi movie ka.

Arre, you haven't? I just saw 'Animal', Ranbir Kapoor is totally killing it! But it's quite violent, so if you're not into that, then 'Sam Bahadur' is good, it's Vicky Kaushal as Field Marshal Manekshaw. Choice is yours, action ya history?

Hmm, 'Animal' sounds tempting, Ranbir toh वैसे bhi favourite hai. But violent scenes se thoda darr lagta hai. 'Sam Bahadur' is interesting too, Vicky toh acha actor hai. Okay, I'll check out trailers. Koi aur option hai?

If you're feeling adventurous, there's also 'Dunki' coming out soon, SRK ki film hai. But initial reviews are mixed, so maybe wait for a few days before deciding. Otherwise, I think 'Animal' and 'Sam Bahadur' are the safest bets for now.

Okay, got it! 'Animal' ya 'Sam Bahadur' – I'll see which one has better reviews online. SRK toh always a safe choice hota hai, but mixed reviews? Hmm, let's see. Thanks for the recommendations! Movie night pakka.
No problem! Enjoy the movie! And let me know which one you liked better. We can discuss it later, over chai, obviously. And maybe some samosas too. Movie and samosas, perfect combo!
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I was thinking, yeh monthly kharcha toh badhta hi jaa raha hai. Koi tareeka hai kya thoda save karne ka? Warna yeh toh har mahine jeb khali ho jaati hai, bhai.

Haan yaar, I feel you! Actually, I started using this app to track my expenses. It helps a lot in understanding kahaan zyada kharcha ho raha hai. Maybe we can try that together? Thoda budgeting bhi ho jaega.
Budgeting? Woh toh badi boring cheez lagti hai. Koi aur jugaad batao. Like, maybe cut down on eating out? Ya phir yeh jo rozana chai peene jaate hain, woh band karein? Kya bolta hai?

Chai bandh?! Kabhi nahi! But yeah, eating out definitely needs to be controlled. Also, I was thinking of starting an RD. Even a small amount every month can make a difference in the long run. What do you say?
RD is a good idea, but I'm always scared of locking my money away. What if I need it urgently? Koi mutual fund wagera try karein? Thoda risk hai but returns bhi toh zyada milte hain na?

Mutual funds are definitely an option! Let's do some research together. I know someone who invests regularly. We can ask him for advice and then decide. But first, chai! Let's discuss this over a cup.

Arre yaar, yeh PTM ka scene toh phir aa gaya. I swear, every few months, I'm juggling deadlines at work and then rushing to school. This time, I'm determined to be prepared. Any tips on how to actually make the most of it?

Dekho, sabse pehle, go through your child's assignments and classwork beforehand. Note down specific questions. Don't just ask 'How's he doing?' Dig deeper. Ask about specific areas where he's excelling or struggling. It makes a huge difference.

Good point! Last time, I was so rushed, I just nodded along. I felt like I didn't get any real insights. I'll definitely review his notebooks. And what about dealing with the teachers? Sometimes, they can be a bit... judgemental, you know?

Haan, I get that. Approach it as a partnership. They're there to help him succeed too. Start by acknowledging their efforts, then gently raise your concerns. Frame it as 'How can we work together to help him?' rather than blaming them.

That's a smart way to put it. I think I tend to get defensive. Aur batao, should I bring up extracurriculars? He's really into cricket, but I worry it's taking away from his studies. Maybe I should ask the teacher's opinion.

Definitely bring it up! It's important for them to see the whole picture. Maybe they can suggest ways to balance his passion with his academics. Plus, it shows you're invested in his overall development, not just his marksheet.

Accha suno beta, boards are coming up, right? Don't stress too much, okay? Just focus on understanding the concepts. Ratta maarne ki zaroorat nahi hai. Practice previous years' papers. That's the key, understand?
Haan mummy, I know. Everyone's saying the same thing. But it's so much to remember! Physics ke derivations, chemistry ke reactions... It's all going over my head. I'm trying my best though, promise.

Dekho, break it down into smaller parts. Don't try to do everything at once. Set realistic goals for each day. And take breaks! Chai piyo, listen to some music. Mind fresh rahega toh zyada yaad rahega.

Okay, mummy. I'll try that. Maybe I'll make a timetable. But what about the subjects I'm really weak in? Like maths? I just can't seem to get those trigonometry problems right. My friend also said similar problem.

Then focus on those subjects first. Practice those trigonometry problems until you understand them. If you still can't, ask your teacher or your friends for help. Don't be afraid to ask questions, beta. That's how you learn.
Theek hai, mummy. I'll do that. Thanks for the advice. I feel a little better now. I'll make a timetable and start with maths. And I'll ask my friends for help if I get stuck. Wish me luck!

Accha suno, I was thinking, this weekend let's do something different, you know? I'm so tired of just ordering in. Beachside cafe sounds good, no? Thoda romantic, thoda breezy... Hyderabad mein toh options bhi hain. What do you say?

Beachside cafe in Hyderabad? That actually sounds quite lovely. But which one are you thinking of? Some of them get really crowded, especially on weekends. And the food needs to be decent, you know my standards! Tell me more about your plan.

I was looking at 'The Waterfront'. It has pretty good reviews and the pictures look amazing. Plus, they have live music on Saturdays. Think fairy lights, soft music, the Hussain Sagar lake... perfect for a romantic evening. What do you think about the ambience?

The Waterfront? Haan, I've heard of it. Sounds nice. Live music is a good touch. But book a table in advance, okay? Otherwise, we'll end up waiting forever. And confirm if they have vegetarian options, my diet is going on track these days.

Done and done! Table booked for Saturday at 8 pm. I already checked the menu online, plenty of vegetarian options. Just get ready to be pampered! I'm even thinking of wearing that new saree you liked. Surprise!

Wah wah! Saree, live music, and a lake view? You've definitely outdone yourself. I'm already looking forward to it. This week has been so hectic, this is exactly what I needed. Thanks for planning this, I appreciate it a lot!
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I was thinking, you know how we always talk about doing something big? I was seriously considering applying for masters abroad. Kya bolti hai?
Arre yaar, that's huge! Abroad? Kahan ka scene bana rahi hai? It's a massive decision, like totally changing your life. But honestly, I'm excited for you. Which country are you thinking of?
I'm leaning towards Canada, maybe even the US. Canada feels safer, less chaotic, you know? Plus, I heard the PR opportunities are better. US mein toh visa ka tension hi tension hai.

True that. Visa is a headache. But think about the exposure in the US, the universities are top-notch. Canada is chill though, and the maple syrup is calling! Have you started researching universities and courses?
Thoda bahut dekha hai, lekin overwhelmed feel ho raha hai. Application process, SOP, LOR, phir GRE ka tension! Itna kuch hai karne ko. Where do I even start, tell me?

Okay, chill maar. Step by step chalte hain. First, finalize your universities and courses. Then, focus on GRE prep. We can study together, it’ll be less boring. And I know someone who went to Canada last year, I'll connect you!
Oye sunn, I was thinking, you know how we always talked about going abroad for masters? Ab kya scene hai tera? Are you still planning for it or should I drop the idea too?
Arre bhai, plan toh hai. Actually, I've started prepping for the GRE. Thoda mushkil lag raha hai, but I'm giving it my best shot. Tu bata, tera kya plan hai? Which field are you even considering?

GRE? Oh god, that sounds intense. I was thinking more along the lines of IELTS and focusing on UK universities. Maybe something in data science. The fees, though, is giving me proper tension. Koi scholarship ka jugaad hai tere paas?

Scholarship toh bhai lottery ticket jaisa hai. But yeah, I'm researching different options. There are some university-specific ones and a few external ones too. We should sit down and compare notes. Maybe apply to the same unis?
That's a great idea! Imagine, hum dono same university mein. Hostel life part 2, but this time, firangi style! Let's definitely plan a study session soon. Pizza and GRE prep, sorted. Kab free hai tu?

Perfect! Pizza and planning, I'm in. This weekend pakka. We can also check out some consultants, just to get a better idea of the application process. Let's make this happen, yaar. Dream toh poora karna hai!
Oye, Deepak, Holi ke liye rangoli ka kya plan hai? Lights bhi toh lagani hai, last year ki tarah sab fuse nahi hona chahiye. Bhabhi ji ne kuch design bheja tha, dekha tune?

Haan bhai, rangoli ka plan toh ready hai. This time, floral design try karenge, thoda modern touch. Lights LED wali lagayenge, fuse hone ka chance kam hai. Bhabhi ji ka design bhi dekha, mast hai, usse bhi incorporate karenge.
Perfect! Floral rangoli sounds awesome. LED lights are a good call. Make sure electrician ko bula ke wiring check kara le. Warna Holi wale din sab andhera ho jayega. Aur dhol ka kya scene hai?
Electrician se baat ho gayi hai, kal subah aa jayega. Dhol wala booked hai, shaam ko 6 baje se bajaana shuru karega. Bas ab gulal aur thandai ka jugaad karna hai, woh tera responsibility hai.
Gulal aur thandai? Woh toh done samajh. Mai best quality lekar aaunga. Lekin bhai, rang pakka nahi hona chahiye, warna baad mein sab mujhe hi gaali denge. Safe colours laana.

Tension mat le, organic gulal hi laayenge. Koi chemical wala nahi. Holi hai, masti bhi karni hai aur skin ka bhi dhyaan rakhna hai. Aur haan, camera ready rakhna, Instagram ke liye reels bhi toh banana hai.
Oye, suno! College reunion toh pakka hai, but I have a better idea. Road trip, guys! Remember the Goa plans we always made? Let's finally do it. Sab purane dost, ek gaadi, aur open road. What say?

Arre bhai, Goa toh sunke hi excitement aa gaya! But road trip? Kaun drive karega? Aur gaadi kiski hogi? Logistics bhi toh dekhna padega. Office se leave milegi bhi ya nahi, boss toh tension deta hai hamesha.

Leave toh main manage kar lunga. Gaadi meri Innova hai, badi hai, comfortable rahegi. Driving bhi main aur tum dono sambhal lenge. Baaki logistics, route, aur hotels hum sab milke plan karenge. Tension mat lo, sab set ho jayega.
Hmm, Innova hai toh phir theek hai. But Goa mein monsoon toh nahi hoga na? Varna beach pe kaise chill karenge? Aur budget kya rahega, woh bhi bata de. Kahin aisa na ho ki baad mein jeb khali ho jaye.

Monsoon ka tension mat lo, October mein plan karenge. Perfect weather rahega. Budget per person around 15k pakad lo, including petrol, hotels, aur khana-peena. Thoda upar-neeche ho sakta hai, but roughly itna hi lagega.
Okay, 15k is doable. October sounds good too. Let’s create a WhatsApp group and discuss the detailed itinerary. I'm in! College days phir se jeene ka mauka mil raha hai, miss nahi kar sakte!
Arre yaar, pata hai, office se aate aate itni thakan ho jati hai. Aur batao, family kaisi hai? Weekend ka kya plan hai? Kuch movie vagaira dekhne ka plan hai kya? Latest kaunsi movie release hui hai?

Haan bhai, thakan toh hoti hai. Family mein sab theek hai. Weekend mein socha tha ghar pe hi relax karenge. Movies ka toh pata nahi, lekin 'Fighter' aayi hai suna hai. Reviews toh mixed hain, lekin action movie hai.
Fighter? Hmm, dekha toh trailer. Action toh mast lag raha tha, par story ka kuch samajh nahi aaya. Soch raha tha 'Article 370' dekhu, political drama type hai. Tumhe aise films mein interest hai?

Article 370? Interesting. Political dramas mein thoda kam interest hai mujhe, lekin suna hai acchi film hai. Agar reviews acche hain toh try kar sakte hain. 'Fighter' mein Hrithik hai na? Uske action scenes toh kamaal hote hain.

Haan, Hrithik Roshan hai 'Fighter' mein. Par mujhe lagta hai 'Article 370' mein kuch toh baat hogi, tabhi toh itni buzz hai. Chalo, dono ke trailers ek baar aur dekhte hain, phir decide karte hain weekend mein kaunsi dekhni hai.
Theek hai bhai, trailers dekhte hain. Waise agar ghar pe dekh rahe hain toh OTT platforms pe bhi kuch options honge. Netflix ya Amazon Prime pe kuch naya aaya hai kya? Woh bhi check kar lete hain.
Beta, toh socha kya hai? Ab toh 12th ke boards bhi khatam hone wale hain. Engineering ka toh tera mann nahi hai, I know. Par kuch toh decide karna hoga na, admission forms bharne ke liye?

Haan Maa, I know. Actually, I was thinking about maybe something in humanities? Like, history or political science. I find those subjects really interesting, you know? But papa keh rahe the scope nahi hai.

Dekh, scope toh har cheez mein hota hai. It depends on how good you are, and how much you work hard. Political science se bhi log IAS officer bante hain. History mein research kar sakte ho. Important yeh hai ki tujhe mazaa aana chahiye.
That's true, Maa. I was also looking at economics, actually. It seems like a good mix of humanities and something more practical, maybe? I could still go into finance later, right? Like you?

Economics is a good option, definitely. Tumhara maths bhi achha hai. And yes, you can still come into finance. But don't do it just because of me. Explore your options properly. Colleges mein career counseling bhi hota hai, try that.

Okay, Maa, I will. Thanks! I feel a bit better now. I'll research some colleges that offer those courses and see what their syllabus is like. Maybe I'll even talk to some seniors studying those subjects.
Oye! Kya plan hai Diwali vacations ka? I'm so fed up with office work, need a serious break. Soch raha hoon kahin hill station chala jaaun. Tu bata, tera kya scene hai?
Arre bhai, Diwali toh family time hota hai! But I totally feel you about needing a break. Maine socha tha Goa chale, beach pe chill karenge, maybe some water sports bhi try karein. Kya kehta hai?
Goa is always a good idea! But Diwali mein bahut crowded hoga na? Hill station mein shanti milegi, plus thand bhi hogi. Let's weigh the pros and cons, yaar. Budget bhi dekhna padega.

Haan, crowd toh hoga. But Goa mein parties bhi toh Diwali ke time pe mast hoti hain. Hill station ka bhi apna charm hai. Ek kaam karte hain, dono jagah ke options dekhte hain, phir decide karte hain. Chalega?
Perfect! I'll check out some hill station packages online. Tu Goa ke deals dekh le. Phir sham ko milke discuss karte hain chai pe. Diwali vacation toh plan karke hi rahenge!
Done deal! Main bhi Goa ke options dekhta hoon. Beach vibes ya pahadi shanti, dekhte hain kismat mein kya likha hai. Shaam ko milte hain, chai pe full planning ke saath. Vacation mode, on!

Oye, sunn! How's married life treating you, gamer boy? Work from home aur biwi, balance kaise banata hai? I'm struggling, yaar. Office calls never end, and she gets annoyed I'm always online. Koi tips batao, guru.

Arre bhai, it's a level up for sure! Pehle toh, set clear boundaries. Tell your team you're unavailable after a certain time. Second, dedicate specific time for her, like date nights or even just a chai session without your phone. Trust me, it helps.

Chai session sounds good. But what if urgent work comes up? My boss expects me to be available 24/7. Aur woh toh sunta nahi. She thinks gaming is a waste of time and I'm always on Discord with the boys. Problem yeh hai.

Boss ko politely batao your need for work-life balance. As for her, try involving her in your gaming, maybe show her some fun games. My wife now plays Candy Crush with me! And schedule gaming time, so she knows when you'll be busy. Communication is key, dost.

Candy Crush? Interesting! I'll try explaining my gaming world to her. Aur boss ko bhi samjhana padega. It's tough balancing the corporate pressure and relationship expectations. Thanks for the tips, bro. You're a lifesaver, seriously.

Koi baat nahi, bhai. We all go through it. Remember, happy wife, happy life! Aur happy gamer, productive life! Just be patient, communicate honestly, and find common ground. Aur haan, kabhi kabhi usko bhi PUBG khilao! All the best!
Oye! Kya scene hai? How's your kutta doing, Lucky? Last time I saw him, he was chewing on your chappals like they were nimbu.
Arre, don't even ask! He's a total drama queen. Kal raat, he refused to eat his dog food. Only wanted my chicken biryani. Pura nakhra hai, bhai.
Biryani?! Dude, that's too much! My billi only gets doodh and biscuits. Doctor ne bola tha, 'No human food, beta'. Strict diet rule hai.
I know, I know! But uska woh puppy face... I melt! I need to get him trained properly. Koi achha dog trainer pata hai kya, tere area mein?
Haan yaar, I think Sharma uncle ke paas ek contact tha. He trained his labrador really well. I'll ask him and let you know. Lucky ki training toh banti hai!
Thanks, bhai! You're a lifesaver. Otherwise, yeh Lucky toh mujhe pagal bana dega. Fir tu bhi mujhe biryani khilana padega, to calm me down.

Accha suno, anniversary aa rahi hai. I'm completely blank on what to get. Last year toh watch di thi. Kuch unique sochna hai, yaar. You know, something that shows I actually put some effort in this time.

Hmm, tough one. Jewellery is always a safe bet, but it feels a bit cliché, right? Maybe an experience? Like a weekend getaway to a nice resort near Lonavala? Peaceful bhi rahega aur quality time bhi milega.
Lonavala is a good option, but she's been super stressed with work lately. I was thinking something relaxing at home. Maybe a fancy massage chair? Or a high-end coffee machine? She loves her coffee.
Coffee machine is practical, but massage chair has more wow factor, I think! Imagine, she comes home from work, exhausted, and bam! Instant relaxation. Plus, you can use it too, bhai sahab!

Haan, that's true! Both of us could use some relaxation. I'll check out some options online. But, is it too impersonal? I want something that says 'I love you', not just 'I care about your back pain'.
Okay, final idea: massage chair *and* a handwritten letter expressing your feelings. That way, you cover both bases – practical and romantic. Think about it! Best of both worlds, boss!
Hello, suniye ji, PTM ki date aa gayi hai. Teenager toh abhi se tension mein hai. Aap please chaliye, mujhe toh meeting mein jaane se darr lagta hai, uske marks sunkar meri BP high ho jaati hai.

Arre yaar, relax karo. Main chalta hoon. Waise bhi, startup mein fund raise toh ho nahi raha, thoda time toh nikal hi sakta hoon. Tum bas chai banao, aur mujhe batao ki kya prepare karna hai. Teacher kya puch sakti hai?

Woh toh sab padhai-likhai ke baare mein hi puchengi. Uske homework, projects aur uski grades ke baare mein. Mujhe lagta hai woh yeh bhi pooch sakti hain ki hum usko padhai mein help karte hain ya nahi. Please kuch prepare kar lena.

Theek hai, theek hai. Main dekh lunga. Main toh bas yeh soch raha tha ki agar woh pooch lein ki future plans kya hain, toh main kya bolunga. Doctor ya engineer toh woh ban'na nahi chahta. Aur entrepreneurship ka lecture dene mein mujhe sharam aaegi.

Aap kuch bhi bol dijiye, bas usko support kijiye. Usko pata hai ki aap uske saath hain. Woh hi sabse important hai. Aur haan, teacher ko bolna ki woh usko motivate karein, usko demotivate na karein. Positive feedback important hai.

Haan, woh toh main karunga hi. Chalo, chai pilao. Aur kal ke liye best of luck wish karo. PTM mission par jaa raha hoon. Aur agar teacher ne kuch zyada hi suna diya, toh seedha golgappe khane chalenge. Deal?

Accha suno, I just finished 'The Namesake' by Jhumpa Lahiri. Kya book hai yaar! The way she describes the immigrant experience is just so relatable. Have you read it? I think you'd absolutely love it. Highly recommend it.

Oh wow, 'The Namesake'! I've heard so much about it. I've been meaning to pick it up. Right now I'm deep into 'A Suitable Boy' by Vikram Seth. It's a long read, but the characters are so well-developed, it feels like you're living in 1950s India.

'A Suitable Boy'! That's a classic! I tried reading it once but got intimidated by the size. Maybe I'll give it another shot. The family dynamics are supposed to be amazing, right? What makes it so special, in your opinion?

Exactly! It's the family dynamics, the societal observations, and the sheer scope of the story. It’s like watching a whole era unfold. Plus, the descriptions of Indian culture and traditions are just beautiful. It feels so authentic and real. You should definitely try again!

Okay, you've convinced me! 'A Suitable Boy' is going on my list. In return, you absolutely HAVE to read 'Interpreter of Maladies', also by Jhumpa Lahiri. It's a collection of short stories, and each one is a gem. So poignant and beautifully written.

Done! 'Interpreter of Maladies' it is! I always appreciate your recommendations. We have such similar tastes in books. Thanks for always keeping my reading list interesting. Next chai, we can discuss both books! Deal?

Oye, kya scene hai weekend ka? Socha toh tha ghar jaunga, but phir yaad aaya assignments pending hai. College life is tough yaar, hamesha kuch na kuch laga rehta hai. Chai garam hai, mausam bhi thoda cool hai, kya plan hai bata?

Bhai, mera toh usual routine hai. Saturday ko cricket match dekhna hai doston ke saath. Sunday ko mummy ne mandir bulaya hai, woh toh jaana hi padega. Shaam ko socha hai thoda padhai kar loon. Assignments are a pain, I agree.

Cricket? Kaunsa match hai bhai? IPL toh khatam ho gaya na? Agar India ka hai toh pakka dekhunga. Mandir bhi jaana chahiye, thoda shanti milegi. Assignments toh ek endless cycle hai, kabhi khatam nahi hote. Chai is the only escape.

Haan, India ka hi match hai, Australia ke saath. Day-night hai toh mast rahega. Mandir mein prasad bhi milega. Aur assignments ke liye, group study karein kya? Shayad thoda help ho jaaye. Warna toh raat bhar jaagna padega.

Group study is a good idea, but last time toh sab log movie ki baatein kar rahe the. Anyways, India-Australia toh dekhna hi hai. Chal, lets plan something for Saturday evening then? Maybe golgappe afterwards?
Done deal! Match aur golgappe pakka. Group study ka bhi plan bana lete hain Sunday ko. Assignments bhi ho jayenge, aur thoda fun bhi. Abhi toh chai khatam karte hain aur lecture ke liye nikalte hain.
Accha suno, beta. Soch liya college ke liye? Science toh nahi lena, na? Last time bola tha engineering mushkil lag rahi hai. Arts mein kya options hain, woh dekha tune?

Haan maa, thoda confused hoon. Arts mein history aur political science interesting lag rahe hain, but sab bolte hain scope kam hai. Isliye samajh nahi aa raha. Aur commerce mein bhi placements ka pressure rehta hai na?

Dekh, scope toh har cheez mein hota hai agar dil laga ke kare toh. Political science se UPSC kar sakta hai. History mein research opportunities hain. Important hai ki tujhe interest kis mein hai. Pressure toh har jagah milega, beta.
Hmm, woh toh hai. Research mein mujhe interest hai. History stories and all padhne mein maza aata hai. But papa bol rahe the MBA karna better rahega future ke liye. Kya karoon main?

Beta, MBA toh baad mein bhi kar sakta hai. Pehle woh padh jo tujhe genuinely pasand hai. History mein masters kar ke dekh, research assistant ban sakta hai. Phir MBA karna hai toh karna. Abhi pressure mat le.
Okay maa, I think I will explore history further and see if it really clicks for me. Thanks for understanding! Papa ko bhi samjhana ki abhi MBA ka pressure nahi chahiye.

Arre yaar, PTM ka tension ho raha hai. This time I'm really hoping things are better with grades. Last time toh principal ne seedha bol diya 'improve karo'. Kya karein, graphic designing mein toh theek hai, padhai mein dabba gul.

Haan yaar, bachchon ka padhai toh aisa hi hai. Don't worry too much. Maybe this time things will be better. Have you tried talking to properly? Sometimes just understanding their perspective helps. Aur chocolate lekar jaana teacher ke liye.

Chocolate toh pakka. But I've tried everything, yaar. Lectures, incentives, even bribed him with a new phone! He's just not interested in maths and science. I wish they focused more on creative subjects, like art. Kya karein, system hi aisa hai.

I understand your frustration. But try to find a middle ground. Maybe a tutor? Or find ways to make learning fun. And remember, PTM mein calm rehna. Don't get defensive if they complain. Just listen and ask for solutions. All the best!

Haan, tutor toh lagaya hai. Let's see what the teacher says. Main toh bas yeh chahti hu ki woh pass ho jaye. Engineer ya doctor nahi banana usko. Bas apni marzi se kuch kare. Okay, thanks for listening to my rant. Feeling a bit better now.

Koi baat nahi. We're always here to listen. Relax, everything will be fine. Just go with a positive attitude, and work with the teacher to find the best way forward for Rohan. Aur PTM ke baad samosa treat dena humein!
Accha suno, I'm going on a first date tonight. Rooftop restaurant hai. What should I wear? I'm thinking something classy but not too over the top, you know? Help me out, yaar!
Oye, rooftop? Nice! Don't go too heavy on the bling. Maybe a simple kurta dress with some elegant jhumkas? Or a flowy midi dress? Depends on what vibe you want to give off, right?
Midi dress sounds good! But should I go for something bright or stick to darker colours? I was thinking maybe a dark green or navy blue? Or should I be daring and wear something red?

Red is risky for a first date, maybe save it for later! Dark green is sophisticated and suits everyone. Pair it with some strappy heels and a clutch. You'll look fab, I promise! Thoda subtle, thoda sexy!
Perfect! Dark green midi it is. Heels toh hai mere paas. What about makeup? Should I go for a bold lip or keep it natural? I don't want to look like I'm trying too hard, you know?
Definitely keep the makeup natural. A little bit of blush, some mascara, and a nude lip. Let your personality shine! And don't forget a good perfume. All the best for your date! Nach lena baad mein!
Oye, kya scene hai? Interview ke liye kitni taiyari hui? I'm so stressed yaar, samajh nahi aa raha kahan se shuru karun. CV toh bhej diya, ab kya karun?
Chill maar bhai! Resume toh sirf entry point hai. Ab apne skills ko polish kar. Star method use kar answers banane ke liye. Aur company ke baare mein research kar, woh sabse important hai.
Star method? Woh kya bala hai? Aur company ke baare mein kya dekhna hai? Unke products ya services toh pata hai, lekin aur kya jaan na chahiye?

STAR matlab Situation, Task, Action, Result. Har question ka answer is format mein de. Company ke baare mein unke values, culture aur recent news padh. Interviewer ko lage ki you are genuinely interested.
Accha, yeh toh helpful hai. Lekin English mein bolna bhi toh important hai na? Meri English thodi weak hai. How to improve that overnight, any jugaad?

Jugaad toh yeh hai ki mirror ke samne practice kar, aur apne answers record kar. Also, mock interview de apne kisi dost ke saath. Confidence dikhana important hai, English thodi kamzor ho toh bhi chalega.
Accha suno, I just finished 'The Midnight Library' by Matt Haig. Kya book hai yaar! It really made me think about all the choices I've made in my life. Have you read it or anything similar lately?

Nahi yaar, 'The Midnight Library' toh nahi padhi. But I recently devoured 'Project Hail Mary' by Andy Weir. Total sci-fi, but the way he builds the world and the character relationships is amazing. Ek dum different experience.

Sci-fi, interesting! I'm usually more into philosophical stuff, but I'm open to trying new genres. What did you like most about 'Project Hail Mary'? Koi specific scene ya character jo dil ko chhoo gaya?

The friendship between the human and the alien is just heart-warming, believe me! It made me think about communication barriers and how we can overcome them. It's a long book, but totally worth the time. You should definitely check it out.

Okay, you've convinced me! I'll add it to my list. In return, you should try 'Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine'. It's about a quirky woman who learns to open up to the world. It's funny, sad, and ultimately uplifting.

Sounds perfect! I need something a bit lighter after all that sci-fi intensity. 'Eleanor Oliphant...' added to my list too. Thanks for the recommendation! Let's discuss once we've both finished reading them. Pakka!
Oye, kya scene hai weekend ka? Koi plan-shlan hai ya phir full on gamer mode on rahega? Chai garam hai, biscuit maar ke bata, kya chal raha hai tere dimag mein?
Bas bhai, gamer mode hi on rehne ka plan tha. Socha tha pura weekend Valorant mein nikal dunga. But agar tu kuch aur plan kar raha hai toh bata. Chai toh mast hai, biscuit bhi zabardast hai.
Valorant toh theek hai, lekin kab tak? Thoda bahar bhi nikal. Soch raha tha India Gate chalein, thoda walk karenge, photo-shoto kheechenge. Aur phir wahan se momos kha lenge, kya bolta hai?
India Gate? Hmm, momos sunke thoda interest aa raha hai. But bhai, weekend pe wahan bheed bohot hogi na? Photo kheenchne mein bhi mushkil hogi. Koi aur jagah try karein? Maybe CP?

CP mein toh har weekend party-sharty hoti hai. Humko toh bas chill karna hai, thoda ghumna hai. India Gate isliye bol raha tha, open space hai. Chal na yaar, dekh lenge bheed hui toh. Nahi toh, kahin aur nikal lenge.
Okay fine, India Gate chalte hain. But condition yeh hai, agar bohot bheed hui toh seedha momos kha ke wapas. Aur agar momos acche nahi hue toh tu party dega. Deal?
Oye sun, kya scene hai? Ghar pe sab theek toh hai na? Last time mila tha toh tu thoda stressed lag raha tha. Sab khairiyat toh hai na?
Haan bhai, kya bataun. Ghar pe thodi tension chal rahi hai. Papa ka health thoda down hai, aur mummy unki seva mein lagi hai. I'm just trying to manage everything, you know, office and ghar ka kaam.
Arey yaar, yeh toh sunke bura laga. Papa ko kya hua? Koi doctor ko dikhaya kya? Aur tu tension mat le, sab theek ho jayega. Family hai toh problems toh aati rahti hain.
Haan, dikhaya doctor ko. He said it's age-related, but still... Dekh, I'm trying to be strong for them, but kabhi kabhi lagta hai ki main hi toot jaunga. You know, it's a lot to handle.

I understand, bhai. Sun, if you need anything, kuch bhi, just call me. Main hamesha tere saath hoon. Chinta mat kar, hum sab milke handle karenge. Aur thoda rest bhi le, apni health ka bhi dhyaan rakh.
Thanks, yaar. Teri baat sunke thoda achha laga. You are a true friend. I think I'll try to take a break this weekend. Shayad kahin ghoom aaun. Let's see, but thanks again for listening.
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I was reading up on gender identity the other day, and it got me thinking. It's like, society ne jo box banaya hai, sabko usme fit hona zaroori hai kya?
Exactly! Mujhe bhi yeh lagta hai. Like, why should we all conform to 'ladka' or 'ladki'? People are so quick to judge, bina kuch jaane. It's like, 'Oh, he's wearing that? Must be...' You know?

Haan yaar, wohi toh. And it's not just about clothes, na? It's about how you feel inside, your expression, everything. Gender is such a personal thing, phir bhi sabko opinion dena hai. It's exhausting, honestly.

Totally! And the language we use also matters, right? Pronouns and all. I'm trying to be more mindful of using the right ones, but sometimes I slip up. It's a learning process, I guess. We should all try to be better allies.

Bilkul sahi. Education is key, I think. The more people understand, the less they'll judge. Aur humein bhi patience rakhna hoga, na? Change takes time. But conversations like these are important. Chai piyega?

Haan, chai toh banti hai! Exactly, slow and steady wins the race. And yeah, more chai, less judgement, that's my motto. Let's just try to create a more inclusive and accepting space for everyone, one chai at a time.
Oye, kya scene hai? Sun raha hoon you're thinking of quitting? Seriously? I thought you were all set in your current job. Tell me everything over chai, quick!

Haan bhai, tension hi tension hai. That's true, but I'm feeling stuck, you know? No growth, same old routine. Thinking of switching to something more creative, maybe digital marketing. But dar lag raha hai.
Digital marketing? Not bad, yaar! But it's a completely different field. Have you thought about the skills you'll need and the competition? It's not like coding, which you already know. Plan kya hai?

Yeah, I know it's different. I’ve been taking some online courses on weekends. Planning to build a portfolio with some freelance projects. Need to upskill myself before taking the plunge, warna dub jaunga.

That sounds like a solid plan. Just make sure you have a financial cushion before you jump. Gharwale kya bol rahe hain? They'll freak out if you quit without a proper backup. Don't do anything impulsive.
That’s the biggest hurdle, bhai. Trying to convince them that it's a good move. They want stability, salary, all that jazz. But I want to do something I actually enjoy. Wish me luck, I'll need it!

Accha suno, Goa mein daily commute is a total mess, yaar! The roads are so narrow, and the traffic during peak season is just insane. I spend more time in my car than at my desk, I swear. Thinking of getting a scooter just to survive.

Bhai sahab, I can imagine! Goa mein roads are definitely not made for this many cars. Evenings are worse I heard. But scooter pe bhi darr lagta hai, especially with the way some people drive there. Have you considered using public transport at all?

Public transport? Goa mein? It's practically non-existent! Buses are infrequent and never on time. Auto-rickshaws are a rip-off, they charge whatever they feel like. That's why everyone relies on their own vehicles, which makes the traffic even worse. It's a vicious cycle!

Haan, that makes sense. Maybe try carpooling with someone from your office? At least you can share the driving and the cost of petrol. Plus, company mil jaati hai, time pass ho jaata hai. Kuch toh relief milega from the stress of driving alone.

That's actually a good idea! I'll ask around and see if anyone lives nearby. Otherwise, I might just have to invest in a good audiobook or podcast to keep me sane during the commute. At least something to distract me from the honking and the slow crawl.

Exactly! Kuch toh jugaad karna padega. And hey, maybe try leaving a bit earlier or later to avoid the worst of the traffic? Thoda sa time shift karne se bhi difference padta hai. I hope you find a solution soon, bhai! Goa is beautiful, but the commute sounds like a nightmare.

Hello, suniye toh! Finally date plan ho gaya. Sunset boat ride, remember? I managed to snag tickets for us. Hope you're free this Saturday evening? It's going to be super romantic, bilkul filmy style. Let me know if the timing works for you, ok?

Arre wah, that's fantastic! Sunset boat ride sounds dreamy. Saturday evening is perfect, I'm definitely free. Thank you so much for arranging everything. Filmy style, huh? I'm looking forward to it already. Just tell me what time and where to meet.

Great! I was thinking we could meet near Gateway of India around 5:30 pm? That way, we'll have plenty of time to board and find a good spot before the sun starts setting. Don't forget to bring your camera! Perfect Instagram opportunity hai yeh.

Gateway of India, 5:30 pm, noted! Camera toh pakka le aaunga. You know I never miss a chance for a good photo op, especially with a sunset like that. This is going to be amazing. Anything else I should know or bring along? Maybe a shawl for the evening breeze?

Good thinking about the shawl! The sea breeze can get a little chilly. Other than that, just bring yourself and your amazing company. I'm really excited, it's been ages since we did something like this. Let's make some memories, haan?

Deal! Shawl packed, excitement levels maxed out. I'm equally thrilled. It's going to be a memorable evening for sure. See you on Saturday then! Thanks again for planning this. Abhi se dil mein ghantiyaan baj rahi hain, bilkul Bollywood style!

Oye sun, Lucknow mein beachside cafe? Thoda ajeeb nahi lag raha? But idea mast hai. Soch raha hu, candles wagera lagwa du kya? Aur kaunsa cafe best rahega romantic date ke liye? Suggestions de de yaar.

Beachside in Lucknow is unique, true! Candles toh pakka lagwa. 'Riverside Romance' suna hai? Wahan ambience achha hai, Ganga view bhi milega. Menu check kar le, Italian ya Mughlai decide kar lena. Perfect date night!

Riverside Romance? Naam toh filmy hai! Mughlai is the way to go, obviously. But yaar, dress code kya rakhu? Casual ya formal? First impression is the last impression, bhai. Aur gift kya le jau? Flower bouquet ya kuch aur?

Casual rakh, bhai. Lucknow hai, chill scene rehta hai. Flower bouquet cliche ho gaya. Aromatic candles de de, ya phir koi personalized gift. Aur thoda shayari wagera yaad kar le. Lucknowi andaaz mein baat karna.

Shayari toh meri weak point hai! Koi online source bata jahan se main kuch lines ratt saku. Aur reservation kitne baje karwaun? Sunset time sahi rahega kya? Ya phir thoda late, for the full romantic effect?

Sunset time perfect hai, bhai! Golden hour mein photo bhi achhi aayegi. Google kar 'romantic shayari in Urdu', bahut mil jayegi. Practice kar lena. Aur confidence se baat karna, sab set ho jayega. All the best!
Accha suno, how do you manage everything, ya? Office ka stress, relationship bhi... I feel like I'm always choosing between deadlines and spending time together. Koi tips hai kya?

Dekho, sabse important toh communication hai. Openly baat karo about work pressures. My partner understands when I have a crunch week, and vice versa. It's about mutual respect for each other's careers.
Hmm, that makes sense. But sometimes, I feel guilty taking time off when there's so much pending. Like, 'yaar, kaam toh khatam karna hi hai' kind of thing.
Guilt toh hoga, but you need to schedule 'us' time. Even if it's just a quick chai together in the evening, or a weekend movie. Treat it like any other important appointment. No skipping!
Okay, noted. Chai appointments it is! What about when work bleeds into personal time? Like, replying to emails at 11 pm... that's a big problem for us.

Set boundaries! After a certain time, phone off, laptop closed. Tell your team you're unavailable after hours unless it's an emergency. It's tough at first, but they'll adjust. Trust me, your relationship will thank you.
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Socha tujhse thoda Bollywood update le lu. Last week toh tu bol raha tha Pathaan phir dekhne jaayega. Kya scene hai? Koi nayi picture lagi hai kya theatre mein dekhne layak?

Haan bhai, Pathaan toh kamaal tha, two times dekha! Abhi Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani aayi hai. Karan Johar ki film hai, toh thoda drama toh hoga hi. Trailers dekh ke toh mast lag rahi hai. Tu bata, tera kya plan hai?

Rocky Aur Rani... Hmm, suna toh maine bhi hai. Par Karan Johar ki filmein kabhi kabhi over-the-top ho jaati hain na? Family drama zyada dikhate hai. Action-shaction kuch hai ya phir sirf romance aur gaane hi hai?

Thoda romance toh hai, obviously, lekin story bhi solid hai. Ranveer Singh aur Alia Bhatt ki chemistry bhi achhi hai. Baaki action scenes bhi daale hain thode bohot. Ek baar dekh le, phir decide kar lena. Warna OMG 2 bhi option hai, Akshay Kumar hai usme.

OMG 2? Oh, the sequel! Maine suna hai ki woh thodi controversial hai. Kuch religion wagera ke baare mein hai na? Shayad family ke saath dekhne mein awkward ho jaaye. Rocky Rani hi try karte hai, weekend pe plan banate hai.

Perfect! Rocky Rani is a good choice. Full paisa vasool entertainment hai. Popcorn leke jaana mat bhulna! Mujhe bata dena kaisi lagi. Fir discuss karenge. Chalo, mai chalta hu, office ka kaam bhi pending hai. Bye!
Oye, toh bata na yaar, I'm meeting this guy for a first date. Rooftop restaurant hai. What should I wear? I'm so confused, nothing feels right in my wardrobe! Help a girl out, quick!
Arre, chill maar! Rooftop matlab thoda fancy, but first date hai toh keep it chill. Maybe a flowy midi dress? Not too blingy, but something that shows you've made an effort. Kya kehti hai?
Midi dress toh theek hai, but which one? I have that floral one, or the plain black one with the interesting sleeves. Floral zyada lag raha hai kya? Or is black too serious for a first date?
Hmm, floral might be a bit much. Black with interesting sleeves sounds perfect! You can add a pop of color with your earrings or a bright clutch. Elegant but not trying too hard, you know?
Haan, that makes sense. Shoes? Flats are too casual, right? Should I go with heels? I have those cute wedges which are comfy but still have some height. Kya option hai?
Wedges are a safe bet! Comfortable enough to walk around and chat, but still dressy enough for a rooftop. Go for it! And remember, confidence is the best outfit. All the best for your date!
Oye, boss! First date hai rooftop restaurant mein. Kya pehnu? Journalist type toh rehna hai, but impress bhi karna hai. Help kar de yaar, wardrobe mein toh sab boring kapde bhare pade hain.

Arre bhai, tension na le. Rooftop hai toh smart casual chalega. Dark jeans, light-colored shirt, aur ek stylish blazer phen le. Journalist wala vibe bhi rahega aur date ke liye bhi ready lagega. Bata, shoes kaun se hain?
Shoes toh mere paas loafers bhi hain aur sneakers bhi. Loafers thoda formal ho jayega kya? Sneakers zyada casual toh nahi lagega? Confusion hi confusion hai. Help me out, dost!
Sneakers mat pehen. Loafers better option hai. Ya phir brogues bhi chalega. But loafers are safer. Jeans rolled up thoda sa, nice belt, and you're good to go. Perfume lagana mat bhoolna!
Perfume toh hai. Okay, loafers final. Shirt kaunsa color? Blue theek rahega? Ya white zyada safe option hai? Blazer toh main grey wala nikal lunga. Thanks a lot, yaar! You are a lifesaver.
Blue shirt is perfect! Grey blazer ke saath mast combination banega. All the best for your date, bro! Tension mat le, chill maar. Just be yourself and enjoy the evening. Party sharty karna phir!

Oye sunn, kya scene hai tere US visa ka? Abhi tak kuch update mila kya? I'm so stressed about mine, bhai. Deadline is approaching fast, and I haven't even got the interview date yet. Tension ho raha hai.

Arre bhai, mat pooch. Mera bhi same haal hai. Applied ages ago, but no news. Trying to call the embassy helpline, but it's always busy. Sun raha hoon ki bohot backlog hai because of the pandemic. Dil toh kar raha hai cancel karu, but project important hai.

Exactly! Project toh crucial hai. Boss already pressure daal raha hai. I heard some agents are offering faster appointments, but it feels like a scam, yaar. Risky hai kya woh sab? Have you considered any of those options?

Haan, I saw those ads too. My cousin warned me against them. Apparently, many are fake and can get you blacklisted. Better to wait it out, I think. Maybe we should try writing to the embassy directly? Worth a shot, right?

That's a good idea! I'll draft an email tonight. We can mention our project deadline and urgency. Maybe they'll consider our case. Fingers crossed, bhai. Let me know if you want me to include your details too in the email.

Yes please, that would be a great help! Ek saath try karte hain. I'll forward you my details. Thanks a lot, dost. Chal, at least we're in this mess together. Misery loves company, hai na? Let's hope for the best!
Suniye, I was thinking, family ke liye thoda healthy meal plan banayein? Office mein toh junk kha kha ke body bilkul aalas aa gaya hai. What do you think? Kuch suggestions hain aapke paas?

Haanji, bilkul sahi baat hai. Bachchon ko bhi healthy khana chahiye. I was reading about millet-based recipes. Ragi dosa, jowar roti... they're supposed to be really good. Aur sabziyan toh daily honi hi chahiye.
Millets are a great idea! I saw a quinoa upma recipe online too. Weekends pe we can try new things. But weekdays mein, something quick and easy hona chahiye. Maybe dal-chawal with extra vegetables?
Perfect! Dal-chawal is a classic. We can add palak or methi to the dal to make it more nutritious. Aur roti ke liye atta bhi multigrain use kar sakte hain. Thoda fiber bhi jayega andar.
Haan, that makes sense. I'll check out some multigrain options this weekend. Snacks ka kya plan hai? Bachche toh chips aur biscuits ke peeche hi bhaagte hain hamesha.
For snacks, we can try homemade granola bars or roasted chana. Fruits bhi cut karke de sakte hain. Thoda effort lagega, but it's worth it for their health. No more store-bought junk!
Arre yaar, suno toh. Tumhe pata hai na wo Shruti? Uski baat ho rahi thi aunty ke saath. She finally got that internship at Google! Imagine, Google mein internship, kitni badi baat hai!
Kya baat kar rahi ho? Shruti? Google mein? Kamaal hai! Mujhe toh pata bhi nahi chala. Last time jab mili thi, she was so stressed about placements. Good for her, yaar! Par kaise hua sab?

Haan, wahi toh! Aunty bata rahi thi ki usne din raat coding ki, projects banaye. Aur phir, LinkedIn pe bhi bahut active thi. Networking is key, I guess. I am so happy for her, but thoda jealous bhi feel ho raha hai, sach bataun toh.

Hota hai, hota hai. It's natural to feel that way. Par uski mehnat bhi toh dekho. We should also take inspiration from her. Chalo, at least we know it's possible. Ab humein bhi kuch karna padega, nahi toh peeche reh jayenge.

Exactly! I was thinking of starting a new course online. Maybe something related to AI or data science. Shruti se bhi help le sakte hain, she must have some contacts now. Let’s plan something together, chalega?

Haan, zaroor! That's a great idea. We can support each other. Aur Shruti se tips bhi mil jayenge. Let's meet this weekend and discuss everything properly. Chai peete peete plan banate hain. What do you say?
Accha suno, I need to hit the bazaar tomorrow morning for groceries. Diwali ke liye preparations toh shuru karni hai. List banayi hai kya tumne, ya phir main apne hisaab se le aaun?

Haanji, list toh maine raat ko bana li thi. WhatsApp kar di hai aapko. Check kar lijiye. Specifically mention kiya hai ki besan achha wala lena, laddu banane hain is baar Diwali pe. Aur dry fruits bhi dekh lena, budget mein rahe.
Okay, I see the list. Besan aur dry fruits toh theek hai. But yeh itna saara ghee? Itna ghee kaun khayega? Thoda kam karte hain, cholesterol bhi toh dekhna hai. Aur mithai bhi toh aayegi na ghar pe?
Arey, Diwali hai! Ek din toh cholesterol bhool jao. Guests bhi aayenge na. Aur ghee ke bina laddu kaise banenge? Please, thoda toh le lijiye. Baki aapki marzi, main kya bolun.
Theek hai, theek hai. Leta hoon ghee. But agar baad mein tummy upset hua toh mat bolna. Aur haan, woh rangoli ke colours bhi laane hain. Woh bhool gaya toh phir tum meri class logi.
Haan haan, rangoli colours yaad rakhna. Aur ek baat suniye, thodi phool mala bhi le aana. Mandir mein bhi toh rakhni hai na. Jaldi aana, main chai banati hoon aapke liye.

Oye, kya scene hai? Long time no see, yaar! Life mein kya naya chal raha hai? I was just thinking, we should both focus on bettering ourselves, you know? Thoda self-improvement, thoda growth... kya kehta hai?

Haan bhai, sahi bol raha hai! Life toh race bani padi hai. Self-improvement is the key, warna peeche reh jaoge. But honestly, kahaan se shuru karein? Gym join karein ya phir koi online course le lein? Ideas toh bahut hain, but execution zero.

Dekh, gym is good, but consistency is key. Maybe start with something smaller? Like, daily meditation ya phir reading a self-help book for an hour. Baby steps, bhai. Slowly, slowly pakdo, and then build up the momentum.

Hmm, meditation sounds good, but I can't sit still for even five minutes! My mind is always racing. Book reading is doable though. Any recommendations? Something that's not too preachy and actually helpful. Koi Hindi book bhi chalegi.

Arre, Chetan Bhagat's books are a good start, they are simple and relatable. Or try 'The Power of Your Subconscious Mind' – it's a classic. And for meditation, there are apps, yaar! Guided meditation helps a lot. Trust me, give it a try.

Okay, fine, I'll download a meditation app and check out that book. But you have to do it with me. We'll hold each other accountable. Deal? Aur sun, chai pe chalte hain, phir aur baat karte hain is bare mein. My treat, bhai!

Oye Vikram, sun na! You manage teaching, coaching classes, and still have time for your girlfriend. Kaise karta hai bhai? Work-life balance toh mera hil gaya hai. Tips de de kuch, warna breakup ho jayega pakka.

Arre bhai, chill maar! It's all about setting boundaries. Like, I tell her clearly when I'm busy grading papers or preparing lectures. Communication is key, boss. No late-night calls during exam season! Samajh gaya?
Boundaries? Woh toh mushkil hai. She wants my attention 24/7. Andar se pressure aata hai. How do you say no without hurting her feelings? I feel guilty saying 'I'm busy'. Koi jugaad batao.

Listen, bhai, quality over quantity. Dedicate specific time slots just for her, no distractions. Like, Saturday evening is movie night, no matter what. And during the week, even a 15-minute chai break call makes a difference. Try that!
Chai break call... not a bad idea. Lekin woh toh phir bhi bolegi, 'Tum mujhe time nahi dete'. Girls, yaar! Always complaining. Aur kuch secret formula hai kya? Ya phir koi mantra?

Arre, it's not a secret formula! It's about showing her you care even when you're busy. A small handwritten note, a surprise flower, even forwarding her a funny meme shows you're thinking of her. Small gestures, big impact, samjha?

Accha suno, vacation ka kya plan hai? I was thinking we should finalize the budget this week. Bacchon ke liye bhi kuch karna hai, aur humein bhi thoda relax karna hai. So, let's sit down and decide kitna kharcha karna hai.

Haan, yeh toh zaroori hai. Last time toh budget se bahar chale gaye the. Is baar, flights, hotel, aur activities, sab kuch properly plan karna hoga. Aur, bacchon ke liye shopping ka bhi sochana padega. Kitna allocate karein, tum batao?

Flights aur hotel ke liye, I was thinking around 50,000. Activities aur shopping ke liye 20,000 rakhte hain? Aur khane-peene ka alag se 10,000? Yeh theek rahega? Humein thoda spare bhi rakhna chahiye for emergency.

Hmm, 50,000 for flights and hotel is good. But 20,000 for activities and shopping might be less, especially for the kids. Unko toh kuch na kuch chahiye hi hoga. Maybe we can increase it to 25,000? Aur emergency ke liye 5,000 side mein rakhte hain.

Okay, 25,000 for activities and shopping done. Aur emergency ke liye 5,000. Total ho gaya 80,000. We should start saving from this month itself. Let's create a separate account for this vacation. Kya kehte ho?

Perfect! Separate account is a great idea. It will help us track the expenses easily. Aur, we should also look for discounts and offers online. Maybe we can save some money on flights or hotels. Chalo, aaj hi research shuru karte hain!
Oye sunn, kya chal raha hai? I was just thinking, life is passing by so fast, right? Need to up my game, yaar. Koi self-improvement ka plan hai tere paas?
Haan bhai, you are right! Time toh udta hi jaa raha hai. I've been trying to read more, you know? That's my self-improvement thing right now. What are you thinking of doing?
Reading is good, I should also try that. I was thinking of finally learning coding. Always wanted to build my own website. It's a big challenge, but worth it, I think.
Coding? That's awesome! Seriously, that's a skill that will always be useful. I think you should totally go for it. Maybe we can find some online courses and study together?
That's a great idea! Accountability partner ban jaate hain. We can keep each other motivated. Plus, I was also thinking of starting yoga again. Body bhi toh important hai, na?
Perfect! Coding and yoga – a balanced approach to self-improvement. I'm in! We'll conquer coding and find our inner peace, all while getting healthier. Let's do it!

Oye, kya scene hai? College toh jaise jail lagne laga hai, yaar. Assignments aur projects ne dimag ka dahi kar diya hai. Kuch toh escape plan banana padega, warna toh pakka depression mein chale jayenge.

Sahi bol raha hai bhai! Attendance ka bhi tension alag se. Professor log bhi ajeeb hai, aisa lagta hai jaise unko bhi college aana pasand nahi hai. Escape plan mein main bhi shamil, bata kya karna hai?

Dekh, apne paas do options hai. Ya toh bunk maar ke movie dekhne chale, ya phir long drive pe nikal jaate hai. Movie mein toh phir bhi padhai ka tension rahega, long drive is the best option. Kya bolta hai?
Long drive sounds perfect! Kahan chalna hai? Goa plan karein? Waise bhi, exams ke baad toh Goa jaana hi hai, toh kyun na thoda practice kar lein? Plus, thoda stress bhi kam hoga.

Goa is too far, bhai! Itna time nahi hai. Nearby koi hill station chalte hai, jaise Lonavala ya Khandala. Vahaan ka weather bhi mast rehta hai. Aur wahaan pe vada pav bhi milta hai, pet puja bhi ho jayegi.
Done! Lonavala is fixed. Kal subah nikalte hai. Bike ready rakhna aur snacks pack kar lena. Aur haan, charger mat bhoolna, warna photo kaise kheechenge? Chalo, phir kal milte hai, bhai!
Yaar, Eid aa rahi hai, and I'm totally confused about what to wear. Pathani suit phir se? Or something more modern? And gifts ka bhi tension hai. Kids ke liye kya lein?
Pathani suit is classic, bhai! But maybe try a kurta with a Nehru jacket this time? Thoda different lagega. Gifts mein, kids ko toh chocolates and maybe some small toys de do. They'll be happy.

Kurta Nehru jacket... hmm, not a bad idea. But colour kya choose karu? Something festive but not too loud. And you're right about the kids, chocolates toh must hai. Any ideas for the elders in the family?
Colour mein, maybe a nice shade of blue or green? Elegant lagega. Elders ke liye, dry fruits ka box ya phir attar. Something traditional and useful. Or maybe a good quality shawl for the ladies?
Attar is a great idea! Bilkul bhul hi gaya tha. And shawl bhi perfect rahega for my mother. Okay, I'm feeling much better about this now. Thanks for the suggestions, bhai. Eid shopping sorted!
Koi baat nahi, dost. That's what friends are for! Bas Eid par mujhe bhi biryani khila dena. And wear that blue kurta – I think it will look awesome on you. Eid Mubarak in advance!
Accha suno, I'm on a mission to find Lucknow's best coffee. I've tried Cherry Tree, but I feel like there's gotta be something better hidden in some gully somewhere. Any recommendations, anyone?

Aisha ji, have you checked out Cappuccino Blast near Hazratganj? Their cold coffee is pretty famous. Although, for a proper 'coffee' coffee, maybe try that new place, 'The Coffee Bean Scene' in Gomti Nagar. Heard good things.

Cappuccino Blast is too sweet for me, yaar. I need that strong, bitter kick to get through the day. The Coffee Bean Scene...sounds promising. Is it overly fancy or can I wear chappals and still feel at home?

Nahin, it's not that fancy. You can definitely rock your chappals there. They have a nice outdoor seating area too, perfect for people-watching while you sip your coffee. Plus, they have amazing pastries to go with it!
Outdoor seating and pastries? You're speaking my language! Okay, The Coffee Bean Scene it is. I'm heading there after lunch. Wish me luck in my quest for the perfect Lucknow coffee. I'll report back!

All the best, Aisha ji! Don't forget to try their espresso. And yes, do let us know what you think. We're all invested in your coffee journey now. Maybe we can all meet there next time for chai-shai and coffee!

Arre yaar, PTM phir se? I swear, har mahine ek toh hota hi hai. This time I'm actually going, though. Last time tere papa gaye the, unko kuch samajh mein nahi aaya, sirf 'haan ji, theek hai' bolte rahe.

Haan yaar, I know! Papa log ko kya pata syllabus ka. Lekin iss baar kya plan hai? You’re going prepared? You know, like a proper chef plans a meal? Mujhe tension ho raha hai, Maths mein toh woh phir se kam number layega.

Exactly! I'm thinking of preparing a list of questions beforehand. Performance, behaviour, and that new project they mentioned. Aur haan, I'll ask about extra classes for Maths, definitely. Dekhte hain principal kya kehti hain.

Good thinking! Ek kaam kar, uske friends ke parents se bhi baat kar lena. Maybe they have some inside information about what's really going on in class. Gossip se bhi kabhi kabhi kaam ban jaata hai, you know?
Haan, that's a good idea. I'll try to catch up with mom. She's always in the know. Aur bata, kya pehnu? Should I go full-on serious mummy mode or keep it casual? First impressions matter, right?
Definitely serious mummy mode! Full saree and a stern look. Show them you mean business. They’ll think twice before messing with your child. All the best! Mujhe update dena PTM ke baad.
Accha suno, date pe chalte hain next week? I was thinking movie dekhenge, but which one? So many options are there these days. Koi horror-shorror nahi, please! I get scared easily, you know that na?

Haan haan, date toh pakka. Horror toh main bhi avoid karta hoon, yaar. Bhoot pret dekh ke neend nahi aati. What about that new rom-com? Everyone's talking about it. Ya phir koi action movie dekhe? Thoda dhamaka hona chahiye, right?

Rom-com sounds good, but usually they are so predictable! Action bhi theek hai, but I feel like laughing more than fighting right now. Maybe something with a good story? Kuchh interesting, different type ka. Kya option hai batao?

Okay, okay, no tension. I think there's a thriller playing. Heard it's got a really good story and some unexpected twists. Not too scary, more like suspenseful. Aur nahi toh, animation movie bhi chalega? That new Pixar one is supposed to be amazing.

Thriller sounds interesting! As long as I don't have nightmares after. Pixar is always a safe bet, but I want something that's not too childish. Let's go with the thriller then? What time should we plan for? Evening show, right?

Perfect! Thriller it is. Evening show sounds good. Maybe around 7 PM? Then we can grab dinner after. I'll book the tickets online. Date pakki! Can't wait to see you, and hopefully, not get too scared during the movie.
Accha suno, Diwali aa rahi hai, yaar. I was thinking is baar kuch alag karte hain. Just ghar pe diya jalane se kya hoga? Pura mohalla milke celebrate kare toh mazaa aaye.
Haan, yeh toh sahi hai! Lekin pura mohalle ko ek saath lana, woh bhi Diwali mein... mushkil hai bhai. Sab apne apne mein busy hote hain. Kya plan hai tere dimag mein?
Dekho, I was thinking of a small Diwali mela in the community park. Kuch food stalls, games for kids, maybe a small rangoli competition. And of course, diya lighting ceremony together. Kya bolti hai?
Sounds good! But who will manage everything? Itna sara kaam hai. Permissions se lekar decorations tak, and who will sponsor the food stalls? Budget bhi toh chahiye.

Mein hoon na! I'll take care of the permissions and initial investment. We can ask for small donations from each household and find some local vendors to sponsor the food stalls. Hum sab milke karenge.
Theek hai, phir toh. Count me in! I can help with the decorations and organizing the games for the kids. Chal, phir kal se hi shuru karte hain. Diwali dhamaka karenge is baar!
Oye, Delhi ka monsoon hai ki lottery? Kabhi baarish toh kabhi dhoop. Kal toh aise laga jaise aasmaan phat gaya, aur aaj dekho, bilkul saaf! Kya scene hai yaar?

Arre bhai, Delhi ka toh yahi scene hai. Monsoon mein bhi dhoop se tanning ho rahi hai. Kal office jaate time toh paani mein doobte doobte bache, aaj bike nikaal li. Kya karein, adjust karna padta hai.

Exactly! Aur woh traffic? Baarish mein toh lagta hai jaise sabhi log apni gaadiyon ko boat samajh rahe hain. Signal pe khade khade toh aadha office time nikal jaata hai. Home se work karna hi sahi hai.
Sahi bol raha hai. Kal toh metro mein bhi paani tapak raha tha. Aisa lag raha tha jaise barish metro ke andar bhi aana chahti hai. Delhi monsoon is literally a comedy show. Free entertainment!
Haan yaar, aur upar se yeh humidity! Baarish ke baad toh saans lena bhi mushkil ho jaata hai. Pura din chip-chip feel hota hai. AC bhi fail ho jaata hai itni garmi mein.
Bilkul sahi! Isse achha toh Mumbai ka monsoon hai. Kam se kam consistent toh rehta hai. Yahan toh baarish bhi mood swings dikhati hai. Chal, chai peete hain, shayad mausam thoda cool ho jaaye.
Oye, sun na! Mummy is getting too serious about this 'rishta' thing. Like, every other day, there's a new photo being shown. I'm toh fed up. What to do yaar?
Arre, chill maar! It happens. Mine were after my life last year. Just stall them a bit, bol de 'abhi padhai hai' or 'career banaana hai'. Classic escape routes, you know?
That's the problem, na? I used that excuse last time! Now they're saying 'padhai-vadhai ho gaya, ab settle ho ja'. They're showing me doctors and engineers only!
Accha, listen. Tell them you want someone 'modern but sanskaari'. That's the golden phrase! Then you get time to sneakily check profiles yourself, right? Keep options open, bhai.
Haan, that's a good idea. 'Modern but sanskaari'... I'll use that line. But seriously, what if I don't like anyone? This whole process is so awkward, like a job interview for life!
Then reject! Simple. It's your life partner, not a job. But keep the 'modern sanskaari' act up. Delay, delay, delay. Aur chai-shai peete reh, tension kam hoga. We'll figure it out together.
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Been thinking, yaar, we need to do something different. Yeh 9-to-5 life is killing me slowly. Koi startup idea hai tere dimag mein?
Bhai, tell me about it! I feel the same. Office politics se tang aa gaya hoon. Startup ka toh socha hai, but solid idea nahi mil raha. What were you thinking?
Socha tha, maybe something in the online education space? Dekh na, how many people are prepping for competitive exams. A platform with personalized coaching and mock tests, maybe?
Hmm, that's actually not bad. But bahut competition hai already. We need a unique selling point. Something jo baaki log nahi kar rahe. What about focusing on vernacular languages?
That's a good point! Local languages mein content is limited. We could create a platform that offers courses and tests in Hindi, Tamil, Bengali, etc. Reach a wider audience, right?
Exactly! Aur content creators bhi local hi hire karenge. Authentic feel rahega. Funding ka kya scene hai? Bootstrapped ya venture capital?
Oye, Diwali ki preparations kaisi chal rahi hain? Ghar pe sab theek toh hai na? Is baar kya plan hai, woh Lakshmi puja ka time bata dena, I'll try to make it.

Sab mast hai bhai! Diwali toh bas ghar ki safai mein hi nikal rahi hai. Lakshmi puja ka time toh pandit ji ne evening mein bataya hai. Exact time WhatsApp kar dungi. Tum zaroor aana, family bhi aa rahi hai.

Pakka aayunga! Actually, I was reading about Diwali rituals. It's so interesting how different regions have different customs. Humare yahan toh Lakshmi-Ganesh puja karte hain, tumhare yahan kya special hota hai?

Haan, woh toh hai. We also do Lakshmi-Ganesh puja, but we also have this custom of lighting diyas all night and keeping the house illuminated. It's believed to ward off evil spirits and bring prosperity. Superstition ya faith, jo bhi bolo!

Interesting! Hamare ghar mein toh hum log subah jaldi uthkar pitron ko yaad karte hain. It's a way of showing gratitude to our ancestors. After that, the usual fireworks and mithai. I think every family has their own twist.

Exactly! That's the beauty of our culture, isn't it? Every family has their own way of celebrating, yet the essence remains the same – celebrating the victory of good over evil and spreading joy. Chalo, I'll text you the puja time later. Bye!
Oye, kya scene hai? You seem a bit off lately. Sab theek toh hai na? Exam stress wagera toh nahi hai? Tension mat le, chill maar, sab ho jayega.
Yaar, actually thoda overwhelmed feel ho raha hai. Office ka pressure aur ghar ke issues, sab saath mein aa gaye hain. Neend bhi theek se nahi aa rahi hai. Just feeling kinda low, you know?
I get it, bhai. Life mein kabhi kabhi aisa phase aata hai. But you know, it's okay to not be okay. Have you considered talking to someone about it? Like a therapist or counsellor?
Therapist? Pata nahi yaar. I always thought it's for 'serious' cases. Mujhe toh bas thoda down feel ho raha hai. Log kya sochenge, 'isko kya problem hai'?
Arre, logo ka kya hai, kuch toh kahenge. Your mental peace is important, dude. Even Sachin Tendulkar needs a coach, right? Think of it as getting a coach for your mind. Koi judgement nahi hai.
Hmm, you have a point. Maybe I will check it out. Thanks, bhai. Just knowing you're there to listen helps a lot. Chal, ek chai ho jaye? My treat.

Oye, sunn! I'm planning a surprise birthday party for someone special. Need your help to make it big. Koi clue nahi milna chahiye unko, understand? Soch raha hoon, this time something hatke karte hain, bilkul filmi style mein!

Bhai sahab, filmi style? Now you're talking! Batao kya plan hai? Location, theme, guest list… sab ready hai kya? And most importantly, kitna budget hai? Hum toh full support karenge, just tell us what needs to be done. Koi kasar nahi chhodenge.

Budget toh dekho, thoda tight hai, but dost ke liye kuch bhi! Location socha hai terrace, open air mein. Theme Bollywood rakh lete hain, kya kehte ho? Guest list choti hi rakhenge, close friends and family only. Tum decorations aur food ka dekh lo, please?

Bollywood theme, done! Main decorations aur food ka tension nahi lene dunga. Dhinchak music aur chatpata khaana, sab set kar dunga. Tum bas guest list final karo aur mujhe batao. Aur haan, cake ka kya scene hai? Koi special flavor hai kya?

Cake toh Chocolate truffle le aana, unko woh pasand hai. Aur haan, surprise element maintain karna hai. Kisi ko bhi hint nahi milna chahiye. Yeh plan secret rakhna, warna surprise ka maza nahi aayega. Shukriya yaar, tum ho toh tension nahi hai.

Arre bhai, tension free raho! Chocolate truffle cake done. Don't worry, muh se ek word bhi nahi niklega. Surprise toh surprise hi rahega. Party shuru hone se pehle mujhe call karna, main sab set karke ready rahunga. Phir dekho, kaise dhamaka karte hain!

Oye fitness freaks, dekho toh! Just saw this meme about skipping leg day. It's too funny yaar! 'Never skip leg day' bolte hai, aur yeh log toh gym hi skip kar rahe hain. Sending it to the group. Batao kaisa laga?

Arre bhai, yeh toh sach hai! Leg day is a struggle. But seriously, skipping it is a crime. I saw one more, 'Cardio is hardio' wala. Share karo, share karo! Let’s make this group a meme fest today, haha!

Haha, cardio is hardio! I feel you. Okay, next meme coming up. It’s about protein shakes – 'Protein shake after workout: because biceps'. Seriously though, protein is life after a killer workout. What do you guys usually take?

True that! Protein is essential. I usually go for whey protein isolate after my sessions. Helps with the muscle recovery, you know? Waise, yeh meme toh dil se nikla hai. Biceps banana hai toh mehnat karna padega.

Exactly! No pain, no gain, aur protein shake bhi chahiye. Found another one: 'Me trying to plank'. It's a picture of a cat collapsing. Planks are the worst! I can barely hold it for 30 seconds. Tum log kitna hold karte ho?

Planks are brutal, I agree! I manage about a minute, but it feels like an eternity. That cat meme is so relatable! Okay, I'll share one now: 'When you see someone using your favorite machine at the gym'. It’s too true!

Accha suno, I have a first date this weekend. Rooftop restaurant scene. What should I wear? I'm thinking something stylish but also comfortable. Kya pehnu yaar? Help me decide before I go crazy searching!

Oye Aisha, rooftop means it might get chilly later. Maybe a flowy midi dress with a denim jacket? Or a stylish kurta with palazzos? Comfort is key, especially on a first date. Don't want to be fidgeting all night!

Midi dress sounds good! But which color? I have a red one, a black one and a floral one. Red might be too much na for a first date? Black is safe but maybe boring? Floral is cute but is it too casual?

Hmm, the floral one sounds perfect for a rooftop vibe! It's fun and shows personality. Pair it with some nice wedges or block heels so you're comfy. Just add a light shawl or jacket in case the weather changes. All set!
Perfect! Floral midi it is. Now, what about accessories? I don't want to overdo it. Just something simple. Earrings, maybe? Or a delicate necklace? I'm so nervous, I can't even think straight!

Simple is always best! Go for small hoop earrings or a dainty necklace. Nothing too flashy. Let your personality shine through. And relax! It's just a date. Enjoy the rooftop view and the company. All the best, Aisha!
Oye sunn, woh study abroad ka kya scene hai tera? Application vagarah bhara kya? Last date toh nazdeek aa rahi hai na, I think. Tension ho raha hai ki nahi?
Arre bhai, tension ki baat mat kar. Application toh submit kar diya. Ab bas waiting game hai. Visa process bhi shuru karna hai. Documents collect karne mein hi itna time lag gaya!
Visa ka chakkar toh bohot hi complicated hai. Agent se baat ki kya? Warna reject ho gaya toh phir saara plan flop ho jayega. Dekh lena, properly check karwana.
Haan yaar, agent se baat chal rahi hai. Sab documents usko dikhaye. He said everything is fine, but still thoda darr toh lagta hai. Ghar se itna door, kaise manage hoga?
Manage ho jayega, tension na le. Apna dimaag use karna aur India ko represent karna acche se. Aur wahan jaake bhi mujhe mat bhoolna, warna teri pitai hogi!
Kabhi nahi bhoolunga tujhe. Pakka promise! Wahan se tere liye gifts bhi launga, desi ghee ke laddu aur Taj Mahal ka miniature. Ab khush?

Oye, kya chal raha hai? Productivity ki toh band baji padi hai meri. Deadlines are looming, aur main Netflix binge kar raha hoon. Koi jugaad bata yaar, how to get back on track? Office mein bhi sab pressure daal rahe hain.

Arre bhai, same pinch! Mera bhi wohi haal hai. Try Pomodoro technique, sunna hai kaafi effective hai. 25 minutes work, 5 minutes break. And phone ko side mein rakh, warna distraction toh pakka hai. Chai break le beech mein.

Pomodoro? Sounds fancy! But sahi mein kaam karta hai kya? And phone toh addiction ban gaya hai yaar. Bina dekhe raha hi nahi jaata. Chai break toh must hai, warna dimag kaise chalega? Kuch aur tips de.

Haan bhai, it works! Try kar ke dekh. And phone ke liye, app blocker use kar. Thodi der ke liye apps block kar de. Subah jaldi uth ke kaam start kar, fresh mind se better focus hota hai. Aur ek to-do list bana.
App blocker bhi try karna padega. Subah jaldi uthna is a challenge, lekin try karunga. To-do list is a good idea, at least pata rahega kya karna hai. Thanks yaar, thodi ummeed toh dikhi ab.

Koi na bhai, hum sab ek hi boat mein hain. We'll sail through it together. Remember, consistency is key. Ek din mein kuch nahi hoga, but keep at it. All the best! Aur chai pe chal, dimag thoda shant hoga.
Oye, itni raat ko kya kar raha hai? Neend nahi aa rahi kya? I'm having major cravings yaar. Pet mein choohe daud rahe hain. Bata na, what to do?
Arre bhai, mujhe bhi. I was just thinking same thing. Midnight cravings are the worst! Momos chalein? Ya phir kuch instant noodles banaye? It's too late to order anything I think.
Momos sounds amazing, but itna effort kaun karega? Noodles is a good plan. Maggi banaye? Ya kuch aur try kare? Maybe that weird pasta recipe we saw online?
Maggi is always the safest bet, bhai. Quick, easy, and satisfying. Let's add some extra masala and maybe an egg? Thoda protein bhi ho jayega.
Perfect! Egg sounds great. Chal, you start boiling the water. I'll grab the Maggi and the masala. Kitchen mein milte hain, hunger pangs se pehle!
Done deal! Water's on. Jaldi aa, bhai. Yeh cravings toh jaan lekar hi maanenge. Maggi saves the night, once again! Thanks for the company.

Oye, sunn! Thinking of surprising her with a dinner date. Jaipur mein beachside cafe? Sounds kinda filmy, no? But she loves that kind of stuff. Any recommendations, boss? Budget thoda tight hai, but want it to be special.

Beachside in Jaipur? Thoda difficult hai, bhai. Jaipur toh desert hai! But, maybe a rooftop cafe with a great view of Jal Mahal? Very romantic, especially at night. Plenty of options around Amer Road, check Zomato for reviews and prices.

Rooftop with Jal Mahal view... not bad, not bad! Zomato pe dekhta hoon. Lighting wagera acchi honi chahiye, you know, for the 'ambiance'. And food bhi tasty hona chahiye, sirf view se pet nahi bharega. Thanks for the tip, yaar!

Arre, food toh important hai! Check reviews specifically for the food quality. Also, see if they offer any special decorations or packages for couples. Some places do that kinda thing. Make it extra special, bhai!

Good point! Decorations will definitely score me brownie points. Candlelight dinner setup and all that jazz. I'll call them up and enquire about the decorations and romantic packages. Wish me luck, dost! It's make or break time.
All the best, Mohit! Tension nahi lene ka. Just be yourself and she'll love it. And don't forget to book in advance, especially on weekends. Update dena, how it goes! Party sharty bhi baki hai!
Oye sun, yeh climate change ka scene kya hai? I mean, har saal garmi badhti ja rahi hai yaar. AC bhi fail ho jata hai kabhi kabhi. Kya kar sakte hain hum log?
Haan bhai, you're right. Global warming is real. We need to do something, like use less plastic, maybe carpool. Government ko bhi kuch karna chahiye pollution kam karne ke liye.
Exactly! Aur yeh deforestation bhi toh ek problem hai. Pedh kat rahe hain aur buildings bana rahe hain. Oxygen kahaan se aayega? Humko bhi apne ghar ke aas pass plants lagane chahiye.
Sahi baat hai. Small changes matter. Like, switching to energy-efficient bulbs, reducing water wastage. Thoda sa bhi contribute karenge toh impact toh hoga hi, right?
Haan, sahi hai. I'll start with using less plastic bottles. Aur try karunga ki public transport use karoon whenever possible. Let’s make a conscious effort, boss.
