Perfect! Even I'll try to do the same. Let's encourage others too. Small steps, big impact, that's the mantra. Hum sab milkar hi kuch kar sakte hain.

Oye, Batao! Did you guys catch the latest episode of 'Family Man'? I was completely hooked. Seriously, Srikant Tiwari is like every middle-class Indian dad trying to save the world and manage his kids' tantrums. Full paisa vasool entertainment!

Arre bhai, tell me about it! I watched it late last night. That cliffhanger ending had me wide awake at 2 AM. The writing is top-notch and the way they blend action with relatable family drama is simply brilliant. Waiting eagerly for the next one!

Exactly! The whole scene at the office was hilarious. Remember when he was trying to explain the mission while his daughter was calling about her online classes? That's peak Indian parenting right there. Comedy gold, pure and simple.

Haan yaar, and the subtle political commentary they weave in is just amazing. It’s not preachy, but it makes you think. Plus, JK’s one-liners are legendary. I’ve already started using them in my office meetings. Kya karein, influence toh hai.

True that! JK is a legend. I think this season is even better than the last. The suspense is killing me. I’m already checking online for spoilers, even though I know I shouldn’t. Koi toh batao, what happens next?
Relax, bhai! Let's all watch it together when the next episode drops, then we can dissect it scene by scene over chai and samosas. No spoilers allowed! Promise me you won't ruin it for us. Deal?

Accha suno, you won't believe what happened in our moot court session! This one guy, right, he started quoting Bollywood dialogues instead of legal precedents. Judge was so confused, it was hilarious. Kya scene tha!

Arre bhai, that's too much! Hamare college mein, this one time, during the Constitution exam, someone wrote the entire answer in shayari. Professor was so impressed, he actually gave him passing marks! Only in India, I tell you!
Seriously? That's insane! We had this professor who'd randomly start singing old Hindi songs mid-lecture. Imagine trying to take notes while he's belting out 'Lag Jaa Gale'. Pure comedy, yaar.

Oh god, that reminds me! Our history professor used to fall asleep during his own lectures. Someone even recorded him snoring and made it their ringtone. He found out eventually, but he just laughed it off, the legend!

Haha, professors are something else! Remember that time the power went out during our farewell party and everyone started dancing in the dark with phone flashlights? Felt like a proper Bollywood movie climax, right?
Totally! And then the DJ started playing 'Kajra Re' on repeat. Good times, good times. College life, man, it's a different world altogether. Wish we could go back, just for one day, you know?
Oye, Holi aa rahi hai! What to wear, yaar? Last time toh I was completely drenched in colour, and my kurta was ruined. This time something more...disposable, maybe? And what about gifts for everyone?

Arre bhai, Holi hai, serious mat ho! Wear an old white t-shirt and jeans. Full on rang lagao. As for gifts, dry fruit ka dabba is always a safe bet. Or maybe some gujiya? Everyone loves gujiya during Holi.

Gujiya is good, but thoda cliché nahi hai? I want something more thoughtful. Maybe some cool sunglasses to protect their eyes from the rang? And the t-shirt idea is good, but white gets so transparent when wet!

Sunglasses are a great idea, Dev! Stylish bhi, practical bhi. And about the t-shirt, wear a vest underneath. Problem solved! Or go full Bollywood hero and rip your shirt off. Just kidding, bhai! Relax and enjoy.
Haha, ripping my shirt off? Not this time! Sunglasses it is then. And maybe some organic colours, you know, for the sensitive skin types. Where to buy them though? Any good online stores you know?

Organic colours are a good choice, safer for everyone. Check out Amazon or Myntra, they usually have a good selection. And don't forget to buy a pichkari! Holi without a pichkari is like biryani without rice. Enjoy the festival, Dev!
Arey bhai, kya chal raha hai? I just finished 'Sapiens' by Yuval Noah Harari. Mind blowing stuff, yaar! It totally changed my perspective on history and humanity. Have you read it?

Kya baat hai! 'Sapiens' is on my to-read list. I'm currently hooked on 'The Alchemist' by Paulo Coelho. It's a simple story, but the message about following your dreams really resonated with me, especially with the content creation hustle.

Ah, 'The Alchemist'! Classic. I read that back in college. Gives you that 'kuch toh karna hai' feeling, right? But 'Sapiens' is on another level, bro. It's like a history lesson mixed with philosophy and a dash of existential crisis. You'll love it.

Existential crisis, you say? Sounds intense! Okay, 'Sapiens' goes to the top of the list. In return, after 'The Alchemist', I highly recommend 'Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life'. It's all about finding your purpose, which is crucial for us content creators, isn't it?

'Ikigai', interesting! I've heard about it. Finding that sweet spot where your passion meets your profession. Solid advice, dost. Alright, deal! 'Sapiens' for 'Ikigai' after 'The Alchemist'. We'll have to discuss these over chai soon, bhai.

Done deal! Chai pe charcha it is. And maybe we can even brainstorm some content ideas inspired by these books? Imagine, 'Sapiens' meets 'Ikigai' on YouTube! The possibilities are endless, my friend. Let's make it happen!

Accha suno, I'm thinking of hitting the local market tomorrow morning. Need to stock up on sabzi and stuff. Anything specific you want me to grab while I'm there? Maybe some fresh dhania and mirchi for your special chutney?

Haan haan, definitely get dhania and mirchi! And if you see some good looking palak, get that too. I was thinking of making palak paneer. Also, check if they have those small, sweet lemons. Nimbu paani season is upon us, you know!

Palak paneer sounds amazing! Noted. And sweet lemons, got it. I was also planning to get some atta and dal. Running low on both. Anything else for the pantry? Maybe some masala chai? It's been raining a bit, perfect chai weather.

Yes, masala chai is a must! And check if they have good quality elaichi. Makes all the difference, you know? Also, see if you can find some fresh methi. Methi paratha would be perfect for breakfast this week. Market wala methi is the best.

Okay, methi, elaichi, atta, dal, palak, nimbu, dhania, mirchi... I think I've got it all written down. Should I take the auto or try the metro? Auto walas have been charging crazy rates lately. Maybe I'll brave the metro crowd.

Metro is probably better, especially if you're getting a lot of stuff. Less hassle with traffic too. Just be careful with your bags, you know how crowded it gets. And don't forget to bargain at the market! They always try to overcharge.
Oye, sun na! I'm going on a date tonight. Rooftop restaurant scene. Major dilemma! What do I wear? Something chill but also...you know, *datey*? Help a girl out, yaar! Brain is totally fried already.
Arre baba, chill maar! Rooftop means breezy. Don't go too heavy. Maybe a flowy midi dress? Or even a cute top with jeans and some statement earrings? Depends on the vibe you're going for, obviously.
Midi dress...hmm, good idea! I have that blue one with the floral print. But is it too much? I don't want to look like I'm trying too hard, you know? Casual but cute is the goal, I guess.

Blue floral sounds perfect! Pair it with some simple sandals or wedges. And a denim jacket in case it gets chilly. Hair down, maybe some light makeup. You'll look amazing! Don't overthink it, seriously.
Okay, okay, blue dress it is! Sandals are a must, heels are just asking for trouble on a rooftop. Denim jacket...check. Light makeup...double check. You're a lifesaver, seriously! Thanks, yaar!
Anytime, dost! Now go get ready and have an awesome time! And *sun*, tell me all about it tomorrow! No details spared, samajh gayi? All the best, and enjoy your date!
Oye, kya scene hai? Itni chup kyu hai? Aaj toh Sunday hai, chill maar. Thinking of ordering something tasty. Kya khayega? My treat, boss! Been craving some good ol' comfort food, you know?
Arre, bhai, kya bolu, thoda low feel ho raha tha. But your offer is tempting! I'm in. What's on your mind? I'm up for anything, bas spicy hona chahiye. Kuch chatpata ho toh mazaa aa jaye.

Spicy toh pakka! How about some chhole bhature from that Punjabi place near my house? They make it extra teekha with loads of pyaaz and hari mirch. Or maybe we try that new biryani place everyone's talking about?

Chhole bhature sounds amazing! It's been ages since I had some authentic ones. Biryani is good too, but aaj chhole bhature ka mood hai. Let's go with that Punjabi place. Jaldi order kar, bhookh se pet mein chuhe daud rahe hai.

Done and done! Ordered two plates, extra spicy and with extra pyaaz. Should be here in like half an hour. Tab tak, let’s put on some music and relax. What’s your favorite song these days? Bollywood ya Hollywood?

Perfect! You're the best, yaar. Music sounds great. Aaj mood Bollywood ka hai. That new song from the movie 'Animal' is stuck in my head. 'Hua Main'. Play that, and let the chhole bhature arrive. Life is good!
Oye sunn, what happened to Aisha? Last week she was all excited about that guy from Tinder, and now she's totally MIA. Phone bhi nahi utha rahi. Ghost hogayi kya scene hai?

Arre yaar, don't even get me started! Aisha ka toh wohi hai. One minute she's head over heels, the next, poof! Maybe the guy said something really cheesy? Ya phir she just got bored. You know how she is.
Cheesy toh woh khud bhi bolti hai! But still, ghosting is so rude na? At least tell the poor guy it's not working out. Ab woh banda soch raha hoga kya hogaya. Thoda toh courtesy dikhao.

I agree, it's not cool. But you know Aisha. Confrontation avoid karne ke liye she'll just disappear. Maybe she'll resurface in a week with a new story. Let's just give her some time, she'll explain eventually.

Yeah, you're right. Aisha will be Aisha. Still, I feel bad for the guy. Tinder dates are tough enough without being ghosted. Next time I see her, I'm giving her a lecture about basic human decency. Pakka.
Hahaha, good luck with that! But seriously, maybe we should plan a girls' night out? Distract her from whatever drama she's created. Golgappe and gossip should do the trick. What say?
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I was thinking, how to save some serious dough, yaar? Har mahine end mein toh haalat tight ho jaati hai. Koi jugaad bata na, bhai!
Arre bhai, woh toh same pinch! I've been trying too. I started with a small SIP, you know? Mutual funds mein thoda-thoda invest karo. Long term mein toh pakka faayda hoga. Aur kya kar raha hai tu?
SIP? Sun toh rakha hai, but darr lagta hai. Share market kaafi volatile hai na? Koi aur simple tareeka bata na. Like, chillar bachane ka koi idea. Maybe cutting down on chai-sutta breaks?

Haan, woh bhi sahi hai. Small expenses add up, right? But I also started using apps to track my expenses. Itna kharcha dekhta hoon toh khud hi control aa jaata hai. Try kar, maybe it'll work for you too.
Expense tracker? Interesting. Which one do you use? And also, I was thinking of cutting down on ordering food online. Ghar ka khaana is not only healthier but cheaper too, right?
Exactly! Ghar ka khaana rocks! I use Moneyfy. Give it a shot. Aur haan, maybe we can start cooking together once a week? That way, both of us save money and eat healthy. What do you say?

Accha suno, thinking of taking someone special out. Not the usual fancy place. More like, you know, a chill vibe. I was thinking that maybe a bookstore with a coffee shop inside would be perfect. What do you think, yaar?

Arre bhai, that's a brilliant idea! Bookstores are so underrated. It shows you're thoughtful, not just throwing money around. Which bookstore are you thinking of? Somewhere with good coffee and comfy chairs is a must, right?

Exactly! I was eyeing 'The Bookworm' in Bandra. Heard their coffee is decent and they have those comfy armchairs near the window. Plus, she's a big reader, so plenty to talk about. Wish me luck, hopefully, I can impress her.

Bandra is always a good choice. 'The Bookworm' sounds perfect! Just make sure you grab those armchairs early, they're always in demand. And hey, maybe pick out a book for her? Nothing too cheesy, though. Keep it subtle, bhai.

Good point about the chairs! I'll try to get there a bit early. And the book idea is genius! Maybe a collection of short stories? Something light and fun. Thanks for the tips, yaar! You're a lifesaver, as always.

Koi baat nahi, bhai! Always happy to help a friend in need. Just relax, be yourself, and let the books do the talking. And don't forget to tell me how it goes! All the best, and may you find your happily ever after!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Sunao, movies wagera kuch dekhi kya recently? Office mein bore ho raha hoon, socha weekend pe plan banaye.
Bhai, tu bhi na, hamesha movie ke chakkar mein. Haan, 'Fighter' dekhi maine, mast action hai. But story thodi predictable hai. 'Article 370' bhi release hui hai, suna hai political drama hai.
Arre yaar, action toh theek hai, but I'm looking for something with a good story. Article 370 type kuch interesting ho toh bata. Varna, woh 'Kalki 2898 AD' ka trailer dekha tha, woh kaisi rahegi?
Kalki toh bhai, science fiction hai, abhi release nahi hui. Article 370 mein Kashmir ka issue dikhaya hai, critics toh keh rahe hain acchi hai. Soch le, agar political drama pasand hai toh dekh le.
Hmmm, thik hai. Article 370 hi try karte hai phir. Weekend pe chalte hai. Tu book kar lena tickets. Popcorn mera. Aur haan, koi aur bhi movie release hui toh bata dena, plan change bhi ho sakta hai.

Done bhai! Tickets main book kar dunga. Aur haan, 'Fallen Angel' bhi sunne mein aa rahi hai. Horror hai. But Article 370 is a good choice. Lets watch it and then chai pe charcha karenge, movie ke baare mein.

Accha suno, remember that time we tried making rajma chawal in the hostel? It turned into this gloppy mess that stuck to the pot for days! Even the mess wale bhaiyya couldn't salvage it. Total disaster, yaar!

Oh god, don't remind me! That rajma-pocalypse! I think we used haldi instead of lal mirch, right? And the pressure cooker whistle just wouldn't stop! We almost set off the fire alarm in the whole building. Epic fail!

And then there was that time we tried to sneak into the Bollywood night at that club near campus. We used fake IDs, remember? But the bouncer saw right through us! We got banned for a whole semester, I think.

Arre, how can I forget! My fake ID had a picture of Aishwarya Rai on it! What was I even thinking? And you had a name like 'Rajesh Sharma' on yours! We were so bad at being sneaky. Still, it was fun trying!
Haha, those were the days! Remember studying for exams? We'd end up watching Bollywood movies and eating Maggi all night instead. Then we'd regret it in the morning during the viva. Total timepass!

Exactly! We thought we were so smart, cramming the night before. But Professor Sharma always knew! He'd ask the most random questions. Still, those late-night Maggi sessions are some of my best memories from uni, yaar. Good times!
Accha suno, I just finished reading this book, 'The Silent Patient'. The ending was totally unexpected, yaar! You won't believe the twist. I need to discuss it with someone over coffee ASAP.
Oh ho! 'The Silent Patient'? I've heard it's quite a page-turner. Tell me, without giving away too much, what made the twist so mind-blowing? I'm free for coffee tomorrow, maybe CCD?

Okay, so the whole time you think one character is the culprit, right? But then, in the last few chapters, bam! It's someone completely different, someone you'd never suspect. CCD sounds perfect. Kal pakka?
Arre, suspense toh mujhe bhi pasand hai! This sounds right up my alley. So, is it more of a psychological thriller or a murder mystery kinda vibe? Done deal for tomorrow, let's say around 4 PM?

It's definitely more psychological, delving into the minds of the characters. The author really messes with your perception. And yes, 4 PM at CCD is perfect. I’ll bring the book along, you can see what I mean.
Wah! Book bhi lana? Then I'll make sure to come prepared with all my detective skills! I'm already excited to dissect this plot with you. See you tomorrow then! Good night, shabba khair!

Oye sunn, I was thinking, you know na, about applying for masters abroad? I'm so confused yaar, which country to choose? America, UK, Australia...sab mein alag scene hai. Tuition fees bhi toh dekhni hai. What's your take on this entire study abroad thing?

Accha, I've been doing some research too. America is great for opportunities, but expensive. UK is shorter, but job market ka scene thoda tricky hai. Australia seems chill, but distance is a factor. Let’s make a pros and cons list together? That might help us decide.

Good idea! Aur visa process bhi toh hai, kitna complicated hota hai na? And what about scholarships? I heard getting them is like winning a lottery. Papa toh tension mein aa jayenge if I talk about the expenses. Kaise manage karein?

Visa ka toh tension mat le, there are consultants who can guide us. Scholarships ke liye, we need to start applying early and build a strong profile. Let’s aim for good grades and extracurriculars. Papa ko dheere dheere samjhayenge, don't worry.

Haan yaar, sahi bol rahi hai. Let’s hit the library this weekend and research universities. Which field are you thinking of going into, by the way? I'm still stuck between Data Science and Artificial Intelligence. Help me out!

Cool, library sounds like a plan! I am leaning towards Computer Science, specialising in cybersecurity. Data Science and AI are both hot fields, though. Maybe we can talk to some seniors who are already studying abroad and get their insights? That might give us more clarity.
Oye, kya scene hai? Kitne saal ho gaye, yaar! Last time tujhe school mein dekha tha, ab toh shaadi ke card pe milenge kya?
Arre bhai, kya yaad dila diya! School ke din bhi kya din the, tension-free life. Ab toh bas EMI aur kaam ke pressure mein phase hue hain.
Sachhi! Woh Principal Sharma ki morning assembly wali lecture yaad hai? Aur woh physics ka sir, hamesha daant te rehte the. Woh din kabhi nahi bhool sakte.
Haan, aur woh canteen ke samose, kya taste tha! Aaj tak waise samose kahin nahi mile. Aur humesha line mein jhagda hota tha, 'pehla main, pehla main'.
Exactly! Aur woh annual day drama, jisme humne joker ka role play kiya tha. Kitni hasi aati thi practice ke time par bhi. Woh sab best memories hain.
Bhai, dil toh karta hai wapas chale jayein. Woh school life hi best thi. Chal, next time milte hain toh school ke canteen mein chai peete hain, memories taza karte hain!

Arre yaar, Rakhi aa rahi hai. What to wear, man? I'm thinking kurta-pajama, but which colour? And what about a gift for my sister? It has to be something special, you know? She always gets me the best stuff.

Bhai, kurta-pajama toh solid choice hai. Go for a nice, festive colour like maroon or deep blue. As for the gift, think about her hobbies. Does she like jewellery? Or maybe a nice saree? Something she'll actually use and remember.

Hmm, jewellery is good, but she has so much already. Saree bhi thik hai, but which one? So many options! Maybe something from Fabindia? They have nice, simple designs. And colour… what colour should I even consider?

Fabindia is a safe bet. For the saree, think about her favourite colours. Or maybe something that complements her complexion. If she likes bright colours, go for a mustard yellow or a rani pink. Otherwise, pastels are always elegant.

Pastels, good idea! She does like those soft colours. Okay, Fabindia saree in pastel it is. Now, what about the kurta colour for me? Maroon might be too shaadi-wala, no? Blue is safer, but a little boring. Koi spicy colour batao!

Spicy colour? How about a nice olive green or a muted orange? Not too loud, but definitely stands out. And for the kurta style, go for something simple and comfortable. You don't want to be sweating in a heavy kurta all day!

Oye, batao toh sahi, kal raat wala episode dekha ya nahi? I was waiting all week, and phir yeh cliffhanger nikla. Bilkul bhi maza nahi aaya. Ab agle week tak wait karna padega. Kya suspense banaya hai yaar!

Haan bhai, dekha. I was expecting something big, but it was a slow burn. Thoda sa drag ho raha tha, mujhe toh lagta hai. But the last five minutes made up for it. Ending ne toh hila ke rakh diya. Kya twist tha, boss!

Twist toh theek hai, lekin abhi tak kuch reveal nahi kiya na? I mean, they're just teasing us. I hope they don't ruin the whole series with a bad ending. Last season mein bhi aisa hi kiya tha. It was so disappointing.

Arre, tension mat le. I think this season is better written. The characters are more developed, and the plot is tighter. Mujhe lagta hai ki they know what they're doing. Trust the process, bhai. Chill maar.

Okay, okay. I hope you're right. But agar ending kharab nikla, toh dekhna, I'm blaming you. Waise bhi, office mein kitna kaam tha kal. Isliye thoda sa late dekha. Aaj toh pakka early leave leke dekhta hoon.

Haha, fine, blame me. But I'm telling you, you won't be disappointed. Aur haan, office se jaldi nikalna. Weekend is almost here! Plan bana kuch. Movie wagera dekhte hai, ya phir kahin bahar chalte hai, kya bolta hai?
Oye, kya scene hai? I was thinking, hum dono ko kuch toh improve karna chahiye, life mein. You know, get our act together. Kya bolti hai tu?
Haan yaar, I was thinking the same! Work from home ne toh aalas bhar diya hai. Gym bhi jaana bandh. Kya karna chahiye exactly? Koi idea hai tere paas?
I was reading about this thing called 'Ikigai'. Basically, finding your purpose. Plus, maybe we could learn a new skill? Like coding or something useful for our careers?
Coding? Baap re! Too much for me. But Ikigai sounds interesting. And yes, skill toh seekhna chahiye. Maybe something less technical? Like digital marketing or content writing?
Digital marketing sounds good! Let's check out some online courses. Aur Ikigai ke liye, maybe we can start journaling or something? Figure out what makes us tick, you know?
Done deal! Digital marketing it is. And journaling, fine, I'll try. But if I start writing poetry, don't laugh. Let's find some good courses this weekend. Chal, chai peete hain!
Arre yaar, suno toh. Tumhe pata hai na, Anjali, jo humari saath yoga karti thi? Last time mili thi toh badi pareshan thi, personal problems bata rahi thi.
Haan haan, Anjali. Woh toh humesha kuch na kuch stress mein rehti hai. Kya hua usko ab? Koi naya drama toh nahi shuru ho gaya na?
Drama nahi, bhai! Bilkul opposite. Usne toh kamaal kar diya. She just landed a huge promotion at her company! Unbelievable, right? Woh toh keh rahi thi, job se nikal jayegi.
Kya baat hai! Good for her! Actually, main hamesha se jaanta tha usme potential hai. Shayad usko ek boost ki zaroorat thi. Phir bhi, badi khushi hui sunkar!
Haan, exactly! Aur pata hai, she also invested in a new flat. Woh bata rahi thi, she is finally feeling settled. Ab dekho, life kaise badalti hai!
Wah wah! Anjali toh chaa gayi. I'm so happy for her. We should plan a get-together to celebrate her success. Pakka! Chalo, let's call her this weekend.
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Been meaning to ask, yeh Flipkart Big Billion Days mein kuch dekha kya? I'm thinking of finally getting that noise-cancelling headphones, but so many options, yaar!

Arre, main toh Amazon pe ghusa hua tha! Saw some good deals on kurtis for Diwali. Noise-cancelling headphones? Sony wale dekh, they're supposed to be top-notch. But check reviews, bhai. Fake reviews bhi hote hain.

Haan yaar, reviews ka tension hai. Sony ka dekha tha, budget thoda tight ho raha hai. Maybe Boat ya JBL? Diwali cleaning bhi toh pending hai, vacuum cleaner bhi chahiye. Shopping kabhi khatam nahi hoti, na?

Exactly! Boat is good for the price. JBL bhi decent hai. Vacuum cleaner? Philips ka dekh, my mom swears by it. Aur Diwali cleaning? Don't remind me! Kal se start karna hai, pura ghar jungle ban gaya hai.
Philips okay hai, will check it out. Cleaning toh aisa lagta hai jaise Everest climb kar rahe hain. I think I'll order the headphones tonight. Any other 'must-buy' deals you spotted? Kuch batao toh.

Definitely! Check out the deals on smartwatches. Fitbit or Noise. And kitchen appliances, yaar! Mixer-grinder is on my list. Dekh le, maybe you'll find something useful. Happy shopping, and happy cleaning!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? Dekh rahi hai na social media pe kya trend ho raha hai aaj kal? Sab log woh dance reel bana rahe hai. I was thinking, should we also try it?
Arre yaar, tu bhi na! Every other day a new trend pops up. But, honestly, that dance reel is kinda catchy. Maybe we can give it a shot. But only if we don't look totally ridiculous doing it!

Exactly! Ridiculous nahi dikhna hai. Proper swag hona chahiye. Let's practice a bit before we actually film it. Shaam ko terrace pe milte hai, okay? We can even get chai and samosas while we practice!
Chai samosa sounds like a plan! And yeah, practice is a must. I saw some people’s reels, and they looked like they were having a seizure. We need to avoid that at all costs. Terrace it is, then!
Perfect! And we can even try those funny filters everyone is using. Woh 'aging filter' toh kamaal ka hai, bhai! Imagine our reaction videos after using that. It will be epic!

Haha, aging filter sounds hilarious! Okay, I'm officially on board. Terrace, chai, samosas, dance practice, and aging filters – it's a date! Let's become social media stars, or at least have a good laugh trying!
Arey yaar, Bengaluru traffic is killing me! Every day same story. Silk Board se Whitefield, it's like crossing an ocean. I leave early, still late for my music class. What to do?
Haan, Bengaluru traffic toh alag level ka hai. Have you tried taking the metro? Maybe that could save some time. Or those electric scooters? At least you can zip through some of the smaller lanes.
Metro is okay till some point, but then I have to take an auto. And auto walas, you know, they charge whatever they want! Scooter is risky, roads are crazy. I wish I could just teleport myself!
True that! Auto guys are a pain. Maybe try carpooling? There are some apps, no? Or even better, convince your students to come to you! Set up a mini-studio at home. Problem solved!
Carpooling sounds decent, will check it out. Studio at home is the dream, but space is the issue, you know? Rent in Bengaluru is sky-high! I’m stuck in this traffic loop forever, I think.
I feel you! Bengaluru is expensive and congested. But don't lose hope! Maybe try alternate routes, listen to some music while stuck in traffic, and manifest a traffic-free future! Good luck!
Accha suno, I'm thinking of hitting up that new bookstore near Linking Road this weekend. Heard they have amazing coffee and a really cozy vibe. Perfect for, you know, reading and relaxing.

Wah! Linking Road's always buzzing, but a quiet bookstore sounds like a welcome change. Is it the one with the fairy lights outside? I saw it on Instagram, looked pretty aesthetic. Good choice for a date, BTW.
Haan, that's the one! The fairy lights are definitely part of the charm. And they have a whole section dedicated to Indian authors, which I'm really excited to explore. Plus, coffee is a must, right?

Absolutely, coffee is non-negotiable! Especially with a good book. Which one are you planning to pick up? Maybe something by Jhumpa Lahiri or Arundhati Roy? They always make for a good read with chai...err...coffee!

I was actually eyeing 'A Suitable Boy' by Vikram Seth. It's a bit of a commitment, I know, but I've heard so many good things. And the bookstore has those comfy armchairs, perfect for sinking into a long novel.

Oh, 'A Suitable Boy'! That's a classic. Prepare to be transported to another world. Just make sure you don't get so engrossed that you forget you're on a date! Have a great time, and tell me all about it later!

Oye sunn, I have some spicy news about Isha! You won't believe what happened. Apparently, she finally landed that promotion she's been eyeing for ages. Office mein toh jaise Diwali ban gayi thi, sab log mithai baant rahe the.

Arre wah! That's fantastic news! Isha deserves it, yaar. She's been slogging away for so long. What position did she get? Senior Manager, right? I remember her telling me how tough the competition was. Must be feeling on top of the world!

Exactly! Senior Manager hi toh. And get this, she’s also been selected to lead a new project in Bangalore. Fully funded, big team, the works! Usko toh lottery lag gayi. Suno, party toh banti hai, boss! Chalo, plan karte hain.

Bangalore project?! That's huge! Isha toh superstar ban gayi. Party toh definitely banti hai. We should also get a nice gift for her. Something she can use in her new role. Let’s brainstorm ideas. Maybe a fancy laptop bag?

Laptop bag is a good idea, or maybe a nice noise-canceling headset. Bangalore traffic mein kaam aayega. But seriously, I'm so happy for her. She's always been such a supportive friend. We should celebrate this weekend, pakka!

Agreed, pakka! Noise-canceling headset is perfect! This weekend it is. Let’s call the others and finalize the plan. Isha ko surprise denge. She'll be so happy! Good news always brings good vibes. Chalo, let’s make it memorable!
Oye sun na, how's Sheru doing these days? Last time I saw him, he was looking a bit down. Koi problem toh nahi hai na?
Haan yaar, thoda sa pet mein gadbad chal raha tha. Vet ko dikhaya toh bola food allergy ho sakta hai. Abhi special diet pe hai. Hopefully, he'll be back to his playful self soon.
Oh, food allergy? That's a pain! Did the vet suggest any specific brands? Meri billi, Meowri, ko bhi kabhi kabhi digestion issues hote hain. Maybe it'll help her too.
Yeah, he recommended Royal Canin hypoallergenic. It's a bit pricey, but worth it if it helps Sheru. I also started giving him probiotics. You should try it for Meowri too!
Probiotics, good idea! I'll definitely check that out. Thanks! Aur bata, how often do you take Sheru for walks? I'm trying to get Meowri more active, but she's so lazy.
I try to take him twice a day, morning and evening. But honestly, monsoon mein toh mushkil ho jata hai. He hates the rain! Maybe get Meowri some toys to play with indoors?

Arre yaar, sun na, did you hear about Meera? She finally got that promotion at Google! I was so surprised when I saw her LinkedIn post. Remember how she was cribbing about her manager just last month? Kya change hai na?

Haan yaar, I saw that too! Google, wow! Good for her. She really deserves it, though. That girl has been working her butt off. I remember her pulling all-nighters during college. Lagta hai uska hard work rang laya.

Exactly! And you know what else? I heard from a reliable source – aunty next door – that she's also planning a trip to Europe. Apparently, Google is paying for a leadership conference. Mauj hai bhai, mauj!

Europe trip bhi? Wah! Meera toh chaa gayi. Remember how we used to dream about going to Europe during our graduation trip? And now she's going courtesy of Google! Life is so unfair, yaar. But seriously, I'm happy for her.

I know, right? We were stuck with Goa while she's jet-setting to Europe. But yeah, good for her. I just hope she doesn't become one of those 'I'm too good for you' types after all this success. You know how some people get.

True that. Hopefully, she'll stay grounded. I'm planning to call her tomorrow to congratulate her. Maybe we can all catch up for chai sometime next week? It's been ages since we all hung out together. Let's make a plan!
Accha suno, I've been thinking a lot about our family's diet lately. It's all become so junk-food oriented. I saw an article about meal prepping and thought maybe we should try it? What do you think?

Hmm, meal prepping? Sounds like a lot of work, yaar. But you're right, mom and dad are also complaining about their sugar levels. What kind of meals are you thinking? Something that won't take too much time to cook?

Exactly! I was thinking simple things like dal-chawal with extra veggies, maybe some grilled chicken or paneer. We can make a big batch on Sunday and portion it out. It'll be healthier and save us money on outside food too.

Okay, dal-chawal I can get behind. But grilled chicken every day? Thoda change bhi hona chahiye. Maybe we can add some sabzi like bhindi or baingan in rotation? And what about snacks in between meals?

Good point! We can definitely rotate the sabzis. And for snacks, maybe some fruits, nuts, or even roasted chana. Anything is better than the chips and biscuits that are always around. I'll start making a grocery list tonight.
Cool, sounds like a plan. Let me know if you need any help with the chopping and prepping. I can handle the music while we cook! Sunday ko thoda 'MasterChef India' ban jaate hain, kya bolti?
Arey bhai sahab, yeh Lucknow ka traffic toh jaan le lega! Roz subah civil court se hazratganj jaana is like fighting a war. Lagta hai har koi Formula 1 race mein participate kar raha hai.
Sach kaha aapne. Metro bhi itna bhara hota hai subah ke time. Ek baar toh mera dupatta darwaze mein phans gaya tha. Tab se auto hi prefer karti hu, chahe thoda zyada time lage.

Auto wale bhi kam nahi hai. 'Meter se chalenge' bolte hai, phir beech mein hi 'traffic jam hai, zyada lagega' shuru ho jaate hain. Upar se woh rickshaw wale alag hi line mein chalte hain, sabko pareshan karte hain.
Haan yaar, woh toh hai. Maine toh ab ek electric scooter le liya hai. Kam se kam apni marzi se jaa toh sakti hu. Petrol ka kharcha bhi bach gaya aur thoda exercise bhi ho jaata hai.
Scooter is a good idea. Par woh Lucknow ki garmi mein dhoop se bachna bhi toh mushkil hai. Traffic se bachke dhoop mein jhulso, kya karein. Koi toh solution nikalna chahiye.
Sahi baat hai. Jab tak public transport thoda aur improve nahi hota, tab tak toh yeh traffic ka chakkar chalta hi rahega. Chalo, chai peete hain, thoda toh tension kam hoga.
Oye, kya scene hai? Visa ka kuch update mila kya? I'm still waiting for that bloody email. Tension ho raha hai yaar, sab plans ussi pe depend karte hain, pata hai na?
Arre bhai, tu bhi? Mera bhi same haal hai. Consultant bol raha tha processing mein time lag raha hai. Darr lag raha hai kahin reject na ho jaye. Phir toh sab sapne dhare ke dhare reh jayenge.
Exactly! Aur gharwale alag se pressure bana rahe hain. Unko lagta hai jaise visa toh aise hi mil jaata hai, bas jaake line mein khade ho jao. Samajhte nahi hain kitna competition hai aajkal.
Sahi bol raha hai. Gharwale toh aise treat karte hain jaise government humare rishtedaar hain. Anyway, I heard some people are trying to expedite it by talking to some agent. Should we also try that?
Agent? Mujhe toh thoda risky lagta hai. Kahin fraud na ho jaye. Lekin agar koi trusted source hai toh soch sakte hain. Bata agar kuch pata chale toh. I need to finalize my tickets soon.
Haan yaar, I understand. Chal, let's keep each other updated. Aur bhai, positive reh. Sab theek ho jayega. Bhagwan pe bharosa rakh. Aur chai pe chal, dimag thoda shant hoga.

Accha suno, weekend ka kya plan hai? I was thinking maybe we could catch a movie or something. So much work during the week, I just want to chill. Waise bhi, itni garmi hai, bahar ghoomne ka mann nahi karta.

Haan yaar, garmi toh bohot hai. Movie sounds good! Koi naye release hue hai kya? Ya phir ghar pe hi Netflix and chill karein? Actually, I need to finish some pending work too, but let’s see. Chai toh mast banayi hai tumne.

Netflix bhi theek hai, but I was hoping to get out of the house. Maybe just for a little bit? Dekhte hain. Work toh kabhi khatam nahi hota, you know? We could go for a late-night drive after you finish up your work, maybe?

Late-night drive is a great idea! Thoda hawa bhi lag jaayegi. Okay, I’ll try to wrap up my work by 9 pm. Then we can decide where to go. Any particular cuisine you're craving? Chinese, maybe? Ya phir biryani?

Biryani sounds amazing! Let’s do that. We can order from that new place near my house, heard it's really good. And after that, long drive? Perfect weekend plan sorted, then! Thanks for agreeing, I really needed this.

Done deal! Biryani it is. And yes, a long drive is a must. Relax karo abhi, chai piyo. Weekend stress nahi lene ka. I’m glad we’re doing this too, needed a break from work myself. Cheers to the weekend!
Oye Vikram, kya scene hai weekend ka? Any plans ya phir bore hona hai ghar pe? Socha tha kahin ghumne chalein, but phir yaad aaya mera toh budget tight hai. Batao, tumhara kya plan hai?

Arre bhai, filhaal toh koi pakka plan nahi hai. Event planning se itna thak gaya hoon ki bas relax karna hai. Maybe movie dekhne chala jaunga, ya doston ke saath chai peene. Tum batao, aur koi option hai toh?

Movie toh theek hai, but woh toh humesha hota rehta hai. Soch raha tha ki kisi hill station ya phir koi trekking trip plan karein. Par woh sab toh budget se bahar hai. Kya karein yaar, life is so boring.

Haan yaar, I feel you. Budget ka issue toh hamesha rehta hai. Maybe we can explore some local places, like gardens or historical sites. Ya phir, ghar pe hi game night rakhte hain. Kuch toh karna padega weekend ko interesting banane ke liye.
Game night is a good idea! We can call some other friends too and have a potluck. Everyone brings something to eat. That way, budget bhi sambhal jayega and hum sab enjoy bhi karenge. What do you say?

Perfect! Game night final. I'll start making a list of games we can play. Tum bhi apne friends ko inform kar do. And yeah, don't forget the chai! Weekend toh set ho gaya, finally. Thank you for the idea!
Accha suno, I'm thinking of surprising him with a dinner date. Jaipur mein beachside cafe suna hai? Kaisa rahega? Romantic bhi, thoda different bhi. Kya kehti ho tum?

Beachside in Jaipur? Interesting! I didn't know there were beachside cafes there. But if it’s romantic and different, toh definitely go for it! Just check reviews first, Jaipur mein beach... thoda ajeeb lag raha hai.
Haan, wahi toh. Theek hai, I'll do some research. Maybe it's more of a 'beach-themed' cafe. Lekin romantic toh hona chahiye, candles wagera, you know? Surprise hai toh kuch special toh karna padega.
Exactly! Ambience is key. Check if they have live music, maybe some ghazals? Or a rooftop with a view. Beach theme mein maybe seafood options honge? He likes seafood, right?
Arre wah, tumne toh idea hi de diya! Rooftop sounds amazing. And yes, he loves seafood. I'll check for rooftop, seafood, and maybe some fairy lights. Thanks, yaar! You're a lifesaver.
Anytime! Just imagine, Jaipur ki hawa, rooftop view, candles, and delicious seafood. He'll be so impressed! Don't forget to wear something nice! All the best for your romantic date!
Accha suno, vacation ka kya scene hai? Mujhe lagta hai humein budget pe dhyan dena chahiye. Last time toh bohot kharcha ho gaya tha. Is baar thoda plan karke chalte hain, kya kehti ho?

Haan, woh toh hai. Last time humne bina soche samjhe shopping kar li thi. Iss baar ek rough estimate banate hain. Flights, hotel, aur activities ka alag-alag hisaab rakhenge. Tumhare kya ideas hain, batao?

Mera idea hai ki hum pehle destination decide karein. Phir dekhte hain ki flights kitne ki hain. Aur hotel mein bhi options dekh lenge, Airbnb bhi try kar sakte hain. Activities toh wahan jaake bhi plan ho jayengi, kya kehte ho?

Airbnb is a good option, definitely cheaper than hotels. Flights ke liye, I think we should book in advance to get better deals. Aur activities ka bhi thoda research kar lenge toh wahan time waste nahi hoga. Perfect plan!

Perfect! Toh tum flights aur accommodation dekh lo. Main activities aur food ke options research karta hoon. Phir ek excel sheet banate hain aur sab kuch track karte hain. Is baar budget se nahi bhatkenge, pakka promise!

Done deal! Excel sheet is the key. Aur haan, thoda buffer bhi rakhenge unexpected expenses ke liye. Vacation should be relaxing, not stressful. Budgeting is important, par enjoy bhi karna hai, samjhe?
Sat sri akal ji! Aj phir late ho gaya. Yaar, Amritsar mein traffic ka toh kuch karna padega. Every single day same haal. By the time I reach office, half my energy is gone fighting through the chaos.

Sat sri akal! Haan bhai, tussi sahi keh rahe ho. Amritsar di traffic toh bas Allah hi bachaye. Isiliye main toh cycle use karta hoon. Thoda exercise bhi ho jata hai and pollution bhi kam hota hai. Par tussi event planner ho, cycle kaise chalayoge?

Cycle toh impossible hai, bhai. Sare event ka samaan lekar kaise jaunga? Plus, clients bhi milne hote hain. Auto rickshaw bhi try kiya, but meter koi nahi manta. Seedha double rate bolte hain. It's just too much hassle.

Acha, toh phir kya plan hai? Koi electric scooter dekha? Thoda investment hoga but in the long run, petrol ka kharcha toh bachega. Aur parking ka issue bhi kam ho jayega. Plus, environment ke liye bhi achha hai.

Electric scooter is an option, sochna padega. But charging points ka bhi scene dekhna hoga na? Ghar pe toh hai, lekin event locations pe kya hoga? Maybe I'll look into carpooling with someone from the office. Koi toh mil jayega.

Carpooling is a good idea! Ya phir, tussi government buses try karo. They've started some new routes. Maybe one of them passes near your event locations. Worth checking out, yaar. Kuch toh karna padega is traffic ka.
Oye, kya scene hai? Last week toh bol raha tha weekend plan karenge, aur phir gayab hi ho gaya? Batao toh sahi, kya hua tha?
Arre bhai, sorry yaar! Actually, last minute pe mama ji aa gaye the ghar pe. Family emergency thi, isliye phone bhi nahi dekh paya. Tujhe bataana chahiye tha, I know.
Mama ji? Weekend pe? Thoda ajeeb nahi lag raha? Just kidding! Par seriously, ek text toh kar deta. Main toh tension mein aa gaya tha, socha kahin phas toh nahi gaya.
Haan, I know, I messed up. Next time pakka bata dunga. Par trust me, it was a crazy situation. Mama ji ka pet kharab ho gaya tha, and we had to rush him to the doc.
Oh, that's serious! Koi nahi, ab sab theek hai na? Next time aisa kuch ho toh inform kar dena. I was about to call the police, socha kidnapping ho gaya tera.
Haan bhai, mama ji ab better hai. And promise, aage se aisa nahi hoga. Chal, treat deta hu is baat pe. Golgappe chalega? Sorry bolne ka best tareeka, right?
Kya haal hai bhai? Long time no see! Sab theek toh hai na? You seem a bit off lately. Office ka pressure toh nahi hai zyada? Batao yaar, share karo. Dil halka ho jaata hai.
Haan yaar, sab theek hi hai. But pata nahi, I've been feeling a bit overwhelmed. Kaam toh hai hi, but also just... life, you know? Neend bhi theek se nahi aa rahi. Just feeling low, man.
I get it, dost. Life can be a bitch sometimes. But don't let it get you down too much. Have you thought about talking to someone? Like, a therapist or counselor? It really helps, believe me.
Therapist? Yaar, woh sab toh... I don't know. It feels like a big step. Aur log kya sochenge? 'He's gone mad' type ka scene ban jayega. You know how it is.

Arey, bhool jaao logo ko. This is about you, your well-being. Mental health is just as important as physical health, bhai. And trust me, no one needs to know if you don't want them to. Main hoon na, I'll support you.
Thanks, yaar. That means a lot. I guess you're right. Shayad ek baar try karna chahiye. Where do I even start looking for someone? Koi recommendation hai tere paas?

Accha suno, I was at that new cafe, 'The Coffee Canvas' near Hazratganj yesterday. The ambience is top-notch, but honestly, the coffee was just okay. Nothing to write home about, you know? What's your take on Lucknow's best coffee place?

Oye, Canvas? I heard about it! Decor toh kamaal ka hai, Instagram-worthy. But coffee is all that matters, right? My vote still goes to 'Awadhi Brew'. Their filter coffee is legit, ekdum strong and authentic. Have you tried their cold brew too? Killer!

Filter coffee at Awadhi Brew? Haan, accha hai, I agree. But I'm always hunting for that perfect cappuccino, you know, with the right foam and that subtle chocolate dusting. 'Lucknow Grind' used to be my go-to, but the quality has dipped lately. What to do, yaar?

Arre, 'Lucknow Grind' ka cappuccino was my favourite too! That's sad to hear. Maybe we should explore some hidden gems in Aminabad? I heard there's a small place, 'Chai & Chat', that surprisingly makes a decent cappuccino. Challenge accepted?

Chai & Chat in Aminabad? A cappuccino there? That's unexpected! Okay, I'm game. But you're buying if it's a disaster, deal? I need a caffeine fix that's actually worth the calories. So, when are we going on this coffee expedition, madam?

Deal! If it's bad, my treat, pakka promise. Let's say next week? Tuesday evening, post-office hours? We can brave the Aminabad traffic together in search of this elusive perfect cappuccino. I'm already excited, even if it's just for the adventure!
Accha suno, kids these days are just glued to their phones. I'm seriously worried about screen time for my daughter. It's affecting her studies, I think. Need to put some serious limits, yaar.
Haan Kavya, I understand. It's a real struggle. My nephew is the same. All day gaming and reels. Have you tried any parental control apps? Maybe they can help manage usage a bit better?

I have, but she's too smart. She finds ways around everything! I'm thinking of a strict study schedule with screen time as a reward. But then, I don't want to make her resent studying either. It's tough.

Maybe try a balance? Like, fixed study hours with short breaks in between where she can use her phone. And then, longer screen time on weekends only if she completes her weekly goals? That might work.
Hmm, that's a good idea. A reward system could motivate her. I also need to find some activities she enjoys, something to distract her from the phone. Maybe enroll her in dance class again? Or art?

Exactly! Hobbies are key. And you know, lead by example. If you're constantly on your phone, she'll follow suit. Try setting screen-free times for the whole family. Dinner together, no phones allowed!
Accha suno, I was reading up on how much screen time kids are getting these days. It's insane, yaar! My niece is glued to her phone all day. Makes you think about setting some serious limits, right?

Haan bhai, bilkul sahi baat hai. Kids these days are addicted to those screens. I read somewhere that it affects their development. We need to find a way to balance their screen time with outdoor activities and studies.

Exactly! I was thinking of suggesting a study schedule for her, with specific times for homework and playtime, and then, maybe, a little screen time as a reward. What do you think about that approach?

That sounds like a good start, but make sure the schedule is flexible. Kids get bored easily. Maybe incorporate some fun learning apps or educational videos into the screen time to make it more productive.

Good point. Aur batao, any other ideas to keep her engaged? I don't want to be too strict, but I also need to ensure she's not just wasting her time on useless stuff all day. It's a tough balance to strike.

Maybe try involving her in household chores or hobbies. Get her interested in painting, reading, or even cooking. That way, she'll be less tempted to just grab the phone out of boredom. Plus, family time is important too!
Accha suno, it's my anniversary next month, and I'm totally blanking on gift ideas. He's not into typical stuff like watches or clothes. Koi unique idea hai tumhare paas?

Hmm, anniversary gift, eh? What about a weekend getaway? Somewhere peaceful, maybe a nice resort near Lonavala? Or perhaps an experience, like a cooking class together? That could be fun and memorable.

A weekend getaway sounds amazing, but work is crazy hectic right now. Cooking class is a good thought, but he's actually a pretty decent cook himself! I need something that feels personal and thoughtful, you know?

Okay, personal and thoughtful... How about a custom-made photo album or a scrapbook filled with your memories together? You could add little notes and inside jokes. It'll take time, but it shows you put in the effort.

That's actually a brilliant idea! A scrapbook... I can include photos from our first date, trips, and even silly moments. Where can I get a good quality scrapbook from? Online or should I check out some stores?

You can find great scrapbooks both online and in stores. Check out Itsy Bitsy or stationery shops in your area. Amazon and Flipkart also have a good selection. Don't forget to get some cute stickers and colorful pens to make it extra special!
Oye, kya scene hai? Kitne saal ho gaye, yaar! Last time school mein mile the, remember? Woh farewell party mein kitna drama hua tha, principal sir ka speech sun sun ke toh pak gaye the hum sab!

Arre bhai, kaise bhool sakta hoon! Principal sir ka speech toh evergreen torture tha. Aur woh farewell party? Epic fail! But remember Sharma ji ki nautanki? He was completely drunk and dancing like crazy. Good old days, yaar!

Haan, Sharma ji toh legend the. Class mein hamesha backbench pe so rahe hote the. Aur yaad hai, woh maths ka period? Miss Dixit ka chehra dekhne layak hota tha jab hum log answers cheat karte the. Pure torture tha woh class.

Miss Dixit was something else, yaar! Usske chakkar mein toh aadhe class ne tuition join kar li thi. Aur woh physics ke experiments? Mostly failed, but the chaos was hilarious. School life was definitely the best life.
True that! Ab toh sab life ke chakkar mein phans gaye hain. Job, family, responsibilities... School mein toh bas masti thi, tension free life. Kabhi socha bhi nahi tha ki itna change ho jayega.

Exactly! Ab toh bas bills pay karne aur EMI bharnay ka tension hai. School ke woh carefree din kahaan gaye? Chalo, next time milte hain toh school ke canteen mein chai peete hain aur puraane din yaad karte hain. Done?
Accha suno, this book is totally mind-blowing! So many twists I didn’t see coming. I'm only halfway through, but I have to tell someone before my head explodes. Coffee break, and book talk?

Arre waah, kaunsi book hai yeh? The last thriller I read was so predictable, I guessed the ending in the first chapter itself. I need something with real masala. Spill the beans, but no major spoilers!

It's 'The Silent Patient'. The artist is accused of killing her husband, but she hasn't spoken a word since. The therapist is trying to unravel her story. The twist with the diary entries? Total shocker, yaar!

Oh, I've heard about that one! It's been on my to-read list forever. Okay, okay, I'm intrigued. But seriously, promise me you won’t reveal who did it. I want to experience the 'dhamaal' myself. Chai or coffee?

Coffee, definitely coffee. I need the caffeine to process all this. Okay, no spoilers, promise. But let me just say, pay close attention to the therapist. He's not as innocent as he seems. Just saying, keep an open mind!

Aha! Now you've piqued my interest even more. Therapist, huh? Okay, I'm on it. Next time, we discuss our theories after I've read it. This sounds like the perfect escape from all the business stress. Chal, coffee then!

Oye! Kya chal raha hai? Been ages since we last chatted. Dekh na, I was thinking of buying something online. Any recommendations? I'm bored of wearing the same old clothes. Koi naya style try karna hai.

Arre bhai! Sab theek. Online shopping? Always! My current obsession is Myntra. Unke sale mein bohot discounts milte hai. Last week I got a really cool kurta for just ₹500. You should definitely check it out. Kya chahiye tujhe?

Hmm, Myntra toh hai. I was thinking more like… shoes. My old sneakers are literally falling apart. And maybe a new bag for college? Something trendy, you know? Aur bata, tere life mein kya chal raha hai?

Shoes? Ajio is your best bet, bhai. They have everything, from Nike to Adidas, and the prices are decent. Bag ke liye, check out LBB. They have some really unique stuff. Aur life toh bas exam stress mein doobi hui hai!

Exam stress? Tell me about it! I have two back-to-back next week. Anyway, thanks for the tips! I'll check out Ajio and LBB. Dekhte hai kya milta hai. Wish me luck for my online shopping spree and exams!
All the best for both! Online shopping toh stress buster hai, enjoy! Aur exams ke liye, padhai kar le, bhai. Don't just rely on online retail therapy. Let me know what you end up buying! Bye!

Accha suno, I need to hit up the bazaar tomorrow morning. Ghar mein kuch bhi nahi hai. Thinking of making some rajma chawal. What all should I get? List bana do please, otherwise, main pakka kuch bhool jaungi.

Okay, cool! Rajma toh pakka. And chawal, obviously. Check if we have enough pyaaz and tamatar, those are essentials. Dhaniya aur pudina bhi le aana, gives it that extra zing. Oh, and remind me to check if we need oil too.
Haan, pyaaz, tamatar, dhaniya toh pakka. Aur woh lauki bhi le aati hu, mummy ne bola tha healthy hota hai. Thoda adrak lehsun bhi. Oil toh hai. Anything else? I'm thinking of making some chai too.

Perfect! Lauki is a good idea. For chai, check for elaichi and adrak, if we are running low. Maybe some biscuits too for dipping? Oh, and remember to bargain with the vendors! They always try to charge extra.

Elaichi toh hai. Biscuits bhi theek hai. Haan, bargaining toh meri duty hai! Don't worry about that. Anything else that comes to mind? I want to make sure I get everything in one go. Garmi mein bazaar jaana is a task.
Okay, I think that's it for now. Just double-check for salt and mirchi powder. And maybe grab a nimbu pani while you're there to beat the heat! Send me a picture of the sabzi mandi, I miss the chaos!
Accha suno, yaar. Kya chal raha hai? Been so caught up with work lately, missed checking out any new movie releases. Koi recommendation toh do, bhai. Family ke saath dekhne layak kuch hai kya?

Haan bhai, I understand the work grind. Let me think... 'Fighter' was a decent watch, good action. If you want something light and funny, 'Crew' might be a good option, especially for the ladies in the family. Pure masala entertainment.

Hmm, 'Fighter' sounds interesting. But 'Crew' might be better for a family outing. Any idea about the reviews for 'Madgaon Express'? Heard it's hilarious, but thoda adult-oriented hai kya? Kids ke saath comfortable rahega?

'Madgaon Express' is funny, but yes, thoda adult jokes hai. Maybe skip that one for the family. 'Article 370' is also running, politically charged but well-made. Depends on your family's interest, otherwise 'Crew' is safest.
Okay, noted. 'Crew' seems like the winner then. Thanks for the suggestions, dost. Will book tickets for this weekend. Waise, how was the music? Any songs worth adding to my playlist afterwards?

The music in 'Crew' is quite catchy, especially 'Naina'. You'll definitely enjoy it. 'Fighter' also has some good tracks, 'Sher Khul Gaye' is a banger. But for a family movie, 'Crew' hits all the right notes. Enjoy!
Oye sun, beta kya kar raha hai aajkal? Last time mili toh keh rahi thi studies ka pressure hai. How are you dealing with his teenage tantrums, yaar? Parenting is a full-time job, I tell you.

Arre yaar, mat pooch. He's glued to his phone all the time. Online games, reels, pata nahi kya kya. I try to limit his screen time, but he throws a fit. It's a constant battle, believe me. I feel exhausted.

Same here! Meri beti bhi. She wants to go out with friends every weekend, late night parties. I worry so much! How do you manage the 'trust' factor? I don't want to be too strict, but safety bhi toh important hai.
Exactly! Balance karna mushkil hai. I try to have open conversations, explain my concerns, but it's hard to get through. Aajkal ke bachche sunte kahan hain? I feel like I'm always lecturing him.
I know, right? Sometimes I just want to escape! But then I remember their childhood memories, their cute little faces... and I feel guilty. Parenting is such a roller coaster, na?
Totally! Highs and lows, all mixed up. But at the end of the day, their happiness is all that matters. Chal, let’s plan a playdate for them sometime? Maybe they can influence each other for good!
Aisha yaar, Diwali event ka kya scene hai? I heard you're planning something big this year for the neighborhood? Last time toh sirf a few diyas the, is baar dhamaka karne ka plan hai kya?

Haanji! This time, proper Diwali Mela. Thinking of getting some food stalls, maybe a small stage for some Bollywood dance performances. Even trying to get a local pandit for a small puja. Thoda desi touch toh banta hai na?
Wah wah! Food stalls are a brilliant idea. Samosa, jalebi, aur kya kya hoga? Aur yeh dance performance kaun karega? Our building kids? I can ask my niece, she’s a great dancer, एकदम professional!

Samosa toh pakka! Jalebi, maybe some ladoos too. I'm open to suggestions, actually. And yes, building kids are welcome. Tell your niece to sign up! We need all the talent we can get. It's for everyone, yaar!
Done deal! I'll talk to her tonight. Funding ka kya scene hai? Are you taking donations? I can contribute a bit. Diwali hai toh sabko milke celebrate karna chahiye, hai na? Let me know the details.

Yes, we are taking donations. Every bit helps! Will send you the details tomorrow. Thanks so much for offering to contribute. This Diwali, the whole neighborhood will light up together, bilkul filmistar style!
Oye, sunn! Indore mein sabse best coffee kahan milti hai, bata toh yaar. I'm tired of trying all these cafes and being disappointed. Batao, kaunsa cafe hai jahan dil khush ho jaye?

Arre bhai, Indore mein coffee? Tough competition hai! But I'd say Chappan Dukaan mein ek try kar. There's this small place, usually crowded, but their coffee hits the spot. Ya phir, try Vijay Nagar side, some fancy cafes have opened up.

Chappan mein toh chai-nashta theek hai, coffee ka scene mujhe kuch khaas laga nahi. Vijay Nagar mein kaunsa? Batao toh, specific place. I need strong coffee, you know, lawyer wala caffeine boost, case files khatam karne ke liye!

Okay, okay, lawyer saab! Try 'The Coffee Factory' in Vijay Nagar. Thoda pricey hai, but their cold brew is amazing. Otherwise, if you want something strong and local, look for small South Indian places. Filter coffee might surprise you!

South Indian coffee in Indore? Interesting! Never thought of that. The Coffee Factory, noted. But yaar, filter coffee ka taste... thoda different hota hai na? I need something that tastes like proper cafe-style cappuccino.

Haan, taste is different, but it's a good different! Give it a shot. Otherwise, Coffee Factory's cappuccino is pretty decent too. And hey, try their chocolate croissant while you're at it. Perfect caffeine and sugar rush combo for those late-night studies!

Suniyega, Principal ma'am se baat hui kya PTM ke liye? I was thinking next Saturday morning would work best for most parents, especially those working folks. Phir attendance ka bhi issue nahi hoga. Kya kehte hain aap?

Haan, baat toh hui thi. Saturday morning ka idea accha hai. Let’s confirm with the other teachers too, ki unki availability kya hai. We need to make sure everyone's on the same page, nahi toh phir parents pareshaan honge.

Bilkul sahi. Aur agenda kya rakhe is baar? Last time toh sirf marks distribution pe hi baat hui thi. This time, I was thinking of focusing on overall development and career guidance. Thoda practical approach hona chahiye.

Haan, that’s a great point. Career guidance is definitely important. Maybe we can invite a guest speaker too? Someone from the industry, jo students ko real-world insights de sake. What do you think about that?

Awesome idea! Guest speaker would be fantastic. Koi alumnus hoga jisko hum contact kar sakte hain? Someone who can connect with the students and parents easily. Let's brainstorm some names tomorrow during lunch break.

Perfect! Lunch break mein pakka discuss karte hain. I'll also check my network for potential speakers. Meanwhile, let’s draft a basic email to send to the parents, informing them about the PTM and its objectives. Done?
Oye sunn, yeh climate change ka scene kya hai? I mean, itni garmi pad rahi hai, aur baarish toh aati hi nahi jab chahiye. Kya lagta hai, duniya khatam hone wali hai kya?
Arre bhai, khatam toh nahi hogi, but seriously, things are getting messed up. Global warming ka asar dikh raha hai na? Pata nahi log kab seriously lenge pollution aur deforestation ko.
Exactly! I was reading ki glacier pighal rahe hai, sea levels badh rahe hai. Aur hum yahan AC mein baithke chill kar rahe hai. Guilt trip hota hai yaar, thoda toh.
Haan, guilt toh hona chahiye. At least we can start small, right? Like, less plastic, more public transport. And tell everyone else to do the same. Ek-ek karke hi toh badlaav aayega.
True that! Chalo, next time se metro pakadte hai. And maybe try to plant a tree or something during monsoon. Let's do our bit, however small it may seem.
Perfect! And less ordering in, more ghar ka khana. Packaging kam hoga. Deal? Hum log karenge toh aur bhi log inspire honge. Climate change ko serious lena padega, boss.
Accha suno, office mein stress toh sabko hota hai. Lekin ghar pe bhi wohi tension leke aana... yeh toh sahi nahi hai na? Kaise handle karte ho tum log, relationship mein work-life balance?

Haan bhai, mushkil toh hai. Main toh koshish karta hoon ki office ka kaam office mein hi khatam kar doon. Ghar jaake phone side mein, aur sirf family time. Dinner table pe no work talks, strict rule hai!
Woh toh theek hai, lekin kabhi kabhi deadlines aisi hoti hain ki raat bhar jaagna padta hai. Phir toh gharwalein naraaz ho jaate hain. Upar se HR ka kaam, hamesha logo ki problems suno.
Dekho, communication is key. Apni partner ko samjhao ki kya chal raha hai. Unhe bhi pata hona chahiye ki tum kitna pressure handle kar rahe ho. Aur jab free time mile, toh fully devote karo.
Sahi baat hai. Kabhi kabhi socha hai ki yoga vagera shuru kar doon. Thoda mann shant rahega aur stress bhi kam hoga. Kya bolte ho, yeh idea kaisa hai?

Absolutely! Yoga is a great way to de-stress. Aur saath mein, weekend pe short trip plan karo, kahi hill station ya beach pe. It helps to recharge and reconnect with your partner. Try it, you'll feel the difference!

Oye sunn, I’m planning a surprise birthday party for someone special. Thinking of keeping it low-key, maybe at that rooftop cafe near college? Need your help though, completely clueless about decorations and stuff.

Arre wah, that's so sweet! Rooftop cafe sounds perfect. Decorations toh main dekh lunga, no tension. We can get some fairy lights, balloons, maybe even a small banner. Food ka kya scene hai? Cake toh must hai, obviously.

Cake toh pakka hai! Chocolate truffle, his favorite. Food mein maybe some snacks, like spring rolls and paneer tikka. I was also thinking of getting a small speaker for some background music. What do you think?

Perfect plan! Paneer tikka is always a hit. Speaker is a great idea, we can play some Bollywood hits. But listen, keep it a secret from everyone! Especially him, warna surprise ka mazaa hi nahi rahega.
Haan haan, secret toh rakhna hi hai. I’ve only told a few close friends. We need to make sure he doesn’t suspect anything. Maybe we can tell him we're just going for a casual chai?
Exactly! Chai plan is the best. We'll lure him there and BAM! Surprise! I'll coordinate with the others and make sure everyone is on time. This is going to be epic! Let’s finalize the date now.
Accha suno, Navratri ki planning kahan tak pahunchi? Office mein toh sab busy hain, lekin ghar pe lighting aur rangoli ka kya scene hai? Ma ko bola tha help karne ke liye, unhone kuch idea diya?

Haan bhai, Maa ne kuch traditional designs bataye hain rangoli ke liye. Lighting ka bhi unkaafi acha idea hai, woh kehti hain ki colorful lights lagao, Diwali jaisa feel aana chahiye. Main soch raha tha ki LED strips use karoon, energy bhi bachegi.

LED strips toh sahi hai, lekin thoda Indian touch bhi hona chahiye na? Kuch diyas bhi laga do, authentic lagega. Rangoli mein colors kaise? Kuch vibrant colors use karna, Navratri hai, dull nahi hona chahiye.

Colors ka toh maine list bana liya hai, red, yellow, green, blue sab hai. Maa keh rahi thi ki beech mein ek bada sa diya rakhna, woh shubh hota hai. Aur haan, thoda glitter bhi daal dete hain, chamak dhamak honi chahiye.
Perfect! Glitter is a must. Aur haan, woh jo flower petals hote hain na, woh bhi use karna. Rangoli aur bhi sundar lagegi. Bas, photo bhej dena jab ho jaye, dekhna hai kaisa bana hai.

Zaroor bhai! Photo toh pakka bhejunga. Maa keh rahi thi ki agar time mile toh ek chhoti si Pooja bhi kar lenge. Navratri hai, thoda bhajan-kirtan toh hona hi chahiye. Lighting aur rangoli ka setup kal tak done ho jayega.
Acha suno, I have a first date this weekend. Rooftop restaurant scene hai, you know? I'm completely blank on what to wear. Something that says 'I'm cool but also classy,' you get it?
Arre wah, first date! Rooftop is nice. Hmm, how about a midi dress? Something flowy, maybe with a subtle print? Pair it with some wedges or block heels. Comfortable but still stylish, you know?
Midi dress is a good idea! I was also thinking of maybe some wide-legged trousers and a nice top? But will that be too formal? I don't want to look like I'm going for a job interview, yaar.

Nahin, wide-legged trousers can totally work! Just make sure the top is something a bit more fun and flirty. Maybe a silk cami or a top with some interesting sleeves? Accessorize with some delicate jewelry.
Okay, silk cami sounds good! And what about colors? Should I go for something bright and bold, or stick to neutrals? I'm so confused. This date pressure is real, bhai!

Depends on your mood! If you're feeling bold, a jewel-toned top would look amazing. Otherwise, you can never go wrong with a classic black or navy. Just add a pop of color with your accessories! All the best for your date!
Accha suno, Holi aa rahi hai. Socha hai is baar apne mohalle mein ek saath celebrate karein? Last year toh sab apne apne mein the, mazaa nahi aaya tha. Kya kehte ho?
Haan, idea toh mast hai! Lekin arrange kaun karega? Aur kitna crowd expect kar rahe ho? Warna toh phir wahi hoga, bheed mein sab gum ho jayenge.
Mein arrange karungi! Hum ek committee bana sakte hain, sab milke kaam karenge. Thoda music, thoda rang, aur kuch snacks ka jugaad karte hain. Budget bhi bana lenge.
Okay, I am in! Music ka tension mat lo, mera bhai DJ hai, woh free mein set laga dega. Rang aur snacks ka dekhte hain. Kya kya options hain mind mein?
Rang toh organic hi lena hai, chemical wala nahi. Snacks mein samosa, jalebi, aur thandai ka plan hai. Aur kuch suggestions ho toh batao. Let's make it a memorable Holi!
Perfect! Organic rang is a must. Thandai mein bhang bhi dalenge kya, just kidding! But seriously, let's make sure sab safe rahein aur Holi ka full mazaa lein. I'll help with the snacks.
Oye, kya scene hai? Aaj toh mess mein aloo paratha tha, lekin line itni lambi thi ki mann hi nahi kiya. Phir woh chai wala bhi gayab tha, exam stress mein sab bhool gaya kya?
Arre bhai, mat puch. Assignment deadline sir pe hai aur laptop bhi hang ho raha hai. Aloo paratha toh sapna hi reh gaya. Chai ki toh mujhe bhi zaroorat hai, sar dard kar raha hai yaar.
Chal, hostel ke bahar woh Sharma uncle ki tapri pe chalte hain. Chai bhi milegi aur thoda refresh bhi ho jayenge. Assignment toh raat bhar karna hi hai, thoda break toh banta hai na?
Haan, yeh sahi hai. Sharma uncle ki chai is life saver. Aur suna hai woh samosa bhi garam garam banata hai. Assignment toh baad mein dekhenge, pehle pet puja zaroori hai.
Perfect! Fir toh plan pakka. Samosa aur chai, exam stress ke liye best remedy. Chal nikalte hain, warna woh Sharma uncle bhi band kar denge dukaan.
Chalo, chalo! Lekin bhai, bill toh tu pay karega. Last time maine pay kiya tha. Exam ke baad party teri taraf se, done deal?
Sun beta, board exams are coming up. Are you studying properly or just chilling with your dost log? Time nikal raha hai, and you know how important these marks are for your future.

Mom, chill karo na! I'm studying. Thoda friends ke saath bhi toh ghumna hota hai. Brain ko refresh bhi karna hai. I promise I'm taking it seriously. All subjects are going well, especially Maths and Science.

Okay, okay, I understand. But beta, consistent study is key. Don't leave things for the last minute. Solve sample papers daily. That will help you understand the exam pattern and manage time effectively during the actual exam.

Haan maa, woh toh main kar raha hoon. I'm solving at least one sample paper every day. Also, I'm focusing on understanding the concepts rather than just rote learning. Thanks for reminding me, though!

Good, that's the right approach. And remember to take breaks. Every hour, get up, walk around, maybe listen to some music. Don't burn yourself out. Proper rest is important too. Khaana peena time pe karna.
Okay, Mom. I will. Promise. I'm actually feeling quite confident. Just need to stay focused and avoid distractions. Thanks for the advice and the pep talk. Ab main padhai karne jaa raha hoon, bye!

Arey yaar, yeh PTM ka tension alag hai. I mean, business sambhalu ya phir iski padhai? Samajh nahi aata kya karu. Upar se, teacher ne specifically bulaya hai, matlab kuch toh gadbad hai. Kal jaana hai, socha tha aaj thoda business ka kaam nikal lu.

Haan, woh toh hai. Bachhon ki PTMs are like surprise tests for us parents. Don't worry, sab theek ho jayega. Just talk to the teacher calmly. Maybe they just want to discuss some extra help she might need. You know how they are these days, always with the extra classes.

Exactly! Extra classes ka chakkar hi samajh nahi aata. Itne tuition laga diye hain, phir bhi PTM bulawa aa gaya. I was hoping to launch my new product line this week, but now this is my priority. Dekhte hain kal kya bolti hain teacher.

See, don't stress too much. Maybe it's a good thing. You can find out exactly where she is struggling and nip it in the bud. Better to address it now than later, right? Besides, it shows you care, which is the most important thing.

Haan, woh toh hai. I’ll take some time off tomorrow. I need to prepare some questions for the teacher. Like, is she participating in class? Is she distracted? And what’s with the low marks in math? Hopefully, it's nothing too serious.

Absolutely, go prepared. And don't forget to ask about her overall well-being too. School can be tough, especially for teenagers. Maybe she's feeling pressured or stressed about something. All the best for tomorrow! Let me know how it goes.

Arey sir, free period hai? Bataiye, koi interesting book padhi aaj kal? I'm looking for something new to read, exam stress kam karne ke liye. I need a good escapist novel, woh bhi without being too heavy on the mind.

Haan beta, thoda time hai. Actually, I just finished 'The Namesake' by Jhumpa Lahiri. It's a beautiful story about identity and belonging, especially for desis. You might find it relatable, given your age and aspirations.

'The Namesake'? Sounds interesting! What did you like most about it, sir? I've heard the name before, but never really considered reading it. I'm usually into more fantasy stuff, like Harry Potter types.

I loved the portrayal of the immigrant experience and the generational gap. It's not fantasy, but the characters are so real, you'll feel like you know them. It made me think about my own roots and where I belong in this world, you know?

Hmm, that does sound thought-provoking. Okay, I'll give it a try. You know, I've been reading 'The Alchemist' again. It's so inspiring! It tells you to follow your dreams, even if it's hard. Have you read it, sir?

Ah, 'The Alchemist'! A classic! Yes, I read it years ago. A good reminder to listen to your heart and pursue your passion. It's a great choice for a young mind like yours, full of potential. Padhte raho, aur kya!
Oye, kya scene hai? Socha kya life mein karna hai? Yeh engineering toh theek hai, but dil kya bolta hai?
Yaar, engineering is safe, parents bhi khush. But woh creative side ka kya? I was thinking maybe try graphic designing ya photography. Thoda risk toh hai, par interesting bhi toh hai na?
Exactly! Safe toh sab karte hain. But apna passion follow karna is different. Graphic designing is cool, scope bhi hai aajkal. Portfolio strong banao, phir dekho kaise offers aate hain.
Haan, portfolio is the key. Woh toh hai. I've been taking some online courses, trying to build it up. Par darr bhi lagta hai, parents kya kahenge, job milegi ya nahi. You know how it is.
Parents toh bolte rahenge. End mein, apni life hai. Ek baar try toh kar. Worst case, engineering toh hai hi backup. But at least you won't regret not trying. Kya bolta hai?
Tu sahi bol raha hai. Regret nahi hona chahiye. Let's do this, I'll give it my all for the next few months. If it works out, great. If not, back to the books. Thanks, yaar, for the pep talk!

Accha suno, vacation ka kya plan hai? I was thinking we should decide on a budget first. Last time toh bohot kharcha ho gaya tha, remember? This time, let's be a bit more careful. I'm thinking around ₹50,000 each for a week. What do you say?

Haan, tum bilkul sahi keh rahi ho. Last time toh poora credit card swipe ho gaya tha! ₹50,000 sounds reasonable, but destination par depend karega. If we're going international, maybe we need to bump it up a bit? Ya phir we stick to somewhere in India?

India is fine with me! Kerala sounds amazing this time of year, or maybe Rajasthan? International is too much hassle with visas and all that. And with ₹50,000, we can easily find a nice homestay and enjoy the local food. We can even travel by train for a change.

Train sounds fun! Okay, India it is. Rajasthan mein garmi hogi na? Kerala is a great option, especially with the backwaters. Let's check some homestays and hotels online tonight. We can compare prices and finalize something by the weekend. I'll look into train tickets too.

Perfect! I'll create a shared Google Sheet so we can track expenses. We can allocate funds for travel, accommodation, food, and activities separately. That way, we can keep a close eye on where the money is going. Also, no unnecessary shopping this time, okay?

Agreed! No unnecessary shopping. Focus on the experience, not the souvenirs. Google Sheet is a great idea. I'll add some potential activities we can do in Kerala as well. Let's make this a memorable and budget-friendly vacation! Chai piyoge?

Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I heard you and ka break-up ho gaya? Kya hua exactly? Tell me everything, quick! I'm here to listen and give the best breakup gyaan ever. Jaldi bata, tension ho raha hai mujhe.

Haan yaar, it's true. Basically, we wanted different things. She's all about settling down, shaadi-bachche types. Aur main, I just wanna travel and focus on my career right now. So, mutual consent, you know? But still feeling a bit lost.

Dekh bhai, 'mutual consent' is great and all, but dil toh dukhta hai na? Pehle toh, delete all her photos from your phone. No stalking her Insta stories! Aur sun, gym join kar le. Best revenge is a killer body, samajh gaya?

Gym ka toh plan tha, but revenge ke liye nahin, health ke liye! But yeah, Insta stalking is a real problem. I keep wanting to see what she's up to. It's like an addiction. Maybe I should block her for a while?

Block kar de! No contact rule is crucial. Aur sun, find a new hobby. Learn guitar, join a dance class, something to distract your mind. Aur sabse important, go out with friends! Don't stay cooped up in your room, okay?

Okay, okay, point taken. No contact, new hobby, friends… got it. Thanks, dost. Your gyaan is actually helping. Chal, let's go grab some chai and samosas. My treat. Need some comfort food right now, bhai.
Oye, kya plan hai Diwali break ka? Socha hai kahin niklein? I'm so tired of Delhi pollution, need some clean air. Kahin pahadon mein chalte hain, kya bolti?

Arre bhai, mast idea hai! Pahadon mein Diwali... sounds dreamy! But budget ka kya scene hai? Last time Goa trip mein toh jeb khali ho gayi thi. This time, something affordable but scenic should be our priority.
Haan yaar, budget toh dekhna padega. Uttarakhand theek rahega? Rishikesh ya Nainital? Trains bhi easily mil jaati hain, and hotels bhi itne mehenge nahi hote. Plus, Ganga aarti bhi dekh lenge.
Rishikesh is a good option. Rafting bhi kar sakte hain. But Diwali time pe crowd bahut hoga, right? Maybe we should book everything in advance this time. Hotels and train tickets both.

Exactly! Last minute mein toh kuch nahi milta. Chal, aaj raat ko baithke sab research karte hain. MakeMyTrip pe deals bhi check kar lenge. Let's make this Diwali a memorable one, away from the city's chaos.
Done deal! Pizza order karte hain aur phir laptop lekar baith jaate hain. Diwali vacation sorted! Just imagine, pahadon mein chai aur pakode... perfect Diwali vibe! Let's book it tonight then.
Oye! Kya chal raha hai? I was just thinking about how much work it is to take care of Sheru. You know, my Labrador. He's such a handful, especially with this weather!
Arre yaar, tell me about it! I have a Persian cat, Mittens. She thinks she's a queen! Keeping her fur clean is a full-time job, plus she's super picky about her food. Koi bhi cheez nahi khati.

Exactly! Sheru eats everything he finds on the street. I have to keep a constant eye on him during walks. And the shedding! My entire house is covered in dog hair. I'm thinking of getting him a haircut.
Good idea! Mittens gets a trim every few months. Makes a huge difference. Have you tried those special pet shampoos for shedding? They are supposed to help. I got one from Amazon.
Nah, I haven't. Will definitely check it out. By the way, Sheru also needs his vaccinations soon. That vet bill is going to sting. Pet care is so expensive, right? It's like having another child!

Totally! But you know, the love they give back is priceless. Mittens always knows when I'm feeling down and comes to cuddle. Worth every penny, even with the constant grooming and the expensive cat food!
Oye sunn, tujhe pata hai kya, Sharma ji ka beta, jo humare saath pada tha, usne kya kamaal kar diya? Last I heard, woh toh struggling tha. Ab kya naya scene hai?
Arre bhai, batao toh! Sharma ji ka beta? Woh toh computer mein ghusa rehta tha. Kya kar liya usne aisa ki sabke muh khule ke khule reh gaye? Koi startup shuru kiya kya?
Haan, wahi toh! Startup khola aur kya! Usne ek AI company start ki hai. Aur sunn, bhai, pehle hi saal mein, he got a huge investment from some US investors. Ab toh US mein bhi office khol raha hai.
Kya baat hai! Sharma ji ka beta toh chhupa rustam nikla. Hum toh sochte the, woh bas coding mein hi reh jaega. Ab toh Sharma ji bhi chaude hoke ghumte honge mohalle mein.

Bilkul! Diwali pe toh mithai ka dabba har ghar mein bhijwaya tha. Keh raha tha, 'sab bhagwan ki kripa hai'. Lekin andar se toh phula nahi sama raha tha. Ab toh shaadi ke rishte bhi line mein lage honge.
Haan bhai, sahi kaha tune. Paisa bolta hai. Ab toh Sharma ji ke bete ki life set hai. Hum bhi sochte hain, kab humara number aayega. Chalo, chai peete hain aur uske success ki kahani sunte hain.
Acha suno, Holi aa rahi hai, na? I'm totally confused about what to wear. Last time I wore white and ended up looking like a rainbow exploded on me! Koi idea hai kya?
Haan yaar, Holi toh hai. White is classic but risky. Maybe try a kurta in a light, washable fabric? Yellow or orange would look festive and hide stains better. And leggings, definitely leggings!
Hmm, yellow kurta is not a bad idea. But phir woh bachchon ke liye kya le jaana hai? Mithai toh har koi le jaata hai. Kuch different sochna hai, you know?
True, mithai overload ho jaata hai. How about those water balloons? Or maybe some pichkaris with natural colours? Kids will love it, and it's all part of the fun, right?
