Pichkaris are a good option, but natural colours are key, warna skin irritation ho jati hai. And maybe some small packets of dry gulal too? Thanks for the ideas!
Gulal is perfect! And don't forget to oil your hair and skin beforehand. Holi hai, bhai! Enjoy karo, tension mat lo! Happy Holi in advance!
Oye, kya scene hai? Sunn, I'm so stressed about this US visa. Interview is next week, aur documents ka pile is just getting bigger. Samajh nahi aa raha kaise handle karu.
Arre tension na le bhai! Chill maar. Visa interviews are mostly about confidence. Just be yourself, answer truthfully, and make sure your paperwork is in order. Itna load lega toh kaise chalega?
Confidence toh hai, but woh log aise sawal puchte hai na, ki darr lagta hai. What if they think I won't come back? I have to convince them somehow. Any tips from your experience?
Haan, I get it. Show strong ties to India – family, property, job offer letter. Be clear about your purpose of visit and your return plans. And smile, yaar! That always helps. Positive vibes only!

Okay, that's a good point. I'll gather all my property papers and get a strong letter from my company. Smiling bhi try karunga, though it's hard when you're this nervous. Thanks a lot, man. You're a lifesaver!
Koi baat nahi, dost! That's what friends are for. Just remember to be prepared and confident. And after you get the visa, we're celebrating with a big party, okay? All the best for your interview!
Oye! Kya chal raha hai? I was thinking about leveling up, you know? Like, actually improving myself this year. Bohot procrastination ho gaya. Any tips from your side, Mr. Motivator?

Arre bhai, chill maar! But seriously, I feel you. I started small. Like, reading one chapter of a self-help book every day. And meditation. Helps with the stress and focus. You should try. Slowly slowly line pe aa jayega.

Meditation? Seriously? I can barely sit still for five minutes. But the reading thing, I could try. Any book recommendations? Something not too preachy, you know? I need something more relatable and practical.

Try 'Atomic Habits'. It's all about small changes, compounding over time. No gyaan baazi, just practical advice. Also, maybe try a skillshare course? Learning something new keeps you engaged and motivated, boss!
Skillshare sounds interesting! I've been wanting to learn coding for ages. Okay, I’m actually going to give it a shot. Thanks for the push, dost! Let's check in next week to see how we are doing?
Pakka! Deal. We can be each other's accountability partners. And haan, no pressure. Just small steps, okay? Rome wasn't built in a day, aur hum toh India mein hain. All the best, bhai!
Oye, Rohit! Holi ke liye rangoli ka kya plan hai? Mummy toh keh rahi thi ki badi wali banani hai is baar, bilkul Insta-worthy. Lighting wagera ka bhi kuch socha hai ya bas aise hi tukka lagayenge?

Haan bhai, rangoli ka toh layout ready hai mere dimag mein. Thoda traditional aur thoda modern touch denge. Lighting ka bhi plan hai, LED strips aur kuch colourful lanterns lagaunga. Photo-op ke liye perfect spot ban jayega, tension na le.

Wah! Photographer ho toh kuch toh alag karna hi tha. Par bhai, mummy ko bhi toh khush karna hai. Traditional elements thoda zyada rakhna. Aur haan, woh jo gulal wale photos hai, woh bhi capture karna mat bhoolna.

Haan haan, mummy ka pura khayal rakhunga. Traditional designs mein koi compromise nahi. Gulal wale photos toh main expert hoon, bhai. Don't worry, ek se badhkar ek shot aayega. Sab log social media par post karte nahi thakenge.

Perfect! Phir toh Holi ki tayyari done hai. Bas ab dhol-nagade aur thandai ka jugaad karna hai. Aur haan, apne camera ka bhi dhyaan rakhna, gulal se bachake rakhna. Last time toh service centre ke chakkar lagane pade the.

Camera ka toh full protection hai bhai. Waterproof case aur lens filters sab ready hai. Dhol-nagade aur thandai ka jugaad bhi ho jayega. Tu bas tension free ho ja aur Holi ke rang mein dubki laga. Lets make this Holi unforgettable!
Accha suno, Rakhi ke liye rangoli ka kya plan hai? Is baar kuch naya try karein ya woh traditional design hi bana dein? Aur lighting kaisi rahegi, Diwali wali ya kuch different?

Haan, definitely kuch naya karte hain! Maybe floral rangoli with diya accents? Lighting mein, fairy lights around the rangoli and some lanterns on the balcony? Thoda festive, thoda modern, kya kehti ho?

Floral rangoli sounds amazing! Aur fairy lights toh perfect hain. Balcony mein lanterns bhi theek hai, lekin woh Diwali wali heavy lights nahi lagani hai. Rakhi ka vibe thoda subtle hona chahiye, right?
Exactly! Diwali is all about bling, Rakhi is more about the bond. So subtle and elegant is the key. Rangoli mein colours kaise? Bright colours ya pastel shades?
Pastel shades will look really classy! Aur beech mein ek bada sa diya rakhte hain, woh golden wala. Woh bahut shubh lagega. Aur bhaiyon ke aane ka time kya hai?
Perfect! Golden diya is a great touch. Bhai log toh shaam tak pahunch jaayenge. Tab tak sab ready hona chahiye. Let's get started then, rangoli and lights ka samaan nikalte hain!
Hello ji, PTM ka reminder hai. Date aur time confirm karna tha. Bacche ke teachers se milna important hai, woh toh pata hi hai aapko. Kya aap free ho uss din ya phir kaam se chutti leni padegi?

Haan ji, yaad hai mujhe. Date batao, main calendar check kar leta hoon. Office mein thoda tight schedule chal raha hai, but bacche ki padhai se zyada important kuch nahi. Chutti leni pade toh woh bhi kar lenge.

Theek hai. Next Tuesday, 2 baje afternoon mein hai. Teacher ne specially request kiya hai ki dono parents aayein. Uska performance kuch subjects mein thoda neeche jaa raha hai. So please try karna aane ka.

Tuesday? Okay, main meeting fix kar deta hoon. Performance down hai? Yeh toh chinta ki baat hai. Hum dono jaayenge aur detail mein baat karenge. Tum bhi kuch points prepare kar lo jo hum discuss kar sakte hain.

Haan, main soch rahi thi uske study habits ke baare mein baat karne ka. Aur shayad tuition bhi consider karna padega. Dekhte hain teacher kya suggest karti hain. Thanks for agreeing to come, ji. It means a lot.

Koi baat nahi. Bacche ka future hai, humein milke solve karna hai. Tuition wagera sab dekh lenge. Tum chinta mat karo, main hoon na. Time pe pahunch jaunga school. Fir shaam ko pakka gol gappe khane chalenge!
Oye sunn, Diwali vacations ka kya plan hai? Bohot time se kahin ghoomne nahi gaye yaar. I am so tired of this routine. Let's plan something exciting this time!
Haan bhai, I'm totally in! Last Diwali toh ghar pe hi beet gayi, boring! Kahan chalna hai? Mountains ya beach? Budget bhi dekhna padega, boss. Let's decide quickly, flights bhi book karni hongi.
Mountains are calling! Let's go to Himachal. Shimla ya Manali type kuch. Thand bhi hogi, mazaa aayega. Budget ka dekh lenge, kuch mid-range hotel book kar lenge. What do you say?

Himachal sounds amazing! Manali is always a good idea. Let's check out some packages online tonight. Train se jayenge ya flight? Train is more budget-friendly, but flights are faster. Decide kar lenge!
Train is fine, yaar! We can enjoy the scenery too. Let's book tickets ASAP, before they get sold out. Aur hotels bhi dekh lena. Mujhe photos bhej dena, I'll help you choose.
Done deal! Main abhi raat ko baith ke dekhta hoon. Tickets aur hotels, sab final karte hain. Diwali vacations sorted! Finally, something to look forward to! Thanks, bhai!

Accha suno, weekend ka kya plan hai? I was thinking of finally catching that new Bollywood movie everyone's been raving about. Yaar, law school se fursat hi nahi milti, but dil toh karta hai chill karne ko.

Haan yaar, same pinch! I'm so bogged down with assignments. Movie sounds good, but I was also contemplating going for a trek nearby. Thoda nature mein jaake fresh hawa leni hai. Let's see what's more doable.
Trek bhi solid idea hai! But bhai, yeh monsoon mein trekking? Slippery nahi hoga? Movie theatre is safer, AC bhi milega. We can grab some popcorn and escape reality for a bit. What say?

True, monsoon mein risk hai. Movie hi sahi. Which one were you thinking? That action one or the rom-com? I'm in the mood for something light and fluffy, you know, to forget about all the legal jargon.
Rom-com is perfect! The action one looks too intense for a relaxed weekend. Let's book tickets for Saturday evening? We can grab some chai and pakoras before the show. Deal?
Deal! Saturday evening it is. Chai and pakoras sound divine. I'm already looking forward to it. Thanks for planning, I desperately needed this break from all the case studies and legal theories.
Oye, kya scene hai? Long time no see! Socha call karoon, life mein kya chal raha hai? Suna hai you were thinking of switching careers? Sach hai kya?

Haan bhai, thoda toh hai. This IT job is killing me, yaar. Roz same code, same meetings. I'm thinking of doing something more creative, maybe something with food, you know? Like opening a restaurant or something.
Restaurant? That's a big jump! But interesting. Have you thought about the investment and all that? It's not just about cooking tasty butter chicken, you know. Market research kiya?

Thoda bahut research toh kiya hai. Loans aur location ka tension hai. But I'm passionate about it, man! I feel like I'm wasting my life sitting in front of a computer all day. Need something with more masala.

I get it, yaar. Life is too short to be doing something you hate. But plan properly, okay? Don't just jump into the deep end. Maybe start with a food truck or something smaller to test the waters, right?
Good idea, food truck sounds less risky. Thanks for the advice, dost. I'll definitely look into that. Chal, let's catch up soon for chai and discuss this further. My treat!
Oye, kya scene hai? Sab theek toh hai na? You look a bit down, yaar. Ghar pe sab khairiyat? Tension mat le, bol de jo bhi hai. We're friends for life, remember?
Haan bhai, sab theek hai dikhne mein. But woh papa ka health...thoda upar neeche ho raha hai. Doctor ne kuch tests likhe hain. I'm just worried about the reports. Mummy bhi tension mein hai.
Arey yaar, don't stress too much. Medical science itna aage hai. Tests karwa lo, sab clear ho jayega. Positive raho. Chalo, mandir chalte hain, prasad chadha denge. All will be well.
Yaar, tere muh mein ghee shakkar. I hope so too. It's just that seeing them both so worried is getting to me. I feel helpless, you know? Papa hamesha strong rahe hain.
I understand, bhai. But remember, your support is everything for them right now. Be strong for them. Main bhi hoon na, kisi bhi cheez ki zaroorat ho toh bolna. Hum sab hain saath mein.
Thanks, yaar. Teri dosti mein hi toh dum hai. Chalo, mandir chalte hain. Maybe a little prayer will help ease things. And then, chai-samosa? My treat, to lift our spirits a bit.

Oye sunn, guess what I just heard about Sharma aunty's bahu? Apparently, she's planning to open a boutique right next to Gupta uncle's kirana store! Imagine the competition, yaar! Drama toh pakka hoga.

Arre bhai! Sharma aunty ki bahu? But she seemed so shy and quiet during the Diwali puja. Boutique? Gupta uncle toh waise hi gussa mein rehte hain. Ab toh roz tamasha hoga. Chai pe charcha interesting ho jayegi.

Exactly! And I also heard that she borrowed money from someone in the building. Not from the bank! Big risk, right? What if the boutique doesn't do well? Sharma aunty will have a heart attack, I tell you.

Oh my god! Borrowed from whom? Chalo, let's find out. But seriously, Gupta uncle will be fuming. He thinks he owns the entire market. This is better than any Bollywood movie. Popcorn ready rakhna padega.
I know, right? I'm thinking it's either Verma ji or that new builder. Anyway, I have to run now. But we need to discuss this in detail later, maybe over golgappe? This is too juicy to ignore.

Definitely golgappe! And let's also invite Preeti; she knows everything about everyone. This is going to be epic. Okay, bye! Jaldi milte hain, and keep me updated if you hear anything else. Don't keep me hanging!
Oye! Road trip ka kya scene hai? College friends ke saath plan bana rahi hoon. Kahan jaana hai aur kab tak ka plan hai, kuch idea hai tere dimag mein?
Accha, road trip? Awesome! Goa ka plan kaisa rahega? Beaches, parties, aur bohot saare photo opportunities. Weekend trip rakhte hain? Ya phir thoda lamba, 4-5 din ka?
Goa toh classic hai, but thoda crowded hoga na? Something different try karein? Maybe Rajasthan? Forts, palaces, aur culture. Aur 4-5 din perfect rahega. Exam ke baad nikalenge.
Rajasthan bhi sahi hai! Jaipur, Udaipur, Jodhpur... itinerary banate hain. Hotels book karna, travel arrangements, aur sabse important: food! Dal baati churma toh khana hi hai.
Haan, food toh must hai! Aur budget bhi dekhna padega. Let's make a detailed plan. I'll start researching places and prices. Tum bhi kuch suggestions do, bhai.
Done! I'll check out some offbeat locations in Rajasthan and compare travel costs. Let's aim for a budget-friendly but memorable trip. Aur haan, camera ready rakhna!
Oye, hostel life kaisi chal rahi hai? Exam stress toh hoga hi, I'm guessing. Raat bhar jag ke padhai, subah miss hone wali chai... the usual, right? Tension mat le, sab ho jayega.

Arre bhai, kya bataun. It's a mess! Kal raat toh physics ke numericals ne rulaya. Coffee pi pi ke aankhein sooj gayi hain. Aur yeh mess wale bhaiya, har roz aloo ki sabzi hi banate hain. Life is tough, yaar.

Aloo sabzi is a constant, whether you like it or not. But seriously, try studying in the library. Thoda distraction kam hoga. And maybe sneak in some Maggi from outside? That's the ultimate hostel survival kit, you know.

Library is always packed, bhai. Logon ko padhne se zyada selfie lene mein interest hai. Maggi is a great idea, but warden uncle ne pakad liya toh? Fine lagega. Maybe I'll just stick to surviving on chai and hope for the best.
Fine-wine kuch nahi hota. Just be sneaky, yaar. Aur sun, if you need any help with physics, bata dena. I might not be a pro, but do-teen formula toh yaad honge. Together we can crack this, dost.
Tu sachha dost hai, yaar! Physics mein help karega? Then chai meri taraf se pakka. Let's plan a study session tonight after dinner. And Maggi smuggling operation bhi saath mein karenge. Deal?
Oye, kya chal raha hai? I was just reading about zodiac signs and their compatibility. Tu kya believe karti hai yeh sab mein? Mujhe toh kabhi kabhi lagta hai sahi hai, kabhi nahi.
Arre, bhai! I'm doing fine. Honestly, thoda bahut toh believe karti hoon. Like, I'm a Leo, and the descriptions are scarily accurate sometimes. But full-on astrology? Naah, that's a bit much for me.
Exactly my point! Meri rashi is Libra, and they say we are all about balance. Which is ironic because my life is a total mess. Maybe it's just a fun way to understand ourselves better, right?

Haan, exactly! It's like a personality quiz. And let's be real, everyone loves those! Plus, it's a great conversation starter, especially with rishtedaars asking 'beta, kya rashi hai?' at every shaadi.
True that! Next time aunty poochhegi, I'll just say 'Compatible with success, aunty!'. Waise, which sign do you think is the most annoying? Just curious, for science, obviously.
Haha! For science, eh? Okay, between you and me, I think Geminis get a bad rap, but I’ve also met some Scorpios who are a bit… intense. But honestly, log toh log hote hai, rashi kya karegi!
Namaste ji. Aajkal ke bachchon ka toh screen time itna zyada hai! Padhai kab karte hain, mujhe toh samajh hi nahi aata. As a principal, I'm constantly worried. Aapka kya kehna hai?

Namaste. Bilkul sahi kaha aapne. Mobile aur tablets mein ghuse rehte hain. Humare zamane mein toh sirf khelna hota tha. Parents ko bhi thoda strict hona padega. Study schedule banana bahut zaroori hai.
Exactly! Ghar pe bhi main yahi kehti hoon. I try to implement strict rules, but it's a constant battle. Online classes ke baad bhi, they just want to watch reels. Kaise manage karein?
Ek toh ye online classes ne aur bigaad diya hai. Aap ek kaam karo, unke liye kuch outdoor activities plan karo. Sports mein daalo unko. Aur weekend pe family time fix karo, no screens allowed!
Yeh toh achha idea hai. Maybe I should introduce mandatory sports activities in school too. Physical activity is so important. Aur family time... that's a struggle with everyone's schedules nowadays.
Koshish toh karni padegi. Healthy habits shuru se dalni padengi. Screen time ko gradually kam karo. Aur haan, khud bhi example set karna padega. We also need to reduce our usage in front of them.
Oye sun, woh Sharma uncle ka beta, is going to Goa for New Year's. Everyone's planning to go. Should we also try and convince our parents? It's gonna be epic, yaar!
Goa? Are you serious? My parents toh kabhi nahi maanenge. They'll say padhai pe dhyaan do, Goa toh jaate rahenge. Plus, it's so expensive! Where will we get the money from?
Arre, thoda manage kar lenge. Pocket money bachao, maybe ask our older siblings for help. And about parents, we can say it's a 'study trip' to learn about Goa's culture and history. What do you say?

Study trip? You think they'll buy that? My mom knows I can barely remember the dates of the Mughal empire, let alone Goan history. But seriously, I feel like I'm missing out if I don't go. Sab jaa rahe hai.

Exactly! FOMO is real, bhai. We don't want to be the only ones stuck here while everyone else is partying on the beach. Think about the Instagram stories! We can figure out a way to make it happen. Trust me.

Okay, okay, you've convinced me. But if my parents find out we lied about the 'study trip', I'm blaming you! Let's brainstorm ideas on how to convince them without raising suspicion. Chai pe chal, dimag chalayenge.
Accha suno, I'm planning something big for birthday this year. She’s turning the big 4-0, and I want it to be unforgettable. Thinking of a surprise party at my place. Kya kehti ho?

Wow, Meera that sounds amazing! toh pagal ho jayegi khushi se! But organizing a surprise party is a lot of work, especially keeping it under wraps. Have you started making a guest list? And what about the theme?

Guest list is almost done, just need to finalize a few people. Theme is Bollywood, since she’s obsessed! I’m thinking red carpet, filmy dialogues, and maybe even a small dance performance. Food will be my responsibility, obviously!

Bollywood is perfect! And knowing your cooking skills, the food will be the highlight. I can help with decorations and keeping busy that day so she doesn't suspect anything. Just tell me what you need, I'm in!

That's a relief! Decoration help would be fantastic. Can you handle the music too? A good Bollywood playlist is crucial. Also, we need to make sure someone brings her to my place without giving away the surprise. Any ideas?
Done! I’ll create a killer playlist. I’ll ask to bring her over under the pretext of a casual dinner. He’s good at keeping secrets. This is going to be epic, Meera! will never forget this birthday.
Oye, Diwali is just around the corner, right? Kya plan hai tera is baar? I'm thinking of skipping the crackers this time, pollution ka scene bahut zyada hai. Maybe just lights and mithai?

Haan bhai, Diwali toh aa hi gayi. Crackers toh mai bhi avoid karunga. Pollution se toh dimaag kharab ho gaya hai. I'm thinking of going home, family ke saath chill karenge. Maa ke haath ka khana is a must, yaar!

Arre wah, ghar jaana is always the best option. Maa ke haath ka khana…uff! I'm jealous. My family is planning a small get-together at our place. Card parties, you know, the usual Diwali drama. Tu bhi aa jaa, bhai.
Card parties? Thoda gambling bhi chalega kya? Just kidding! Let me see if I can swing by after going home. But seriously, Diwali feels incomplete without some jalebi and samosas. What about you?
Jalebi and samosas toh honge hi. Aur kya chahiye life mein? We'll also have some fancy mithai from that new shop near my house. Plus, my mom makes amazing chaklis. Diwali is incomplete without them.
Chaklis! Now you're talking my language! Okay, consider me almost there. I'll try to come on Diwali night. Warna, bhai dooj pe toh pakka milte hain. Happy Diwali in advance, mere dost!
Oye! Sunn na, uska birthday aa raha hai next week. Socha hai kuch? Usual treat toh banta hai, but let's do something hatke this time. Koi surprise wagera plan karein?
Haan bhai, sahi bol raha hai. Hamesha wohi restaurant mein jaake cake kaatna is boring. Surprise birthday party sounds awesome! But kahan karein? Aur kisko kisko bulayein? Budget bhi dekhna padega.
Mere terrace pe space hai, woh decorate kar sakte hain. Close friends only, say 15-20 log? Pizza, pasta order kar lenge, aur woh chocolate truffle cake toh must hai uska favourite. What do you think?
Perfect! Terrace is a great idea. Main decoration ka samaan le aaunga, lights wagera. Aur music ka kya? DJ bulayein ya Spotify playlist se kaam chal jayega? Cake ka order bhi main de deta hu.

Spotify playlist is fine, yaar. College ke gaane chalayenge, nostalgia trip ho jayega. Main baki logon ko secretly message karta hu. Make sure usko kuch pata na chale, warna surprise surprise nahi rahega.
Done deal! Sabko bol dena 'operation birthday' is top secret. Main usko sham ko bahane se terrace pe le aaunga. Bas phir dhamaal machega! This will be epic, bhai!

Arre suno, I'm thinking of hitting up that new bookstore near Linking Road this weekend. Heard they have amazing coffee and a really cozy reading nook. Kya bolti ho, weekend pe chale? Need a break from school stress.

Accha? The one with the fairy lights and the Instagrammable walls? Haan yaar, school has been crazy. Date sounds perfect! Coffee and books are my kind of therapy. Saturday morning, maybe? We can browse and then chill with a cappuccino.

Perfect! Saturday morning it is. I was thinking of checking out the new poetry section. Maybe we can even find some nice gifts for the teachers' day. Plus, their masala chai is supposed to be bomb. Let's make it a proper book-and-chai date.

Masala chai? You had me at chai! And yes, Teachers' Day is just around the corner. Good thinking! We can browse for some inspiring reads and maybe even some quirky stationery. Linking Road traffic will be killer though. Metro se chale?

Metro is a great idea! Avoids all the Linking Road drama. Plus, we can catch up properly without the auto walas honking in our ears. I'll meet you at Bandra station around 10? We can walk from there. Sounds good?

Done deal! Bandra station, 10 AM. Looking forward to a relaxing morning filled with books, chai, and some much-needed girl talk. School and meetings have drained my soul. This is exactly what I needed. See you Saturday!
Accha suno, which book are you engrossed in these days? I saw you completely zoned out at the coffee shop, book in hand. Any good plot twists I should brace myself for?
Arre bhai, it's this thriller novel. The twists are insane! Just when you think you've figured it out, BAM! Something completely unexpected happens. You won't believe who the real villain is.
Oh ho, suspense toh hona hi chahiye. Tell me without giving too much away, is it worth the read? I need something to distract me from these never-ending funding rounds. Startup life is killing me.
Absolutely worth it! It's a total page-turner. It is the perfect escape from the startup hustle. Trust me, you'll forget all about valuations and pitch decks while reading this. Grab a copy ASAP.
Done deal! I'll download it tonight. So, tell me one tiny spoiler. Just a little one. Is there a love triangle involved? Because that's usually my weakness in these kinds of stories.
Okay, okay, just a tiny hint. There is a complicated relationship, but it's not your typical love triangle. It's more like a web of secrets and hidden agendas. That's all I'm saying! Enjoy the ride.
Oye, kya scene hai? Sun na, I wanted to talk to you about something important. It's been on my mind for a while, and I really trust your opinion, you know? Koi judgement nahi, promise?

Haan haan, bol na! Tereko toh pata hai, I'm always here to listen. Bilkul bhi judgement nahi. Chill maar. What's bothering you? Spill the chai, yaar. I'm all ears and ready for some serious dost wala support.

So, I've been questioning my gender identity lately. It's like, I don't always feel like I fit into the typical 'boy' box, you know? It's confusing, and I'm trying to figure things out. Samajh nahi aa raha kya karu.

I get it. That takes a lot of courage to share, seriously. There's no rush to figure it all out immediately. Take your time, explore your feelings. We can explore this together. Just know I'm here for you, no matter what. Aur batao, what specifically feels off?

It's just... sometimes I feel more feminine, and other times I don't feel like either. It's like I'm somewhere in between, or maybe outside of it altogether. I've been reading about non-binary identities and it resonated with me a bit. But I'm still unsure.

That makes sense. Non-binary is a valid identity, and it's okay to explore it. Maybe we can look up some resources together, like support groups or online forums where people share similar experiences? Remember, you're not alone in this journey. And I'm here to support you every step of the way. Let's figure this out together, okay?
Oye, sunn na, yeh climate change ka scene kya hai? I mean, har saal garmi itni badh rahi hai. Last year toh Delhi mein kya haal tha, yaad hai? Aisa lag raha tha suraj sar pe aa gaya ho.

Haan bhai, I know! Aur baarish bhi dekho, kabhi aati hai toh aisi aati hai ki sab kuch dooba deti hai. Experts bol rahe hain, its all interconnected. Carbon emissions badh gaye hain, glaciers pighal rahe hain, sab gadbad ho raha hai.
Toh ab kya karein? Government toh kuch karti nahi hai. Politicians are busy with their own games. Hum aam aadmi kya kar sakte hain? Solar panel lagwayein ghar pe? Woh toh out of budget hai apne liye.

Arey, choti choti cheezein bhi matter karti hain. Plastic kam use karo, zyada ped lagao, public transport use karo whenever possible. Aur logon ko bhi samjhao. Every little bit helps, you know? Change starts with us.

Hmm, baat toh sahi hai teri. I'll try to be more mindful. Office mein bhi bolunga sabko, plastic bottles kam use karne ko. Maybe we can start a small initiative, like a 'green day' every week. What do you say?

That's a great idea, bhai! Let's do it. Green day sounds cool. We can even organize a tree-planting drive near our colony. Thoda effort toh karna padega, but future generations will thank us for it, definitely.

Sunna yaar, bachchon ka online classes khatam hone ka naam hi nahi le raha. Abhi se screen time itna zyada hai, toh aage jaake kya hoga? Aankhein bhi kharab ho rahi hai unki. Tension ho raha hai mujhe.
Haan bhai, yeh toh problem hai. Lockdown ne sab kuch badal diya. Lekin tum fitness instructor ho, kuch toh solution hoga tere paas. Exercise aur healthy routine se kuch toh control kar sakte hain na?

Woh toh hai, lekin padhai bhi zaroori hai na? Maine socha hai ki unka study schedule thoda adjust karoon. Thoda time physical activity ke liye nikalna padega. Screen time kam, khel-kood zyada, tabhi baat banegi.
Exactly! Balance karna padega. Aur unko bhi samjhao ki screen se dur rehna kitna important hai. Games khelne bahar jao, dosto se milo. Family time bhi increase karo, saath mein baithkar baatein karo.

Sahi bol raha hai. Sunday ko plan banaunga. Sabke phones bandh, sirf family time. Park mein jaake cricket khelenge. Shaam ko ghar pe board games. Dekhte hain, kitna farak padta hai. Umeed hai kuch toh hoga.
Zaroor hoga bhai. Consistency is key. Thoda time lagega, lekin bachche adjust ho jayenge. Aur tum bhi unke saath enjoy karna. Family time se zyada important kuch bhi nahi hai. All the best, Aarav!
Oye sun, yeh US visa ka kya scene hai tera? Last time toh reject ho gaya tha na? I'm planning to apply, but dar lag raha hai. Kahin mera bhi na reject ho jaye. Koi tips hai toh bata de bhai.

Haan yaar, last time reject ho gaya tha. Interview mein kuch gadbad ho gayi thi. This time I've prepared better. Documents saare ready rakh. And be confident, bhai. Zyada mat ghabrana. Bas jo poochhe, sach bolna.

Sach toh bolunga hi. But woh log itna interrogate karte hain na, darr lagta hai. What kind of questions did they ask you? I heard they are very particular about your travel history and financial stability. Mujhe toh tension ho rahi hai.

Haan, travel history and financials toh dekhte hi hain. They asked me about my job, salary, family details, and why I want to go to the US. Be clear about your purpose of visit. And show them you have strong ties to India so you'll come back.
Okay, got it. Strong ties matlab? Family photos dikhaun kya interview mein? I'm planning to show my property papers and say that my parents are dependent on me. Will that work? Ya koi aur jugaad hai?
Property papers are good, bhai. Parents dependent is also a plus. Just show them you have reasons to come back. And don't forget to smile! All the best, tera ho jayega. Hum party karenge phir.
Oye sunn, woh Sharma ji ka beta toh IIT nikal gaya, parents kitna pressure daal rahe hai. Engineering karna hi padega, warna life set nahi hogi. What to do yaar?
Arey bhai, chill maar. Sharma ji ka beta Sharma ji ka beta hai. Tu kya karna chahta hai, woh important hai. Engineering sabke liye nahi hoti. Think about what makes you happy, aur wohi kar.
Haan, woh toh hai, but family expectations ka kya? Dadi toh bol rahi thi doctor bano, society mein izzat hogi. I feel stuck between what I want and what they want.
Dekh, family ko pyaar se samjha. Tell them your passion, dikha unhe ki you're serious about it. Thoda time lagega, but they'll eventually understand. Apne sapne ke liye stand le.
Right bola, bhai. Thoda courage chahiye bas. I'll try talking to them again. Maybe I can show them my art portfolio and explain why I want to pursue design instead.
Exactly! Confidence dikha. Aur agar phir bhi nahi mane, toh remember, it's your life. Zindagi ek hi hai, apni sharton pe jee. I'm always here to support you, whatever you decide.
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? I'm totally broke yaar. Month end aa gaya aur account mein sirf jhinga la la. Any ideas on how to survive till salary day? I'm thinking Maggi for the next week, seriously.

Arre bhai, same pinch! Mera bhi haal wahi hai. This month was brutal with all the unplanned kharche. Maybe we can try some 'ghar ka khana' dabba service? Thoda toh budget friendly hoga compared to ordering out everyday.
That's a good idea! Ghar ka khana sounds amazing right now. And healthier too, bonus points! Do you know any reliable dabba services near our office? Warna phir se Swiggy pe loot machni hai.

Haan, I heard about one called 'Annapurna Bhoj'. My colleague uses it. Says the food is decent and the price is quite reasonable. Let's check it out online together. Maybe we can even get a discount for ordering together?

Perfect! Annapurna Bhoj it is. Let's do some research during lunch break. Yaar, this money crunch is giving me serious anxiety. Need to start investing more seriously. SIP karna padega, warna aise hi rote rahenge.

Exactly my thoughts! SIP is the way to go. I've been meaning to start one for ages. Let's research some good mutual funds too. We can be 'crorepatis' together, eventually! Imagine, no more Maggi at month-end!

Accha suno, did you hear about what happened with Priya? I was so surprised when I found out! Apparently, she landed that massive international event planning deal. I mean, good for her, but wow, talk about hitting the jackpot!

Arre yaar, seriously? Priya? That's amazing! Last I heard, she was still struggling with getting local clients. What kind of event is it? Must be something big if it's international. Tell me everything, I'm dying to know the details.

It's some tech conference in Singapore. Apparently, she pitched a really innovative concept, something about virtual reality and event experiences. They loved it! Now she's got a team of like, twenty people working under her. Total game changer!

Wah bhai wah! toh chha gayi! Singapore, huh? That's quite a leap. I remember when we were all struggling together back in college. It’s so inspiring to see someone we know doing so well. Good for her hustle, yaar!

Exactly! It just goes to show, hard work pays off. Though, I heard through the grapevine that she pulled a few all-nighters to perfect that pitch. I hope she's taking care of herself amidst all this success. Fame is a demanding mistress, you know?

Haan, that's true. Hopefully, she remembers to enjoy the fruits of her labor and not burn herself out. We should totally plan a get-together soon to celebrate her success. What say? Maybe a small treat at that new cafe near our office?
Oye sunn, what's your take on this climate change thing, yaar? I saw some crazy floods on the news. Darr lag raha hai, bhai. Is it really as bad as they say, or is it all just drama for the cameras?

Arre, it's legit serious, dost. Woh floods and all? That's just the start. The heat is getting unbearable, and the weather is totally unpredictable. I read somewhere that even our chai crops are at risk! Imagine a world without chai!

Chai at risk? That's it, I'm officially worried. But what can we even do, na? It's like, hum toh chote log hain. Politicians and big companies are the ones messing it up. Humara kya role hai isme, batao?

Dekh, every little bit helps, right? Reduce, reuse, recycle – the usual stuff. Maybe try to use public transport more often? And complain to the government about pollution in our area. Thoda toh pressure daalna padega, bhai!

Haan, that makes sense. I guess even switching to those LED bulbs can make a difference. And I've been meaning to start composting my kitchen waste. Chal, let's at least try to be a little more conscious, okay? For the sake of chai, if nothing else!

Exactly! And let's spread the word, yaar. Talk to our families and friends about it. The more people who care, the better. Plus, imagine the karma points we'll earn! Maybe even enough to skip the queue at the temple next time!
Oye, kya scene hai? Aajkal toh tu dikhai bhi nahi deta. I heard you're pulling all-nighters. Sab theek toh hai na? Productivity ke chakkar mein health mat bigaad lena, bhai.
Haan bhai, trying to hustle. Startup life is crazy, you know? But yeah, you're right. Need to find a balance. I've been trying this Pomodoro technique. Suna hai uske baare mein?
Pomodoro? Woh kya cheez hai? Sounds Italian! Kuch khaane wali baat hai kya? But seriously, tell me, how does it help you with your kaam?

Arre nahi yaar, it's a time management thing! Basically, you work in focused 25-minute bursts, then take a short break. Helps me stay focused. At least, that's the theory. Abhi toh practice chal rahi hai.
Hmm, interesting. Main bhi try karta hoon. Aajkal procrastination ka master bana hua hoon. Office mein toh bas chai peene ke bahane dhoondta rehta hoon. Koi tips de de, guru.
Chai peena is important for mental health, but yeah, maybe try setting small, achievable goals for each day. And delete all the social media apps for a few hours. That's my secret weapon, sort of!

Accha suno, Navratri is just around the corner! This time, let's do something grand. I was thinking, full Gujarati style decorations, you know? And maybe we can distribute sweets to all the neighbors? What do you guys think?

Haan, that sounds amazing! We can put up those colorful bandhani dupattas as decorations. And for sweets, maybe jalebi and fafda? Everyone loves that combination. Who will handle getting the decorations and the sweets? I can help with the rangoli.

Perfect! Rangoli is your department, definitely. I can take care of ordering the bandhani dupattas online. And maybe we can ask that halwai near the temple to make the jalebi and fafda fresh? It will be a proper treat for everyone!

Good idea about the halwai! Fresh sweets are always the best. Should we also include some dry fruits in the distribution? Maybe some kaju katli for those who don't like jalebi? We need to make sure everyone feels included, right?

Absolutely! Kaju katli is a great addition. Let's make a list of all the neighbors so we don't miss anyone. And we should start decorating a few days before Navratri so we're all set for the first day's puja and garba!
Okay, I'll make the neighbor list tonight. We can also plan the garba playlist! I have some amazing Gujarati folk songs ready. This Navratri is going to be the best one yet! Dhamaal karenge!
Arre bhai, dekha woh article tech ke baare mein? Bol rahe hain AI sabki naukri kha jayega. Kya lagta hai tujhe, sach hai kya?
Yaar, thoda toh sach hoga. Automation badh raha hai na. Lekin completely jobs khatam ho jayegi, woh toh nahi lagta. New roles bhi toh create honge, hai na?
Haan, woh toh hai. Lekin phir bhi tension hoti hai. Hum fitness instructors ka kya hoga? Robot trainers bhi aa jayenge kya?
Nahin bhai, woh toh impossible hai. Logo ko human connection chahiye, touch chahiye. Robot kaise motivation dega? Tu toh superstar hai, tension mat le.
Superstar toh theek hai, lekin technology toh har cheez mein ghus rahi hai. Digital fitness bhi badh raha hai. Uska kya karein?
Usse adapt karo bhai. Use technology to your advantage. Online classes lo, fitness apps use karo. Evolution is the key, Warna toh game over.
Beta, ab toh college applications ka time aa gaya hai. Have you decided what you want to study? Engineering toh nahi lena, please! Soch samajh ke batana, life ka sawal hai.
Mumma, I'm still confused. Everyone's saying computer science is the future, but I'm not sure if coding is really my thing. Maybe something in design? Or architecture, like chacha?
Dekho, future toh sabka apna apna hota hai. Don't just follow the crowd. Design is good, architecture bhi. But think about what you enjoy doing, what makes you happy. Paisa toh aata jaata rahega.
Yeah, that's true. I enjoy drawing and creating things. Maybe graphic design? Or even fashion? But will I get a good job after college, like with computer science?

Beta, talent ki kadar toh har jagah hai. If you're good at what you do, jobs will come. We'll support you in whatever you choose. Just do your research, talk to people in those fields, and make an informed decision. Samajh mein aaya?

Okay, Mumma, I understand. Thanks! I'll look into graphic design and fashion more seriously. Maybe I can intern somewhere over the summer to get a better feel for it? Aapne tension kam kar di, thanks!
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Ghar pe sab theek toh hai na? Last time jab mile the, you seemed a bit down. Sab khairiyat toh hai?
Haan bhai, kya batau. Parents are on my back about shaadi. You know how it is. They want me settled ASAP. I'm not even ready for that commitment right now.
Arre yaar, I understand. Same pinch! My parents are also pressurizing me. They have a bio-data ready and everything. It's becoming a daily drama at home, bhai.
Exactly! It's like they think shaadi is the solution to all problems. As if life will magically become perfect after that. I just want to focus on my career right now, you know?
I feel you, dude. Career is important. We should decide our own timeline, right? But how do you even reason with them? They just don't get it. Kabhi kabhi toh frustration hoti hai.
Tell me about it! I'm thinking of just telling them I need more time to 'find the right person'. Maybe that'll buy me a few months. Let's see. Chai piyega? Thoda mind divert hoga.
Oye, kya chal raha hai? I was just reading about this climate change stuff, and it's kinda freaking me out, yaar. Everything is getting so unpredictable, especially the weather.
Haan bhai, I know! Last summer ki heatwave toh was insane. And abhi dekho, baarish rukne ka naam nahi le rahi. I saw a documentary about the melting glaciers; it's scary how fast things are changing.
Exactly! Aur pollution ka kya scene hai? Delhi mein toh saans lena bhi mushkil ho gaya hai. I feel like we should be doing something, but kya karein, it feels so overwhelming.
True, man. I started using public transport more often, and I'm trying to reduce my plastic consumption. Small steps, you know? Maybe we can convince others also to join in and make an impact.
Yeah, chalo, let's try to spread awareness among our friends and family. Even planting a few trees around our colony would be a good start. Every little bit counts, right?
Bilkul sahi! Let's make a plan this weekend. We can get some saplings from the nursery and get everyone involved. Climate change is a global problem, but solution starts with local action, bhai.
Oye! Kya plan hai bhai? Bohot din ho gaye, kahin ghoomne chalte hain. Office office mein dimag kharab ho gaya hai. Soch raha tha, long weekend aa raha hai, kuch toh karna chahiye. Tera kya kehna hai?
Haan yaar, sahi bol raha hai. Main bhi pak gaya hoon yeh routine se. Kahan jaane ka mann hai? Pahadon mein thand hogi, beach pe garmi. Budget bhi dekhna padega. Goa phir se? Ya kuch naya try karein?

Goa toh har saal jaate hain. Is baar kuch alag karte hain. Himachal chalte hain? Shimla, Manali type? Thand hogi toh sweater-jacket nikal lenge. Photos bhi achi aayengi. Aur budget bhi Goa se kam hoga, shayad.

Himachal is not bad! But pahado mein driving ka scene thoda darawna lagta hai. Last time, woh hairpin bends pe toh meri halat kharab ho gayi thi. Aur family bhi aa rahi hai kya saath mein, ya sirf hum log?

Nahi bhai, family nahi. Just chill scene with dost. Driving ka tension mat le, main chalaunga. Ya phir train se chale jayenge, aur wahan local taxis kar lenge. Itni tension nahi lene ka. Relax karne ja rahe hain!

Okay, fine! Himachal done. Tu dates vagarah dekh le. Hotel bhi book kar lena. Aur yeh bhi dekhna ki wahan pe snowfall toh nahi ho rahi. Varna phir traffic jam mein phas jayenge. Mujhe bas bata dena, main ready hoon!
Kya bolti hai? Long distance is a pain, na? I miss our chai sessions at that tapri near college. Ab toh online hi sab kuch. How's life treating you in Bangalore?

Arre yaar, Bangalore is okay, work is hectic as usual. But you're right, that tapri chai was something else. Nothing beats gossip over garam chai and samosas. Online is just not the same, feels artificial.

Exactly! Remember how we used to bunk lectures for that? Professor Sharma was always after us. Now I just stare at my laptop screen all day. At least send me some Bangalore weather updates. Mumbai is roasting.

Hahaha, Professor Sharma! Those were the days. Bangalore weather is pleasant, thoda sa cool. Sending you virtual vibes of this weather. And yeah, will update you. You should visit sometime, we'll explore some new places.

Definitely planning to! Need a break from this Mumbai madness. We can finally try that fancy South Indian place you keep talking about. Saving up for the trip already. Miss our old hangout spots, though.

Deal! The South Indian place is amazing, you'll love it. And don't worry, we'll recreate our tapri feels somehow. Long distance sucks, but our friendship is stronger. Jaldi aao, phir dhamaal machayenge!

Oye, Rakhi aa rahi hai yaar! What should I wear this time? Last year toh kurta-pajama pehna tha, boring ho gaya. And more importantly, behen ko kya gift du? She's expecting something 'hatke' this time.

Arre tension mat le! Outfit wise, try something Indo-western. Pathani with jeans maybe? Or a cool Nehru jacket over a plain tee. Gift ke liye, think about her hobbies. Makeup? Books? Or maybe a personalized phone cover?

Indo-western sounds good, but Pathani might be too much for Rakhi. Nehru jacket is doable. She's into makeup, but I don't know anything about brands. Personalized phone cover is a good idea, but a bit too cliché, no?

Okay, then ditch the makeup idea. How about a subscription box related to her hobbies? Or maybe a gift card to her favorite online store? That way, she can pick whatever she wants. As for the outfit, solid shirt and chinos?

Subscription box is actually a brilliant idea! She loves trying new stuff. And yeah, shirt and chinos are safe and stylish. Perfect! Bhai, you saved me from a major Rakhi disaster. Thanks a ton, buddy!

Koi nahi, bhai! That's what friends are for. Now, don't forget to take some good photos for Insta! And haan, mithai khilana mat bhoolna. Happy Rakhi in advance! May your sister love your gifts and outfit choices!

Accha suno, next date ka kya plan hai? Thinking of catching a movie. Koi specific genre ya actor in mind? I was hoping something lighthearted, maybe a rom-com to relax after a long week at work. Batao, kya dekhna hai?

Hmm, rom-com sounds good! But yaar, these days sab same lagte hai. Koi naya option hai? Or maybe something with a good story, not too cheesy. I heard that action movie is good, but I am not sure. What are your thoughts on that?

Action is fine, but dates are for romance, no? That action movie might be too loud and distracting. How about a thriller? Something suspenseful but not horror. Or maybe we check out the reviews of that new rom-com. Let’s decide together.

Thriller sounds interesting! But I get scared easily, you know that. Rom-com reviews are a good idea. Let’s quickly check BookMyShow. If nothing good is there, then we can decide at the last minute at the theatre itself. Deal?

Deal! Let's check BookMyShow now. Maybe that new Bollywood movie? Or Hollywood? Whatever has good ratings and is playing at a decent time. I am free on Saturday evening. Let me know what you think. We'll book the tickets ASAP.

Perfect! I'll check it out and send you some options. Saturday evening sounds great. And if all else fails, we can always just grab dinner and chai somewhere. Movie is just an option, company matters more. I'll get back to you soon!
Oye, sun na, finally got the offer letter from that MNC! But the salary... thoda kam lag raha hai. How did you manage your negotiation last time? Koi tips de yaar, tension ho rahi hai.

Arey tension na le! First, research karo industry standards for your role and experience. Then, highlight your key achievements and skills during the interview. Be confident and polite. Remember, you bring value to the table.
Haan, research toh kiya. But dar lagta hai ki zyada maangne pe offer hi cancel na ho jaye. They said it's their 'best offer'. What if they call my bluff? Should I mention my previous salary?

Never reveal your previous salary, bhai! Focus on the value you'll bring. If they insist, say you're looking for a role that reflects your current skills and market value. And 'best offer' toh sab bolte hain, don't fall for it. Thoda toh push karna padega.
Okay, makes sense. I'll try to negotiate based on my skills and the market rate. What if they still don't budge much? Should I ask for other perks like better health insurance or more vacation days?

Exactly! Salary nahin toh perks! Negotiate for flexible timings, work from home options, training opportunities, or even a signing bonus. Every little bit helps. All the best! Rock the negotiation, bhai! Party toh banti hai, offer pakka hone ke baad.
Accha suno, I need to schedule a parent-teacher meeting for Rohan. His grades are slipping, especially in maths. Batao, how do I even approach this? School mein phone karna padega kya?

Haan, phone toh karna padega. Best to call the school office and ask for the teacher's availability. Tell them it's urgent. Aajkal ke bachche, padhai mein dhyan nahi dete. Let's hope it's nothing serious.
Okay, I'll call them tomorrow morning. Should I inform beforehand? I don't want to surprise him, but I also don't want him to get defensive. What do you think?
Yes, definitely tell him beforehand. Explain calmly that you want to understand how you can support him better. Don't make it sound like an accusation. Thoda pyaar se samjhao, sab theek ho jayega.
Theek hai, I'll talk to him tonight after dinner. Hopefully, he'll be receptive. I'm just worried about his future. Competition kitna tough hai aajkal. Pray karo sab kuch thik ho jaye.
Zaroor, sab theek ho jayega. Just be there for him and show your support. These teenage years are tough. And remember, good communication is key. Don't stress too much, relax! All will be well.
Arey yaar, Eid toh aa rahi hai na? Socha hai kya karna hai? I was thinking humlog apne mohalle mein ek chota sa community event arrange karein. Sab milke celebrate karein, kya kehte ho?

Wah Aisha, idea toh bohot mast hai! Lekin Eid community event... arrange kaise karenge? Permissions vagarah bhi toh chahiye hongi na? Aur funding ka kya scene hai? Thoda detail mein batao toh idea lage.

Haan, permissions ke liye toh society office se baat karni hogi. Funding ke liye, hum sab thoda-thoda contribute kar sakte hain. Aur jo local shops hain, unse bhi sponsorship ke liye pooch sakte hain. Decorations, food stalls, aur ek chhoti si musical performance plan kar sakte hain.

Sounds like a plan! Food stalls mein kya rakhenge? Biryani toh must hai, aur phir meetha mein seviyan. Aur decorations ka kya? Rangoli banayenge kya? I can help with the rangoli design, mujhe bohot pasand hai rangoli banana.

Exactly! Biryani aur seviyan toh pakka. Rangoli bhi zaroor banayenge. Aur decorations mein, hum colourful dupattas use kar sakte hain, aur kuch fairy lights bhi laga sakte hain. I think it will look very festive. Tum rangoli ki zimmedari le lo, main baki dekh lungi.

Done! Rangoli toh main sambhal lungi. Aur main apne kuchh friends ko bhi bol dungi help karne ke liye. Let's make this Eid community event the best one ever! Sabko yaad rehna chahiye ki humne kitna mazaa kiya tha.
Oye! Kya scene hai? Socha kya life mein karna hai? Pressure toh badhta jaa raha hai parents ka, aur placements bhi sar pe hain. I'm so confused between coding and marketing, bhai.

Haan bhai, tension toh hai. Coding mein scope toh dikhta hai, but marketing mein apna creativity dikhane ka mauka hai. I'm leaning towards data science, but the competition is insane. Ghar wale toh bol rahe hain MBA kar le.

MBA? Are you serious? Woh toh sab karte hain. Data science is cool, but coding is more secure, I think. But then, marketing mein fun bhi toh hai. Paisa bhi toh dekhna hai, yaar. Aur yeh social media ka craze bhi alag hai.

Exactly! Paisa toh important hai, but passion bhi toh hona chahiye na? I was thinking maybe a startup? Lekin uske liye risk lene ki himmat chahiye. Data science mein phir bhi job mil jayegi, MBA ke baad bhi option khule hain.

Startup? You're brave, man! Risk toh hai, but reward bhi toh hai. Coding se startup idea bhi toh aa sakta hai. Yaar, yeh career choices life ka sabse bada drama hai. Let's just grab some chai and think about it more.
Chai perfect rahega! Maybe we can brainstorm some startup ideas over chai and samosas. Aur phir decide karenge. Let's not stress too much, bhai. Jo hoga, dekha jayega. But first, chai!
Accha suno, I'm going on a first date tonight! Rooftop restaurant scene. What should I wear? I'm thinking something stylish but not too over the top, you know? Help a girl out!

Oye hoye! First date! Rooftop is perfect. I'd say go for a flowy midi dress. Something light, maybe with floral prints? It's classy, comfortable, and totally date-appropriate. What colours are you thinking?

Hmm, midi dress sounds good. I have this one in a pastel blue, but I'm worried it might be too casual. Or maybe a darker colour like maroon? Not sure what vibe to give off. I want to look good but also like myself.

Pastel blue is lovely, especially for a rooftop. Add some delicate gold jewelry, and you're sorted! Maroon might be a bit heavy for a first date. Confidence is key, so wear what makes you feel good! How about shoes?
Shoes! Okay, I have some strappy heels that are pretty comfortable, or should I go with wedges? The rooftop has cobblestones, so I don't want to trip and fall flat on my face! Heels or flats?

Definitely wedges, then! Safety first, fashion second. Plus, wedges are super stylish these days. You'll look amazing, and you can actually enjoy the date without worrying about your balance. All the best! Batao how it goes!
Oye, sunn! Ghar renovate karwane ka kya scene hai tera? Kab se soch rahi hai, abhi tak kuch final nahi hua kya? Diwali tak toh pakka karwana hai, warna mummyji daantengi.

Haan yaar, tension mat le. Quotations toh aa gaye hain, bas painter final karna hai. Ek banda bol raha tha ₹50,000, dusra ₹60,000. Materials bhi toh dekhne hain, kaunsa paint acha rahega, woh bhi toh matter karta hai na.
Arre, itna tension mat le. Asian Paints ka Royale try kar, mast finish deta hai. Aur painter se bargaining kar, thoda toh kam karega hi. Diwali tak toh ghar chamakna chahiye, samajh rahi hai na?
Woh toh hai. Actually, I was thinking of adding a small balcony in the bedroom. Kya bolti hai? Zyada kharcha ayega kya? Papa toh mana kar rahe hain, bol rahe hain faltu ka load badhega.
Balcony? Mast idea hai! But haan, thoda kharcha toh hoga. But it will add value to the house, long term mein. Papa ko mana le, bol ki terrace pe chai piyenge shaam ko.
Tu sahi keh rahi hai. Chal, I'll convince him. Thanks for the advice, yaar! Abhi contractor ko call karti hu, final karne ke liye. Diwali ready ghar chahiye, boss!

Accha suno, I've been thinking, life is getting too hectic. Work is crazy, and we need a break. What do you say to a surprise weekend getaway? Somewhere we can just chill and reconnect, away from all this city chaos?
A surprise getaway? Wow! That sounds amazing, honestly. I'm always up for some relaxation. But where are you planning to take me? I hope it’s not too far. Tell me something, at least give me a hint!

Patience, mere jaan! It's a surprise, remember? Just pack a bag with some comfy clothes, maybe a light shawl, and your toothbrush, obviously. Think hills, maybe some greenery, definitely some peace and quiet. Leave the rest to me.

Okay, okay, you've piqued my interest. Hills, greenery, and peace...sounds like heaven! But what about work? Can we really just ditch everything for a weekend? I have a few deadlines looming. I need to inform my team.

Don't worry about work; I've already handled it. I spoke to your boss and told him it was a family emergency. Consider it covered. We leave Friday evening, so be ready by 6 pm sharp. No excuses! This is our time.

You are unbelievable! A family emergency, seriously? But I love it! Fine, consider me packed and ready to go. This surprise better be worth all the suspense, though! I am already excited. Thank you, my love. This is a much needed break.
Oye! Kya scene hai? Kal raat party ke liye kya pehen rahi hai? I'm totally blank, yaar. Meri wardrobe toh ekdum khaali lag rahi hai. Help kar de please!
Arre tension na le! I was thinking something indo-western. Maybe a kurta with palazzo pants? Or a nice saree gown? It's comfy and stylish, and you know how much I love fusion wear.
Hmmm, saree gown sounds interesting. But will it be too much? I don't want to look like I'm trying too hard, you know? Maybe the kurta-palazzo is safer. Which colour you think?
Go for a deep jewel tone like emerald green or sapphire blue. Those colours look amazing on you! Aur thoda sa shimmer bhi add kar de, you know, for the party vibe. It will be perfect.
Okay, okay, I'm convinced! Emerald green kurta-palazzo it is! Now, shoes? Heels or flats? And jewellery? I'm so confused! You're a lifesaver, seriously.
Definitely heels! And some jhumkas, nothing too heavy. Keep it classy but fun. You'll rock it! Don't worry, we'll get you all dolled up. Ab chal, let's raid my jewellery collection.

Accha suno, that book I was telling you about, 'The Midnight Masala'? I just finished it! The ending, yaar, total dhoka! Did not see that coming at all. Coffee peete peete I'll tell you all about it. Ready for some serious plot twists?

Arre wah, jaldi batao! I'm all ears. 'Midnight Masala' sounds intriguing. Was it worth the read? I'm looking for something new to dive into after my crazy kitchen shifts. Bring on the plot twists, but no spoilers for the very, very end!

Okay, okay, no spoilers for the very end. But imagine this: the main character, she's a chef just like me, finds out her spice business is actually a front for something shady! And her partner, the one she trusts the most... he's the mastermind! Crazy, right?

Oh my god! That's intense! Like a Bollywood thriller playing out in a kitchen. So, is she going to fight back or just quietly disappear into the sunset? This sounds way more exciting than figuring out the perfect biryani ratio. I need this book!

She definitely doesn't go quietly! She starts investigating, uncovering family secrets and hidden identities left and right. Think 'Don,' but with more garam masala and less SRK. It's a wild ride, full of close calls and spicy revelations. You HAVE to read it!

Okay, fine, you've convinced me! I'm ordering it right now. But if I can't put it down and end up burning the daal tomorrow, I'm blaming you. Now, tell me about this 'Don' with garam masala... just a little hint to keep me going till the book arrives.

Suno, I was thinking about that Goa trip we were planning. Budget ka kuch idea hai tumhare pass? Flights aur stay toh main dekh lunga, but overall, kitna kharcha ayega, uska ek rough estimate banao na. Warna wahan jaake pata chala, jeb toh khali ho gayi.

Haan, Goa toh definitely on hai. Dekho, flights and stay tum dekh rahe ho toh uska tension nahi. But food, activities, aur thoda shopping bhi toh hoga na? I'd say around 30-40k per person pakad ke chalo, just to be safe. Kya kehti ho?

30-40k per person? Thoda zyada nahi hai? Food mein kya itna udaoge? Aur shopping bhi? I mean, I was thinking more like 25k max per person. We can cook a few meals ourselves and maybe skip some of the touristy shopping spots. Kya bolti hai?

Okay, okay, calm down. 25k is a bit tight, but we can make it work. We'll stick to local eateries, maybe rent a scooter instead of a car, and skip the fancy restaurants. But promise me, no compromising on the beach time! Deal?

Deal done! Beach time is sacred. Toh phir, 25k plus your flight aur accommodation ka kharcha is the final budget? I'll start booking things then. Aur haan, let's download some offline maps too, just in case network nahi chala toh.

Perfect! Yes, 25k plus the other expenses. And great idea about the offline maps. Aur suno, let’s also keep aside a small emergency fund, just in case. You never know what might happen. Abhi se excitement ho rahi hai!

Accha suno, I'm planning a grocery run to the market today. Need to stock up on dal, chawal, atta, and maybe some sabzi. Anything specific you want me to pick up? Thinking of making rajma chawal this week.

Bhai sahab, if you're going to the market, can you please get me some fresh pudina? And maybe some dhaniya too? I want to make some green chutney. Also, get some lemons, they are always useful. Thanks a ton!
Sure thing, pudina, dhaniya, and lemons noted. Anything else? Maybe some mirchi for that teekha tadka? Or any specific brand of atta you prefer? I usually just grab the one that's on sale.

Arre, mirchi toh definitely! The spicier, the better! As for atta, Sharbati if they have it, otherwise the regular one is fine. Oh, and if you see good baingan, grab a couple. Baingan bharta sounds good.
Done and done! Baingan, mirchi, and Sharbati atta (if available). Anything for a good baingan bharta. I'll head out in an hour or so. Anything else before I leave? Let me know quickly.
बस, nothing else I can think of right now. Thanks a lot! Be careful while going, the traffic is usually crazy at this time. And try to bargain a bit with the sabziwala, okay? Dhanyavaad!
Oye sunn, remember college days? I was thinking, let's plan a road trip! It's been ages since we all chilled together. Dev here, by the way. Where should we go? Any suggestions, guys?
Dev bhai! Road trip? Solid plan! I'm in. Goa maybe? Or something more adventurous, like Spiti Valley? Depends on when we're going and how much time we have. What's the budget looking like?
Budget dekhenge yaar, pehle decide toh karo kahaan jaana hai. Goa is always a safe bet, but Spiti is tempting. Maybe something in between? We can aim for a long weekend type thing, like 4-5 days max.
Okay, 4-5 days... That rules out Spiti, I think. How about Rajasthan? Jaipur, Udaipur, Jodhpur circuit? We can drive, eat amazing food, and see some history. Plus, it's relatively close for everyone.

Rajasthan sounds amazing! Good call. We can even hire a tempo traveller for more space and less driving stress. Let's check everyone's availability and then book accommodation and finalize the route. Who's in for Rajasthan?

Rajasthan it is! I'm definitely in. Let me check with the others in our group chat. Will get back to you by tonight with everyone's availability. Start looking at hotels and things to do, Dev bhai! Exciting!
Accha suno, I have a date tonight. Rooftop restaurant, you know? I'm so confused about what to wear. Something fancy but not too much, right? Help me decide yaar, my wardrobe is a mess right now.

Oye! Rooftop, nice! Don't stress, just be yourself. Maybe a flowy midi dress? Something that moves in the breeze. Or those wide-legged pants with a cute top? Depends on the vibe you're going for, totally.
Midi dress is a good idea! But which one? I have that floral one, but is it too summery? And the black one is too formal maybe? Arre yaar, this is so much pressure for a simple dinner.

Floral is fine! It's romantic. Just add a denim jacket if it gets chilly. Or the black one with some colourful jewellery? Make it pop! Trust me, confidence is the best accessory, wear what makes you feel good.
Okay, okay, floral it is! Denim jacket bhi thik rahega. Now, shoes... flats or heels? I don't want to look like I'm trying too hard, but I also want to look nice. What do you think, guru?

Flats! Definitely flats! You don’t want to be hobbling around on a rooftop. Some cute sandals or even those stylish sneakers would be perfect. Comfort is key, and you'll be able to enjoy the evening more. All the best!
Oye, kya scene hai? Long time no see, yaar. Woh jo tera dost hai, uske baare mein kya khabar hai? Last time mila tha toh kuch ajeeb vibes aa rahi thi usse.
Haan bhai, mat pooch. ka toh alag hi drama chal raha hai. I think uski dosti thodi toxic ho gayi hai. Har baat mein comparison aur negativity. Dimag kharab ho gaya hai mera.
Arey yaar, aisa kya kar raha hai woh? Humne toh socha tha ki woh banda supportive hai. Kya hua exactly? Bata toh sahi, tension mat le. We're here for you, always.
Yaar, har cheez mein apni hi sunata hai. Meri success se jalan hoti hai shayad. Ab toh aisa lagta hai ki woh meri khushi mein khush nahi hai. Bas apni hi problems lekar aata hai.
Dekh, aise doston se dur rehna hi better hai. Zindagi mein positive log chahiye, negativity failane wale nahi. Maybe it's time to re-evaluate your friendship with him. Kya bolta hai?

Tu sahi bol raha hai bhai. I think I need to have a serious talk with him or maybe just distance myself. It's exhausting dealing with his negativity all the time. Thanks for listening, yaar. Dil halka ho gaya.
Oye, suna kya? This time Ganesh Chaturthi ka pandal apne area mein, Karan organise kar raha hai. Last year toh sab kuch ajeeb tha, no proper arrangements. Usko kya idea hai, music wala kya karega?

Arre, bhai, underestimate mat karo. Karan is quite resourceful. He's got contacts, and he knows how to get things done. Plus, being a musician, the music and cultural programs toh solid hi honge, dekhna.
Haan, music toh sahi hai. But, pandal ka setup, security, aur woh endless line for prasad? Woh sab manage karna is a different ballgame, yaar. I hope he has a good team to help him out.

Heard he’s roped in Sharma uncle from the society. Sharma uncle has connections with the local police and municipality. So, permissions and security toh sorted lag raha hai. Prasad ka line bhi manage ho jayega.
Chalo, that's a relief. Sharma uncle is a pro. But I hope Karan doesn't go overboard with the DJ and all. It should be devotional, not a Bollywood concert. Ganesh ji ko bura lagega.

Arre chill maar. Karan knows his audience. He'll probably mix some devotional songs with some subtle Bollywood beats. Thoda modern, thoda traditional. Let's just hope for the best and enjoy the festival!
Oye, sun na, yeh visa ka kya scene hai? I'm so stressed, yaar. US visa appointment mil hi nahi rahi. Kab tak wait karna padega, samajh nahi aa raha. Flights bhi book kar li hain maine. Ab kya hoga?

Arre tension mat le bhai. Sabka same haal hai. Embassy mein backlog bahut zyada hai. Try kar, continuously check karte reh portal. Koi na koi slot toh mil hi jayega. Maine bhi aise hi kiya tha. Patience rakh, ho jayega.

Patience toh khatam ho rahi hai, dost. Shaadi attend karni hai cousin ki. Flights cancel karani padengi agar visa nahi mila toh. Kitna loss hoga pata hai? Aur sabse badi baat, family kya sochegi. I am seriously worried.

Dekh, ek aur jugaad hai. Agent se baat kar, thoda extra charge karenge lekin shayad woh log jaldi appointment dila sakte hain. Risky hai but worth a try if you are really in a hurry. But verify the agent's credentials first, okay?

Haan, agent ka option toh hai but dar lagta hai fraud se. Agar paise lekar bhaag gaya toh? Phir toh main aur bhi phas jaunga. I think I'll just keep refreshing the website every hour. Thanks for the idea though.

Exactly! Better safe than sorry. Website refresh karte reh. Aur, dua kar bhai. Bhagwan sab thik karenge. Chill maar, zyada stress lega toh aur problem hogi. Let's grab some chai, dimag thoda shant ho jayega.

Oye, sunn, I'm thinking of taking her to this bookstore cafe for our date. It's got that old-school charm, you know? Plus, she's a total bookworm. Do you think it's too cheesy or is it actually a good idea?

Arre bhai, bookstore cafe sounds perfect! It's way better than the usual crowded CCD. Plus, you can casually discuss books, show off your intellectual side. Just make sure the coffee is good, warna mood kharab ho jayega.

Yeah, that's what I was thinking. I've heard their cold coffee is killer. And they have these little nooks where we can just chill. I'm hoping it'll be less pressure than a fancy restaurant. Wish me luck!
All the best, dost! Just remember to be yourself and listen more than you talk. Aur haan, maybe pick out a book beforehand so you have something to discuss if the conversation lags. Keep me posted!

Solid advice! I was actually eyeing this old copy of 'Midnight's Children'. Thought it would be a good conversation starter. Hopefully, she'll be impressed by my 'literature' knowledge. Fingers crossed!

Wah wah, 'Midnight's Children'! Full marks for effort. Just don't overdo the intellectual bit, okay? Keep it casual, keep it fun. And most importantly, enjoy the date. Good luck, you got this, mere bhai!
Oye, aur sunao. How's life treating you in Bangalore? Itna door ho gaya hai, feels like forever since we last grabbed chai at Sharma ji's tapri. Everything okay, na?
Sab theek hai bhai. Bangalore is good, work is hectic as usual. But yeah, I miss our chai sessions too. Virtual hugs only, I guess. How's everything back home? Koi nayi gossip hai kya?
Gossip toh full on hai! Remember Priya? She's getting married! And guess what? Rohit finally cleared his UPSC exam. Life's happening here, bas you're missing all the fun. Long distance is a pain, no?
Tell me about it! Shaadi mein toh I'll try my best to come. UPSC cleared? That's awesome! Proud of him. Yeah, this long distance sucks, but career bhi toh important hai, right? Video call karein kya?
Career is important, definitely. But yaar, dost bhi toh family hote hai. Video call is a great idea! I'll tell everyone to join. Let's plan it for this weekend, pakka. Miss you loads, bhai.
Miss you too, buddy! Weekend pakka. Let's make it a proper reunion, even if it's virtual. I'll bring my Bangalore coffee, you bring Sharma ji ki chai. Deal? Looking forward to it!
Accha suno, PTM ka kya scene hai? Date sheet toh aa gayi, lekin preparation kitni hui hai iska kuch idea nahi. Last time toh bol rahi thi sab aata hai, phir marks dekh ke chakkar aa gaye the mujhe.
Haan, woh toh hai. I was thinking, let's go through all the subjects together this weekend? Maybe a quick revision session. Aur phir, PTM mein directly teacher se pooch lenge, real picture kya hai.

Weekend toh theek hai, lekin sirf revision se kaam nahi chalega. Unko bol, thoda aur pressure daale. Especially maths aur science mein. Padhai ke time pe phone nahi chalna chahiye, woh bhi bolna padega.
Okay, okay, calm down. I'll handle it. Pehle hum weekend pe ek saath baithte hain, dekhte hain kya level hai. Phir PTM mein, I'll talk to the teachers accordingly. Don't worry too much, ho jayega.

Theek hai, lekin mujhe promise karo ki tum teachers se sab kuch openly poochhogi. Koi bhi cheez chhupani nahi hai. Aur agar extra classes ki zaroorat hai, toh woh bhi book karwa lena. Marks improve hone chahiye.
Haan baba, promise! I'll ask everything. Extra classes ka bhi dekh lenge. Abhi chill karo, weekend pe plan banate hain. Aur haan, phone ka issue bhi main dekh lungi. Trust me, I've got this.
Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Ghar pe sab theek toh hai na? Last time jab mile the, you looked a bit stressed. Koi naya drama toh nahi hua?
Yaar, kya batau. Mummyji is still on about my shaadi. Every rishta aunty in the city seems to have my number. Papa wants me to focus on my career, but you know how it is.

Arre, I totally get it. Same pinch! My parents are also after my life about settling down. They don't understand the struggle of finding someone who gets you, you know? It's not like choosing a chai stall.
Exactly! And then there's my younger brother. He's decided to become a DJ. Mummyji thinks he's wasting his life. I'm stuck in the middle, trying to mediate between them both. It's exhausting.

Uff, family dynamics, man! It's always something. My sister eloped last year. Now my parents are super cautious about everything I do. They treat me like I'm going to disappear overnight too. Let’s grab chai, maybe that'll help?

Chai sounds amazing! Aur batao, let's vent it out. Maybe we can brainstorm some escape plans… or at least figure out how to survive the next family gathering. Chal, let's go to that new tapri near the metro.

Accha suno, I'm thinking of planning a surprise dinner for him. Varanasi mein, on the ghats. There's this cute little cafe right by the river, super romantic vibes. What do you think? Should I go for it, or is it too cheesy?

Arre wah, that sounds amazing! Varanasi ghats are so beautiful, especially at night. Not cheesy at all! Which cafe are you talking about? Make sure you book in advance, those places get crowded, especially if it's a weekend. Lights and Ganga Aarti view, perfect!

Exactly! I was thinking of the one near Assi Ghat. It's got fairy lights and everything. Booking toh I'll do ASAP. Now, what should I wear? Something traditional or more modern? I'm so confused. I want to look nice but also feel comfortable, you know?

Hmm, maybe something flowy and Indo-western? A long kurta with palazzos, or even a simple saree would look stunning. Keep it light and breezy, given the weather. And don't forget some jhumkas! What about the gift? Kuch socha hai?

Good idea with the kurta! And yes, jhumkas are a must. Gift-wise, I was thinking of getting him that book he's been wanting. Or maybe a personalized photo frame with our pictures? I'm so bad at gift-giving; I always overthink it.

Photo frame is a sweet idea! But the book seems more thoughtful, especially if he really wants it. Just write a nice message inside. And remember, the most important thing is the experience and spending quality time together. Varanasi ghats will do the magic!

Accha suno, Chennai weather ka kya scene hai? Aaj kal toh lagta hai monsoon apni marzi se aata hai, jaise koi Bollywood star late pahunchta hai set pe. Kabhi dhoop, kabhi baarish – bilkul unpredictable!

Haan yaar, sahi kaha tumne! Idhar bhi same haal hai. Subah dekho toh aise lagta hai jaise summer vacation chal raha hai, aur dopahar tak baarish shuru. Office aane mein itni dikkat hoti hai, kya bataun!

Arre, mujhe toh yaad hai last year ek friend ki shaadi thi, aur mandap mein hi baarish shuru ho gayi. Pandit ji bhi bhag gaye! Phir baad mein sab log dance karne lage baarish mein. Aisa lag raha tha jaise koi movie shoot chal raha hai.

Hahaha, yeh toh kamaal ho gaya! Chennai rains aur drama, dono saath saath. Waise, mere ghar ke paas ek nala hai, thoda sa baarish hota hai aur woh overflow ho jaata hai. Phir toh boat race shuru ho jaati hai, literally!

Bilkul sahi! Aur roads pe potholes aise ban jaate hain jaise moon pe craters. Meri scooter toh aise jump karti hai jaise bungee jumping kar rahi ho. Bhai sahab, Chennai rains are something else, I tell you!

Haan yaar, sach mein. Lekin phir bhi, chai aur pakode ka maza baarish mein hi aata hai, hai na? Aur woh filter coffee... Aisa lagta hai jaise life set hai. Chennai monsoon, pyaar bhi hai aur problem bhi!

Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Bade din baad dikha. Sab theek toh hai na? Office mein pressure wagarah toh nahi? I was thinking if you are free, we could catch up for chai. I need to discuss something important.

Haan bhai, sab theek hai. Bas thoda financial tension chal raha hai. You know, EMI aur ghar ke kharche...upar se yeh inflation. Chai pe toh chalte hai, maybe you have some solutions? Bata kya karna hai.

Inflation toh sabko maar raha hai, yaar. I was also thinking about investments, but market ka haal dekh ke darr lagta hai. Maybe we should consult someone? Ya phir thoda savings plan banaye? What do you think?
Savings plan is a good idea, but problem yeh hai ki bachta hi kya hai? Salary aate hi sab udhar chala jata hai. Mutual funds ka kya scene hai? Safe rahega ya woh bhi risky hai? Thoda guide kar.

Mutual funds mein SIP kar sakte hai, thoda thoda investment. It's less risky than lump sum. I have been doing it for a while. Returns bhi decent hai. We can research together. Don't worry, bhai, milke nikaal lenge koi solution.
Okay, cool. Let's meet for chai then. We can discuss the SIP thing in detail. Upar se, I need to borrow some money from you. I will return it next month, promise. I am a little short this time.
Accha suno, have you guys seen the new releases? So many movies are out right now, I'm completely confused about which one to watch first. Koi recommendation hai kya?
Yaar, same pinch! I've been seeing trailers everywhere. Heard 'Fighter' is getting good reviews, but 'HanuMan' is also supposed to be a good watch. Depends on what mood you're in, I guess.
True that. Fighter is more like action-packed, right? And HanuMan is like, devotional-superhero vibes? I'm leaning towards something lighter, maybe a rom-com if there's any good one playing.
Then check out 'Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya'! It's got Shahid Kapoor and Kriti Sanon. Lighthearted and fun, perfect for a relaxed evening. Plus, the songs are pretty catchy too, you know.
Oh, that one! I saw the trailer. Robot love story, right? Sounds kinda different. Okay, I'll check it out. What about the other big releases? Anything worth braving the weekend crowd for?

Honestly, unless you're a huge action fan, maybe skip Fighter for now. HanuMan is decent if you're into that genre, but Teri Baaton Mein seems like the safest bet for a good time. Let me know what you think!
Bro, abhi main seriously soch raha hoon about career switch. Roz wahi routine, mann nahi lagta. Life mein kuch naya karna chahiye na? Thoda darr lagta hai lekin excitement bhi hai.

Bhai, darr aur excitement dono ka mixture hi growth ke liye perfect hai. Jab tak risk nahi lega, kabhi naya chapter nahi shuru hoga. Dheere dheere plan kar, overthink mat kar. Ek step le, fir dekh confidence kaise aata hai.
Haan tu sahi bolta hai. Main soch raha hoon ki proper plan banau aur kisi mentor se guidance le lu. Apne comfort zone ke bahar nikalna easy nahi hai, but maybe wahi asli jeet ka raasta hai.

Bilkul bhai, comfort zone se nikalna hi asli courage hai. Jab tu apne goals ko clearly define karega, toh path bhi dikhne lagega. Aur ek mentor mil gaya toh journey aur smooth ho jaayegi. Full support bro!
Sahi pakde! Main aaj raat ko baith ke apna pehla action plan likhne wala hoon. Chhoti chhoti cheezon se start karunga. Thoda time lagega but ab serious ho gaya hoon apne dreams ko leke.

Bas wahi spirit chahiye bro! Dreams ko sirf sochna nahi, chase karna padta hai. Chhoti progress bhi celebrate kar, har step important hai. Proud of you already, aur jab bhi lage low feel kar raha hai, mujhe ping kar dena. Always here for you!
